column6: This is my first ever yelp review and this place is the only reason I wanted to write one. We got two drinks, and order of the curry puffs, which we totally had to get another order of. The best staff, amazing ambiance, and the music really impressed me. Me and my friend felt totally welcomed and comfortable the whole time and decided it's an absolute return. The staff also brought out an order of chive dumplings on the house. Love you guys so much. Truly a sweet staff
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was great, service was good and the atmosphere was amazing. Would definitely recommend and revisit this spot again. Friday night around 6pm for a group of 5 and we were seated right away without reservations.
No comment
No comment
Cool vibe, it's a nice social place to hang out and get some unique cocktails with some delightfully spicy food.

I really wanted to like this place. Its a  cool space and decorated well. The food was ok/good but a little on the pricey side for what it was. But by far it was the most uncomfortable dining experience  I think I have ever had. My back, literally hurts from trying to position myself to eat the food in the peculiar dining set up they have. The chairs a very small, and not set up very well with tables. I had very little legroom, and I am pretty short myself.  My friends were miserable because we couldn't relax and enjoy themselves.

Wanted to love this place but don't want to eat grandma's hair in my larb either. Esan sausage doesn't have the sourness that it should have. Khao kieb pak mor is ok but the coconut milk topping to be unpleasant. I've been to the restaurant and have tried other menu items. Food is on the sweeter sweeter side and Overall disappointed.
No comment

Food was ok but service was even worse. Had a birthday dinner with a large party and the host took my bottle of rum which was a birthday gift. We had no intention of opening the bottle and was going to put away since we understood that no alcoholic beverages were allowed. Staff was rude and shouldn't be in the hospitality business with that type of attitude. My friends and I had such a horrific experience and NEVER going back. There's many other places worth going to with good service.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Every single seat in this place is no higher than 16 inches off the ground. It's like they raided a kindergarten classroom when they set up the place. I was looking forward to trying the food here, but we left immediately after the server informed us there were no seating alternatives even remotely comfortable for fully-grown adults. I don't know anyone who wants to eat curry in a dark, dirty room in the fetal position. Another commenter described the place as "Chuck E Cheese for hipsters" and that nails it. Bushwick deserves better.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Awesome atmosphere... A really cool casual spot to go to if you're looking for something different environment wise. Food is decently priced and drinks are really good.
No comment
Walked in, saw a mess in the entryway (looked like a swap meet) walked right out. They were ready to seat us as if this was normal
No comment

Good food. Try the fried chicken laab. The dumplings were also and should travel well if you want to order in. The inside vibe is not for everyone. Seats are low to the ground. "Tables" are coffee table height. Staff is accomodating and kindly offers recommendation. No cell service downstairs so bring cash or check out experience can be a bit clunky with Venmo payment.
No comment

Great vibes, good drinks and yummy food. The dishes were extremely spicy even when we had it at medium spice.  But good vibes everywhere. Love the aesthetic of the inside and loved how there's places to sit downstairs AND upstairs.

Came here for a comedy show and was pleasantly surprised to find a place like maomao in the area. The decor is super cool and truly reminds me of street eating in Thailand. I ordered the Chinese style roast pork and my friend ordered the fried chicken laab. My dish was good but I would've liked to see a bit more protein. The laab was a bit too spicy for me. Overall a very cool spot to hang out.
The music was so loud it was hard to enjoy anything because our ears were ringing! The food was just okay, the service was very friendly though. I do not recommend the girlfriend cocktail.

Came here on a Sunday night and the ambience was so awesome. Nicely themed with a vintage Thai cinema vibe, the food, drinks, and friendly staff really made my last night in Brooklyn memorable. I would recommend coming here to start your night off with some great food and cocktails. Definitely coming back the next time I'm in town
No comment

This is some of the worst Thai food I've had in NYC. Extremely disappointing. I'd give the food 1 star but it gets 2 because of the atmosphere and because I was able get drunk during dinner since the service wasn't bad. We shared the larb, and papaya salad, it was all meh. My entree was the bamee moo dang which was some plain ass noodles with pork on them, minimal sauce drizzle. I would expect this type of food from a budget mall place in Flushing but not for this price. I will not go back. Do your self a favor and go to Zaab Zaab if you want authentic Thai cuisine.
No comment

I LOVE This spot!! I live down the street and honestly street food from Thailand and the vibes are on point, come here and you're transformed into another universe.  I don't even want to write a review because they might get too popular lol but honestly I love them and they deserve all the praise!!!!
super cool place and vibe! the drinks were unique and excellent and the massaman curry was delicious

Came here twice already and it's never a disappointment. When you're here, you must order their bar food items. The portion is very small so order a few if you have to. Remember the rule is "eat, drink, eat, and drink," that's what our server told us atleast. They have interesting name for their medicinal drinks as well, when you're here order some. It was told that the herbs were imported from Thailand. And yes they do have craft beer here as well. Definitely would recommend coming here!!!

I woke up to find my self in a hole in the wall restaurant in Bangkok, Thailand. No wait, surprisingly it was in Brooklyn. This place has it all. Inspired by vintage cinema, the restaurant/bar has a movie theater set up with seats and all. Vintage Thai movies are playing in the background as you enjoy Thai beers, sake/soju infused cocktails, or some wine. I came here with a party of 4 and was sat at a table within 5 min (the only thing good about covid is that awesome undervalued places aren't too crowded on a Saturday night). I instantly fell in love with the aesthetics and vibe. We ordered some of the cocktails. My wife got the perfect husband (hopefully not a jab at me), while I went with a Leo (Thai) beer. Hoping they serve Chang and Singha soon! While combing through the menu i started noticing dishes I hadn't seen in a Thai restaurant (within Brooklyn) in a long time. Legit authentic dishes ranging from Kao Mahn Gai (hainanese style chicken and rice) to ba mee moo dang (roast pork style noodle soup). I was in heaven. Feeling nostalgic about my dozen visits back to my home country, this brought back wonderful memories. I ordered the chicken and rice instantly and my wife tried the seafood laab. Everything was amazing. Not sure if they just hired the chef straight from Thailand, but it was every bit what I remembered. Also the price was a steal for the area with dishes ranging from $12-$20. I will be back 100% and recommend this place to anyone in NYC or visiting.
No comment
Came here twice for the vibes, snacks, and drinks. I wouldn't come here for dinner food as much

Really yummy food - no frills - but So Tasty!! Staff was very attentive. The space was very cool & music a little funky & fun. Vibe & crowd was chill. Would go back again if around the neighborhood & would recommend.

A true culinary gem! The food is behind and its one of a kind atmosphere almost makes you forget you're in the United States. Back to my point, the food is delicious, you just need to try every item on the menu, what we like to do is order a few appetizers to share and then of course entrees. Perfect place to drink and hang out with friends. I love the vintage Thai films playing on the big screen. We loooove this place!

Been wanting to try for awhile. Trying to try all the local places near my apt. Anyways the place was cute. I was alone and got seated in an old movie seat facing the screen. Then I saw people eating on TINY PAPER PLATES AND PLASTIC FORKS !!! I was like for these prices which are high I can imagine what kind of portions they serve. They were small of course. I had some kind of chicken wings which were good but served in a plastic cup!! So weird. I got a tiny cup of water. I even asked why are they serving this in plastic making more trash for landfills? Didn't get a good answer. The main dish was Almost 20 bucks. It was not even hot. Kinda warmish. Idk what Eater and Infatuation NYC saw in this place. My knees were killing me and so was my back when I got up. I had a slender bench to eat on and had to hold my plate under my chin to eat. The music was SOOO LOUD and annoying I wanted to get out fast. I left hungry and pissed. Also CASH ONLY of course. I had to VENMO to pay. Annoying. Place was filled with the typical annoying white Bushwick types. Anyways. I shoulda gone with my gut and PASSED ON THIS ONE.
No comment

The most fun restaurant experience I've had in NY in years, from start to finish! The hostess was giving serious Main Character energy and I was living for it. Their style was spectacular. The decor was fun, the music a deLight, and the projected movie a visual joy. The food was amazing!! It was definitely loud and crowded so not great for an intimate catch up but great for a night out with friends. 10/10, would recommend.

Love this place...a gem in New York, beautiful ambiance and amazing family who runs it (they started the restaurant during the pandemic). It has a feel of being in Thailand with the Thai cinema and Thai pantry. All the dishes are authentic street food and more (no Pad Thai on the menu, and that's a good thing because it'll challenge you to try something different). I had the pik gai zapp (fried chicken dish) and the tom yum goong soup (lemongrass broth). Warning: The soup is on the spicier side. Everything is an incredible price for what you get, especially for New York.
Great place to bring a date or group of friends. Our server was wonderful and gave us good recommendations.
No comment
The best chicken wings I have ever had. Highly recommend. Not boring. Spicy in every way.
Really lovely authentic (at least to the extent that I'm aware) Thai fare with an incredibly unique energy! The interior is designed to look like a theater, and the vibes are amazing for dinners.
No comment

Honestly the decor and vibe is super cool. I really wanted to love this place but the food just wasn't great. Everything was okay, good, but not "I need to take my friends here" good. Which was a bummer. The flavors were underwhelming and spice wasn't strong. We ordered about 6 different things, so we did try, but it just wasn't our place. On to find the next "spot"!

Love the old school/vintage Thai decor. The food and alcoholic beverages are just as amazing. A little on the pricey side but definitely justified because of the amazing quality. I can't wait for indoor dining to be open back up so I can come back.
Such a great experience at American Brass! They went above and beyond for my birthday and the food was delish!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Been to this place a couple of times--the first time was for a sit down dinner and the second time was for some oysters at the bar. Both experiences were lovely! When we came for dinner, we had the East Coast oysters and the steak tartare, and both were lovely. All the food we had was pretty rich and filling, and we definitely stuffed ourselves then! I also love oysters and the oysters here are pretty good. Since I live nearby, this place is great if I'm randomly craving them in a pinch. The lighting and ambiance are also both great. I'd recommend visiting American Brass if you're looking for a slightly nicer meal!

We had the worst experience at this place we went to celebrate a birthday. We made a reservation for 830pm when we got there we were told to wait a few minutes. After nearly 40 mins we were seated. Nobody came to take our order for another 30 mins, at which point we had lost our appetite it was close to 1040 pm when we finally got our food. The food was mediocre at best.
No comment
No comment

Had dinner tonight with our kids and it was amazing. We had the burger, short rib pasta, focaccia bread, fries, salmon tartare, and the kids pasta. Everything was amazing. We also tried a few of the deserts and everyone wolfed them down. I want to call out the fact too that the staff was amazing with the kids, super friendly with them, the kids had fun the whole time. Plus the food all came quick which is great for the kiddos. As always we love the food here and the location right on Center.
No comment
This is my favorite restaurant in LIC. Food and drinks are amazing, and prices are in line with food quality. Please don't change anything, we love this place!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Visited tonight for my husbands birthday, which was noted on the reservation. The food was excellent although the portions were a little small. They seemed really understaffed and it took a bit for the food to come out, which was honestly fine because we were enjoying the nice night. A little disappointed they didn't put a candle on the dessert since we noted on the reservation we were celebrating a birthday (not asking for a freebie by any means, but a candle would have been a nice touch).
No comment

Finally came here for brunch after living my dinner experiences and they did not disappoint. I wanted everything on their menu! The pastry basket was delicious and warm with a great variety! The the main course we got the burger and fried chicken sandwich. One of the juiciest burgers I've had! So good. And the fried chicken sandwich seemed to be very popular so we gave it a try and it did not disappoint! If you're in or around LIC and in the mood for high quality American food, go here!

I have not stopped talking about American Brass since we ate here 2 weeks ago. I have already recommended it to all my local friends. My fiancé and I came because of the reviews and we were not disappointed. We were feeling adventurous and decided to order the 'Dinner for 2.' The Chef curated a menu for us and it included some fantastic wine. We had the Focaccia, the steak tartare, cavatelli, the duck and the Waygu steak frites. My mouth is watering as I think about it. The ambiance, service and cuisine was wonderful. We will definitely be back!
No comment
No comment

I had such a wonderful experience at American Brass last night. When making the reservation, I noted that the occasion was for a birthday and they went above and beyond from there. My menu was personalized with HBD wishes, the table was decorated, we received a complimentary birthday dessert + little dessert bites to go, and they topped it all off with a beautiful red rose as we were departing. On top of this special treatment, our entire wait staff was fantastic. Extremely attentive, warm, and friendly. Our waitress completely sold me with her description of the Atlantic cod dish (which was scrumptious), and my boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed the ricotta cavatelli. Finally, the ambiance was perfect with comfortable seating, stunning views of the city skyline, and great background music. I 1000% recommend American Brass.
No comment

The ambience was elegant and classic and the brunch was delicious. I highly recommend the avocado toast, which is avocado mousse topped with sweet gooseberries, pickled onions, and crunchy radish slices. The bread basket, dry aged burger, and hash browns rendered in duck fat were all outstanding. The homage carrot cake was phenomenal and ended the meal with my taste buds just dancing in delight! Great service and right on the water with a view of Manhattan.

Went here for a friends bday brunch and they did more than I've seen for a bday. They had a bday menu, a rose, and a sign. In addition, they all said "happy bday" to my friend. Anyway, the food was great, everything is house made..everything. The bread, the jams, the ricotta, everything.
No comment

Such a surprisingly delightful meal! I looked up the menu before dining here and I was excited, but I was blown away by the quality and taste of the food. I came with a large party of 16 and the service was fantastic. We tried nearly everything on the menu and nothing disappointed. Some true standouts were the seafood tower, Caesar salad, crispy calamari, mushroom tagliatelle and carrot cake. It was perfect for a large party and the food and drinks did not disappoint - will definitely be coming back!

Amazing service! I have been to American Brass many times and I must say the service is ALWAYS on point. The food never disappoints and is always fresh. There is never anything fishy about the seafood, it's fresh, and delicious. My waiter Nok is always so amazing and never misses a beat. This is definitely a go to place that never disappoints. If you're in the neighborhood I suggest coming in and then going for a walk by the water, which is beautiful.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here last fall for lunch w a bestie & was my first time at AB. Wow what a treat..the food  was delicious, service was super attentive & location is just beautiful. A definite must try when in LIC, I will def come back!
Beautiful meal in a sort of suburbia styled restaurant. Definitely not up to snuff decor or ambience wise but the food was amazing so kind-of who cares about the decor. Definitely a must try.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Views, food and cocktails!  Wanting a restaurant with water views, we chose to come to American Brass for the first time for brunch.  The views are amazing and so is the food!!!  We both enjoyed the Salmon Benedict.  The eggs were perfectly poached and we enjoyed the twist - hash browns as the base.  We'd love to try more dishes and return for dinner.
No comment
No comment

Just celebrated my husbands 31st birthday with 11 family members and friends. From the moment we walked in, the customer service was warm and genuine. They quickly greeted our 2 year old son with a balloon and a toy car. Liz came over not too long after we sat, and personally wished my husband a happy birthday and thanked him for celebrating it there. The setting and mood was so extremely chill that we didn't realize we all sat talking to one another about an hour and a half AFTER WE FINISHED DINNER! We stayed until about 10:30 (they closed at 11) but were not rushed to leave or felt like they were pushing us out. We ordered appetizers, multiple drinks per person, entrees and dessert and the bill per person was less than 120. While leaving, Liz stopped us again and gave our son another toy car. This was an absolutely great family dinner experience and I cannot wait to go back when the weather is warmer to enjoy their outdoor dining. Also - croquets and wagyu was DELICIOUS!!!
No comment
When I say I have nothing negative to say about this place I mean it. Best steak I've ever had. I'm pretty turnt so I'll keep it short. Eat here and order the porterhouse for 2
Great place for Brunch, Jazz night, dinner with a waterrront city view.  Staff is great and attentive. Great place to host a party!
No comment

This is hands down the best restaurant in LIC. I loved everything I ate here. Before I get into the food, I have to say the restaurant itself has amazing ambience and you can see the waterfront from outside or inside the restaurant. The drinks were really great too and they had one of the best martinis I've ever tried. The food was fantastic, the oysters were fresh and meaty. We also got the focaccia with whipped ricotta and it was amazing it was so fresh and it is a must when coming here. The steak tartare was amazing with perfect melt in your mouth texture and without any ridiculous dressing. The hamachi was delicious as well but the steak frites was out of this world. Very tender and delicious. I will definitely be coming back and it is a great date night spot!
No comment
No comment
I love this place. From the ambiance, to the attentive welcoming service, and most importantly the food and desserts which are always amazing. This is a gem of a restaurant.
No comment
Went here with friends for brunch. Loved the ambience, it was very chic with a beautiful view. Service was great too. Highly recommend the the fried chicken sandwich and french toast!!

Writing a quick review to say Liz, the manager, is amazing. She is kind, hospitable, on her game, and welcomes EACH guest with enthusiasm and a smile. I come here once a week, live in the neighborhood, and she's the reason (along with the fries) that I come back every week ;) Don't hesitate to come in for brunch or dinner!

I recently had an opportunity to visit American Brass for brunch with some friends. Super easy to make a reservation on Open Table. We went in the midst of the awful July heat wave, but the outdoor area was pleasantly cool and well shaded, so we decided to dine outside. Our server and the various food runners kept our water glasses full the entire time. Our food was beautifully plated and exceptionally tasty, including the Belgian Waffle, East Coast Oysters, Avocado Toast, and Smoked Salmon Benedict (loved the potato pancake base for this!). One star off for the overpriced brunch cocktails (almost $20 for a mimosa, bloody mary or a spritz...you can do unlimited for $40), considering other brunch cocktails in the area are in the 10-12$ range.

We celebrated my husband's surprise 40th bday party at this place and it was phenomenal. Robert made the whole planning phase very painless. From the amazing food, great drinks, awesome decor and impeccable service, everyone had a great time. Can't say enough great words for American Brass and the entire team. Definitely recommend this place and looking forward to coming back soon. Thank you again!
No comment

I've dined at American Brass several times since 2021 and every time the food and dining experience have been great. The last time I ate here, I ordered the East & West coast oysters, Shrimp cocktail, and Cavatelli. Each dish was absolutely excellent. I've had shrimp cocktail from many different restaurants, but the shrimp cocktail from American brass is a cut above the rest. The shrimp are plump and flavorful - the gribiche and cocktail sauce are wonderful dipping sauces. This is a restaurant in Long Island City that I always recommend!
No comment

Quality food, well executed.  I had lettuce salad with shrimp.  It was well portioned and masterfully designed.  Fresh ingredients, variety of textures, and decadent shrimp.  I can't wait to go and have it again.  Bonus: AB is on open table, which makes planning a work lunch in midtown effective.

Such an excellent spot with great food. Love how you have the perfect water front view of Manhattan and one of the best drink selections I have seen. Servers are super friendly and do their best to remember you and treat you like family every time you come! One of my favorite spots and I come all the way from Long Island just to eat here. 10/10

American Brass has not disappointed me yet, every time  I dine in the food and service is excellent! Dined today for Sunday Brunch and ordered the avo toast and it was delicious. I loved how creative the presentation was and the elements of gooseberry, Brussel sprouts and pickled red onions. It is pricey for the portion size, however taste excellent. My husband ordered the bacon jam cheeseburger and didn't really care for it. (I think he didn't like the bacon jam, however I thought it was great). The hot toddy, Irish coffee, cranberry mimosa, beer and apple tarte were all amazing and I highly suggest!!

Had a wonderful evening here! The food was excellent. We particularly enjoyed the house made foccacia, the roast chicken and the squid ink seafood pasta. The service was warm and friendly. Delicious cocktails and a stunning view. Highly recommend!
An amazing place with great stuff, beautiful ambiance, and of course delicious food.
No comment
Beautiful restaurant in Long Island City with amazing view. Very classy and upscale place. Food presentation and taste very good just servers should me more attentive.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Service with smile, splendor & style‼ busy Sunday brunch, packed place, a niiice welcome by the hostess. My friend and I were escorted to a table by the window-woah-a-room with a view‼ Friendly and attentive service by Edwin, who was on top of his game. Water, coffee was kept an eye on for refills. Loved my Salmon Benedict  and my friend loved her bacon, egg n cheese on English muffin n truffle fries...Voila‼Pablo, the GM touched our table a few times to check if all was good? Hospitality defined‼ My first brunch today and def coming back w friends. Ambiance, food and service equates to success at the American Brass. Hats off! Ty Chef for a great brunch menu...! Kudos.

American Brass has been a favorite of mine since 2019 and each time it has only been better. My last visit at America Brass Liz made the experience unforgettable and solidified my love for American Brass. The new menu is to die for. For started the sourdough made in house is incredible and hands down one of the best sourdough I've had. The Hamachi crudo is explosive in flavor, fresh and melts in your mouth. The Cavtelli, lobster ravioli (will leave you asking for more!), roasted chicken and steak Wagu we have returned for several times. To pair with their delicious cocktails all of which Liz walked us through to make sure we had a wonderful pairing with our meals. On a separate occasion we had a delicious Sancerre which we highly recommend! And while I'm not big on dessert at American Brass it's a must have their long standing favorite Carrot cake is the best I've ever had and I love Carrot cake cake. Thank you Liz for taking our already favorite restaurant to the next level!
No comment

Food good, buy why add 20% tips to the bill? I just dont wan the fight for this, now restaurant still add tip to bill, that's cheating people, 15%-25% is up to customer, check your bill carefully folks, I guess they thou we're travelers, that's some restaurant do to some customer. Terrible terrible, double check your bill. For party of 4? We were there Saturday night 4 people, I never heard that any restaurant add tips for 4 ppl table, show your policy for 4 will add tips, I believe at least 8-10 of people then add what percentage have to show on front menu or let customers know it before. If you're owner not manager then should tell your waiter or waitress stop doing that.
Awesome staff. Great ambience. Food even better. Definitely recommended to people that are looking for a place to eat when in LIC.
No comment
Although I had to wait about 15 minutes before my server came to greet me, the food was great and the view of Manhattan across the water was spectacular, especially during dusk time.
No comment
No comment
gorgeous space, lovely ambiance, and truly stellar service. the food was great but, the desserts were the real stars.

A must go for anyone who enjoys curated dishes, amazing service and a welcoming atmosphere. The menu takes an elevated approach to classic American/global cuisine, and the environment is invitingly casual -- Perfect for intimate dates, family dinners or big celebrations. An epicurean delight to the LIC waterfront!
No comment

Amazing from start to finish. We came for our anniversary and there was a custom Anniversary menu and sign on our table when we arrived. I've been here three times, and although people say it's pricey it's worth every penny. I don't mind paying for excellent food and service. Everything I've had here is amazing. Cannot wait to come back!

Excellent food and service. The Branzino here is hard to beat! The food has so much flavor. It's portioned perfect too! I planned my husbands birthday here. From the time we walked in the staff was friendly, happy and courteous. Throughout the meal the service was impeccable. Everyone raved about their meal. I selected this restaurant for the party and was glad I did. It did not upset. The restaurant was clean, tables were spaced out and menu had something for everyone. Also the desserts weren't too big. What a treat! I'll be back for more. Ps...staff recommendations were excellent too. They even made us a personalized menu for his birthday
No comment
No comment
No comment

For someone who never leaves a review, I must say this restaurant deserves my first review. Went there for a birthday brunch and everything was amazing. From delicious food to over the top service (without being overwhelming). It's a place with modern ambience, great food (that little gem salad had us wanting more), and excellent service. Can't wait to visit again.
Came here post wedding proposal and the entire staff was on top of every detail and very welcoming! Food was great too - would highly highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment

From the outside the space is unassuming, but I saw the swings outside and decided me and my buddies should come in for a drink and then we met Camille. She was polite but personable and knew the food but what impressed us was her drinks and banter. We'll definitely be back to see her. You should too!
Came for brunch one August weekend and our experience was so much better! No longer understaffed, and the food was as good as before. We were seated outside and had a great time.

Consistently great service & amazing food. We've been here several times and it's always special. If Jose L is your server, you're in LUCK because he's an absolute gem. Perfect date night option, beautiful brunch vibes, and overall just a great choice. Thanks for being here in LIC!
No comment
No comment

Decent enough brunch. The primary dishes were good, drinks decent. One of the salads was way overpriced and plain, romaine with some light dressing for $17, literally a dish you could make easy for $2. Outside seating could be cleaned up, neglected planters giving it a rundown feel. Good service but fairly underwhelming for the price and supposed higher class presentation.
No comment
This is a great place has amazing food. I had the chicken sandwich and fries it was delicious. The staff is very kind. Outside seating with a beautiful view. Will definitely be coming back.

American Brass is the best experience. We've been coming for a couple of years. The view over the east river to Manhattan is fantastic, especially of seated outside. If you're inside try to get a window. The staff are super friendly and knowledgeable. My wife has a severe allergy to shellfish and they always accomodate. The food is incredible and I love their beer list, top quality. Killer cocktails and a fabulous wine list too, they've got it all. So glad they survived the pandemic. This is the perfect dining experience and/or casual drink and nibble while you're out walking the promenade.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cocktails, appetizers, white wine, oysters, red wine and steak.  We experienced everything they had to offer.  Great food, ambience, drinks and service

We just had an absolutely amazing experience at American Brass! The decor is incredible, very clean and bright and classy. From the moment you enter you will feel like you're in a high quality establishment. The service was fantastic! Every employee was attentive, neat, and polite. Liz was an absolute pleasure to meet and she was so nice to both my fiancé and I. You can tell she really loves what she does. The food was delicious. Next level. The pastry basket was a selection of warm, buttery and soft pastry breads with some whipped butter to accompany. When we tasted those, we knew the whole meal was going to be memorable. We ate the smoked salmon Benedict, done over a crispy potato pancake - phenomenal. We also had the Belgian waffle done with maple whipped cream and pecans and it was delicious. And we had the fried chicken sandwich - and now we know why that is such a popular menu item. All of the food was prepared to perfection, quickly, and plated very well! We tried some of the dessert cakes and they were absolutely great. The pastry chef (I'm sorry I don't remember if her name was Ellen or Helen), but regardless her high skill is very apparent through her work. This place should be on the top of everyone's list to visit for brunch, lunch or dinner! Not to mention, you're situated across the street from amazing city skyline views. We are looking forward to dinner there soon!!!

This was my first time going to American Brass and I will absolutely be back. The views from the restaurant overlooking the water were gorgeous and it's nice and spacious inside. We went for dinner on a Friday night and had the sourdough focaccia with whipped ricotta dip which was so delicious. We had east coast oysters and grilled octopus, both were really nice and fresh.  We also had the seafood risotto and dry aged burger and would definitely have both again. The seafood risotto was my favorite. The service was really great and I can't say enough about the staff. Every one of the staff were so nice and attentive. The servers were so kind and made sure we were well taken care of.

Mediocre food. Lovely service and great views. Beautifully designed restaurant. But the food was disappointing from the bread to the entree to the dessert. Wanted to love it but ended up disappointed.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food is good. Not too expensive. Place looks nice, right on the water. Taking a star away because of the San Pelegríno scam they're using. They offer sparkling water. They don't ask if you want sparkling or regular. They just ask if you want sparkling. Fine, I took the bait, it happens. But they charge $12 for it... no thanks, I'm not into that kind of game. Total scam. Not going back.

A gem of a restaurant in beautiful LIC. Have now been here for brunch, lunch, and dinner and have not been disappointed. The staff is always welcoming and the manager, Liz, is superb-she was so impressive, we had to get her name! Our favorites are the pancakes and chicken sandwich for brunch/lunch. Literally the best chicken sandwich we've ever had. For dinner, the burger and truffle fries. I know its very clichey but they have a phenomenal burger. Also, some excellent oysters and the cocktails never disappoint! And the restaurant itself is very nice, new and modern/trendy vibe. All around wonderful experience and we'll be back!

Loved the ambience, the lighting was perfect for dinner..The food was delicious (hope the pictures do some justice). This was my first time trying duck in the US and I loved it. The servers were very welcoming and the restaurant was neat. Definitely recommend this LIC restaurant.
No comment

Truly a magnificent experience each and every time I dine here. Service has only become more and more elevated with their new GM, Liz. The staff are professional and attentive, yet simultaneously not overly intrusive. Everything is so finely detailed - from the deliccciouss complimentary cheese gougeres to start off your meal, to replacing silverware between courses, wiping the crumbs, keeping an eye on your water glasses, and even personalized menus for special occasions - the service is just impeccable and makes you feel like a real VIP. Equally as impressive is the food - you can tell how much thought and care goes into each dish. Not only are the presentations beautiful, but the flavors and textures are so perfectly in balance with each other that it truly is a euphoric experience. The desserts, too, are nicely sized, not overly sweet, and offer a unique selection of comforting classics with their own Brass twist that really stand up to the food. Each time I come here, it is such a treat and always the best dinner I've had in a long time. Just ate dinner on Sunday night and already can't wait to find an excuse to come back again!
This is my second review for American brass. The first time was awful due to a horrible manager . This time the service was lovely and the food was great though  expensive. We will definitely return!

This place is top notch. Their food is amazingly delicious. Their service was outstanding. We had dinner in one of their beautiful greenhouses. Make sure you make a reservation ahead of time for the greenhouses. The greenhouse was cozy and warm and well cleaned. The views are amazing and Instagram worthy lol! But On a serious note we had the best time. Now the food... like I said delicious. We had their butternut squash soup, oysters, braised ribs, and steak frites! Wow!! Just wow. For dessert we had the trifle and the espresso mousse, Again delicious! We truly had an amazing time.

This is a long overdue but also recently well-deserved review of our experience at American Brass - I would count this as a double 5 stars. My fiancé and I had our engagement dinner here earlier in September and hosted ten people for a delicious pre-set dinner. My fiancé had done all of the planning with Liz and Robert for the surprise dinner; in his words, they were "extremely thoughtful, accommodating, and attentive" throughout the entire planning process and the night of. They did a truly wonderful job creating a personalized engagement dinner experience - they printed out our photos onto the personalized menus and also had our photos printed onto little packaged dessert blondies for folks to take home. Not to mention, the food alone was delicious. Now fast forward 3 months later, we decide to go back with a few family friends for dinner because, as I mentioned, the food,  ambiance, and service are fantastic. Everything was as remembered - delicious, timely, relaxed, convivial. At the end of the night, we were surprised by the most thoughtful gesture - a romantic goodie bag and a tray of blondies, including two packaged ones with our engagement pictures printed on! Liz came by as we were totally flabbergasted and mentioned she recognized us. I couldn't believe it and was just so touched by the thoughtfulness; and it truly made for another special memory at the restaurant. If anyone is thinking about coming here for a date night, an engagement dinner, rehearsal dinner, or any other special event, you can stop thinking and just do it, as the team here really does care about creating special (and delicious) memories for their guests.

We came here for dinner and we left VERY disappointed. The menu was limited and everything we ordered aside from the salad tasted VERY questionable. The steak did not taste like "steak" at all. It also came with this weird block of cold "butter" ( I wouldn't even call it butter but ok..) the fries were overly salted that you had to make sure you were also quenching your thirst at the same time. To wrap things up, service was also nonexistent. To say the least, the whole dish didn't make sense at all and wished we had ordered something else instead. Now on to the beverages, the so called "drinks" consisted of 2 sips since it was just filled with ice instead. Our bill was over $200 and no way was it worth it. This restaurant wasn't fine dining at all but they charge as if.
No comment

my sister called ahead to make a reservation for my moms birthday. didn't ask for anything except just indoor seating. when we arrived, there was a customized menu for my mom titled "happy birthday mom!" and a little happy birthday sign sitting on the table. immediately felt as if they truly care about their customers. the drinks tasted and looked lovely and the appetizers, especially the focaccia, were incredible with the whipped ricotta. the staff was extremely kind. after each course, the plates were changed and they even wiped off all the crumbs on the table. what i love about american brass is the little things they do to make you feel like you are truly at a high quality restaurant. lastly, you have to try the truffle mac and cheese. i've had many truffley meals and mac and cheese isn't a go to for me. BUT this was so damn good, i don't know how else to describe it but you know it isn't just truffle oil. the dessert was to die for, we got the salted caramel sundae and the peach galette. at the end, the waitress came back with complimentary blondies and a happy birthday sticker. 10000000% recommend. we'll be coming back in the future!
Beautiful place, beautiful people, delicious food. The burger is simply amazing! The views of the city are spectacular. I guess I liked it:)

This was my second time trying the restaurant and both times were pretty bad experiences. The service is sub par and we were rushed to order and finish our food (when it was 2.5 hours before closing and a reservation was made), the drinks on the menu do not match what they have available. They didn't have what we wanted as our first and second food options (for appetizers and meals) were not available and the food we received was barely warm and dry/overcooked. This was the second time trying and the price point doesn't match the quality of the food. High prices and food that is not that great would not recommend or go again.

We had a delicious dinner, celebrating my son's birthday.  From appetizers to dessert, everything was so good! If you stop by, ask to be seated in Andres' section, he provides great service and recommendations.

Visited this spot last night for our annual girls night Christmas dinner. We picked this restaurant this year randomly and we were all very happy. We all did the prefixe menu and the portions were insane. The market salad was a full entree size salad. The burger was out of this world amazing. The fries were so perfect and just so much! We all took home half our meals to save room for dessert, which was amazing as well. Will definitely be coming back here. Food was amazing and staff was so friendly and funny. Great atmosphere... greenhouse are just a bit chilly On a super chilly day!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Wow! The food here is legit. I'm not surprised they got a Michelin star! Creative menu along with the excellent service makes this my go to spot! Camille the bartender, was everything you'd want in a sever: she's attractive, has a great memory and friendly. Don't walk, but run there!

This spot is cool, modern, with a beautiful view of the East River and the beauty of Center Blvd. Calamari was perfect! Recommendation: Sit at the bar but if late in the evening don't come hungry- Kitchen closes at 9- thankfully Camille made up for it with perfect pour, service & care.

Situated right on the waterfront in LIC, American Brass's food is as fabulous as it's views. The cinnamon bun is a stand out part of the menu, but classic brunch staples are reliable and delicious. They've set up individual huts for optimal dining experiences in the Covid era. Will definitely be back for more meals.
Food is actually good!!! Pricey but worth it!!! Is nice for a family dinner or friends getting together!!!
No comment

I had the best tasting short rib here. I unfortunately got it raw the first time and had to ask for it to be cooked more. Then I realized No one asked how I wanted the meat. The dish was small with what looked like 2 big tator tots. I was expecting more with it. I also came here when it first opened up and had a better time.
No comment
No comment

We were guests for a special occasion this evening, and the food and service at American Brass made the event very special. I recommend the calimari, gougeres , chickpea fritters, hot loaves of bread, and salads we shared for appetizers. My roast chicken was moist and delicious. And finally, the dessert shares of vanilla bean panna cotta, carrot cake, pineapple cake, and chocolate mousse were so delicious we couldn't stop eating. The service was excellent--friendly and attentive, but not intrusive. I would recommend American Brass and look forward to visiting again.
No comment
No comment

I think I just found my new LIC spot. American Brass is situated in a lovely location with the sight of the NYC skyline right across the water so be prepared to get some pretty photos/selfies. The ambience inside the restaurant is just fantastic and the waitstaff were all super attentive and helpful. The food was just delicious - some of the highlights for me were the fluffy focaccia bread served with whipped ricotta, the perfectly grilled octopus and they very tasty Farfalle. Can't wait to go back!

I came here for the first time tonight with my parents and boyfriend to celebrate my mom's birthday. I've walked by many times and am so glad I finally came in. Everything was wonderful. I told staff it was my mom's birthday and they went above and beyond to make it special for her (printed a special birthday menu, happy birthday sign on table, and dessert, all without asking!). Very appreciative of the effort! The food was delicious too - salmon, steak, chickpea fritters and focaccia. Awesome carrot cake and chocolate soufflé too! Highly recommend this spot.
No comment

Wow! Wow! Wow! Why did it take us so long to find this gem of a restaurant? We sat at the bar for dinner last night because we like to interact with the staff. From the minute we sat down, we were treated with spectacular service (thanks, Freddie and Elizabeth!) We started with delicious cocktails, had the hamachi crudo and the little gem salad, and then had the cod and the burger, which came highly recommended and deserved their excellent reputations. The food was outstanding as was the wine we ordered. This is some seriously elevated cuisine. We ended with a salted caramel sundae which I swore I wasn't going to touch but just couldn't help digging into repeatedly. Everything was wonderful. Then, out of a gesture of pure kindness and thoughtfulness, a personalized dessert came out with our bill. We were stunned and thrilled (and stuffed!) We will definitely be back. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. You must go!
No comment
No comment

This place is nice.. they have small greenhouses for dining. Heater inside which you can set . I had the Atlantic salmon, pork belly, sourdough, the squash soup and the lemon cake and they were all delicious. The drinks were great as well. Will definitely return to dine. We had a prefixed dinner for $60. Which included app, entree and desert only.

Beautiful place, has a French look to it!  Had the green velvet double ipa, not too hoppy but not strong enough lol and had the cavatelli dish which what seemed to consist of gnocchi pasta with crab meat and bread crumbs.  I love the bread crumbs as it added texture to each bite and they didn't put too much not to over power the dish with crunch so that was good.  I give this place 3 stars because it's although the dish was pretty good, it left a bad after taste, a bit overpriced if you can't get that sea flavor out, and the raw bar chef was not using gloves at all!  He was touching his apron, the tickets, pretty much everything he shouldn't be touching!  His colleague realized I was a bit disgusted and she finally put gloves on but I felt bad for her because they didn't have gloves her size, they were too large, but she gets an A+ for effort.  Hope you guys enjoy
No comment

Got seated really quickly and they have plenty of outdoor dining. I love how the seating is like little mini private greenhouses. The frozen margaritas are yummy and get you DRUNK, girl. My eggs Benedict was delicious and i like how the greens on the side were lightly dressed and lemony. Great place to go if you're hanging out by gantry.
No comment
No comment

My husband and I had a fantastic date night here, right on the water as the sun set. The decor of this restaurant is gorgeous and the location can't be beat. The cocktails here are very tasty and creative.  We had excellent service. The hamachi and burger were okay but I absolutely loved the Salmon, the pork belly, the truffle fries (amazing)

I have lived in LIC for 5 years and never have had a better experience than sitting at the bar at American Brass with Camille working. She gave us  excellent recommendations for food and was an absolute joy to speak with. We will be a regular  here because of her.

Since Covid began, I've been extremely cautious and have not dined out. Finally, me and two friends decide to have a girls night but only if we can do it safely. We booked a greenhouse for dinner at American Brass and the experience was beyond phenomenal. It was cozy and extremely quiet -- we were unable to hear the two tables on either side of us. The staff was amazing and saw them disinfecting the greenhouses after each party. The food was delicious - trout croquettes, short and ribs, espresso mousse .. my mouth is watering while I'm typing this. Less than 24 hours I decided to book another greenhouse for lunch with my family. I truly am blown away by the whole experience of the greenhouse meanwhile not compromising on the taste and quality of food or service. Can't wait to dine here again.

Wow, what a spot. Dinner AND a view! Love how they have personal tables with covid precautions and all. The skirt steak was perfect and juicy, and I really enjoyed the scallops. Overall good experience and great place to grab a drink by the water. Was cool to have the personal table/rooms because we dodged the wind as well!
Great food and good service. Awesome location as well! A bit pricey but if you know that going in it shouldn't matter.

Moved into the neighborhood several months ago and have been looking forward to trying out this place. At first glance, the ambiance is excellent and the hostesses were friendly. The food was a bit too salty for my taste. What really turned me off was when I asked for a second glass of the red wine I was drinking and our waitress brought over a bottle with a tiny amount left in it - at best she poured me a half a glass. I assumed she would be heading back to the cellar and bringing a fresh bottle to pour the other half but that never came. Not a great first experience!

Wanted to like this place. Came for a second time and an $80 bottle of red wine was served to us ice cold. When we mentioned to the waiter, he apologized and sent the general manager to speak with us. He proceeded to berate us for not saying something sooner in the meal and took the rest of the bottle away without asking, still expecting us to pay for it. Was extremely rude and offered no apology. Places that treat their customers this poorly do not deserve anybody's business. Avoid.

So far we've been here for new years, my birthday, and valentine's day. Every time we come the food is exquisite and service is amazing. We feel like friends of the restaurant and eating amazing food is icing on the cake. American brass is always cooking up the goodness and we hope to continue coming here for the phosita future. Celebrating events or just walking casually for a bite to eat American brass is always the best dining in Long Island City.

Let me start off with besides the food the other very important part of dining for me... service!!  Our waiter was Chris.. because of him and how knowledgeable he was with oysters and the food he made this one of my best dining experiences!! Thank you Chris!!!  I had the steak frites.   Out of 10 I give it a solid 8... also had bunch of oysters as per the waiter all delicious.    Watermelon and passion fruit mojitos... Rock!!!  Overall a very good experience with a beautiful view of the manhattan skyline! Their setup makes you forget you are dining out during the COVID times!!!
No comment
No comment

Damn this was delicious! Went to eat in the outdoor greenhouse. Has a heater but we went on an extremely cold and rainy night. Service was excellent. I definitely will go back again! Hopefully when we can eat inside. Not pictured we also had the squash soup which was the best soup I have ever had.

This was the first time I've eaten indoors since COVID-19 and my experience felt pleasant and safe. The restaurant abided city guidelines and required mask in all parts indoor unless eating or drinking. The food and drinks were delicious, everything we ordered tasted great I had the burger as an entree. The service was on point and the restaurant ambiance was nice as well. It's a new restaurant in the neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

I came to American Brass for my friends birthday which was surprisingly empty on a Saturday night. We were seated promptly and the service was great. I ordered the Branzino for my entree and it was definitely the star of the show. The fish was cooked to perfection and the crispy skin was chefs kiss! My friends ordered the steak frite which came with a whopping pile of fries and it looked delicious as well. I told the waiter it was my friends birthday and they surprised her with a piece of cake and ice cream on the side which was very nice of them. I would definitely be back!
No comment
No comment
Cool cabins(one cabin for one table, very safe!) and nice service! Love the steak and burger!

i had my birthday dinner here and to be honest i have never been made feel as a special as i did at american brass. they were so thoughtful and friendly and really nice. everyone loved their dishes- the food was amazing. Jose our waiter was exceptional. i could not have asked for a better dinner. thank you for making my day amazing.
No comment
No comment
No comment
It was our anniversary, and we received complimentary champagne! And everything was so tasty, absolutely professional service. Will go back for sure.
No comment

It was a great experience. This past Sunday was our first dining out experience since March 2020 and it was to celebrate my daughter's 24th birthday. It was comforting to feel and dine at ease within your private greenhouse's knowing your CoVid protocol for your staff and patron's. The service was excellent and the food was amazing from the warm rosemary focaccia bread, to the tender pork belly with sauteed dates and the mouth watering slow braised short ribs as well as the delicious steak frites, whoa, what a meal. I'm extremely glad I chose your establishment as our first dine out spot.  Thank you and your staff for creating such a relaxing, memorable and enjoyable experience for us. I wish you continued success and keep up the great work.
No comment
Food is just okay. Service is ok.they charge tips  automatically which sucks. They should not do that .
The ambiance and the food was amazing! Highly recommend the mushroom lasagna and the butternut squash soup. Great staff!!

Took my mom for her birthday dinner last night here. Great ambience and service was also very good. Was disappointed to see that the menu i saw online was not the menu we received.  It was very limited.  We got oysters which were fantastic.  Ordered the rocking shrimp.  Asked the waiter if it was enough for 5 people.  He said yes. It was not. For 2 people maybe. I was also very confused with the focaccia. Not the kind I'm used to. It was a mini loaf of bread in a skillet. It was good but definitely not focaccia. As far as the entrees go I was very disappointed in mine.  Everyone said their dish was delicious.  Mine was as well.  I ordered the grilled short ribs. I had these 2 little cubes of meat on my plate. One baby leek split in half and 3 of what appeared to me as tater tots. I expected a little more on my plate for $40. I honestly left hungry.

Food was delicious, but took a bit of time to arrive between app and main meal (~40+ mins after finishing the app). On weekends they have a prix fix menu that is pretty limited. Also very small point but the lights and heater in our greenhouse was not on for us, had to turn it on ourselves. Staff was nice! Overall, would return on a weekday.
No comment
Nice food.  Attentive and courteous service.  Beautifully renovated space.  The lax animal policy made my experience less than perfect.  A yapping terrier at the next table just ruined it!
No comment

This place was amazing! The covid safety, food, vibes, music, and views were on point! This place is not for plain eaters as they have an elaborate fine dining menu but the burger should please even the pickiest of eaters. The inside is beautiful but take advantage of the free glass greenhouses with the city views and twinkle lights along with private heating. The prix fix menu was to die for and 10/10 suggest for the bougie night out with your girls or your man. Service was excellent and will go again. The foie gras was excellent but I wouldn't have minded two pieces of toast instead of one for the ratio of foie gras given. Other than that whole menu was A1 ! I am obsessed!
No comment

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment

This place is a must try! Food was absolutely amazing! Everything on the menu was delicious as we tried so many different things from the menu. The branzino was out of this world!!! Wow! Service was so friendly and super accommodating. Definitely recommended! You'll love it.
No comment
No comment

Came here on one of their opening nights. The location is beautiful, the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating, and the food is great! Something different that the area didn't have. I love that it's more upscale without having to go into NYC. Can't wait to come here in the summer when they open their outdoor area that has an amazing view.

Our night out at this restaurant was great. The location, which is on LIC's waterfront, offers breathtaking taking views of NYC. We were seated pretty quickly and the food arrived moments after.  The salad, which was drizzled with a raspberry vinaigrette, was great starter: light and tasty, it left plenty of room for the my main.  i had the branzino, which was cooked perfectly.  Highly recommend this place.

The greenhouse had great ambience and service.  The drinks were good as well. The steak was disappointing - was chewy and not tender.  The brisket was very good.  Wouldn't come back for the price - the food was not as good as the bill! But in covid standards have shifted and we still had a good night

A beautiful new restaurant on the LIC waterfront with great views of the city. I ordered the seafood tower, steak tartare, salmon tartare and steak frites. All were delicious... the french fries are crispy and thin and had me nostalgic for potato stix from when I was a kid.

This is definitely my favorite restaurant in LIC.  The service, the food and the attention to detail makes it my GO TO place for brunch or dinner.  I can't recommend it highly enough!  Gino and his staff make every visit special and the greenhouses they put up on the sidewalk are amazing...especially if you're like me and not quite comfortable with indoor dining yet!

My 3rd time at American brass.. keep coming back because Food and atmosphere is top notch. Greenhouses are an extra touch, feel very Covid safe. Wagu Cheesesteak is a must (coming from a Philly girl that's saying a lot) with fries. Golden touch tequilla drink is hands down the best cocktail I've had in LIC. Fresh, smoky, and slightly sweet all at the same time. Only complaint is the service... every time I've been the servers are not well versed on the menu and not very attentive. Will give benefit of the doubt due to Covid but would like to see this area improve.

I had an amazing time with my friends. Everything was delicious. We had the happy hour margaritas which were very refreshing. The decor is beautiful and the staff welcoming. We will definitely return.

This place is amazing! The food was the best I had in a while and the service was extremely fast and they went above and beyond for my wife who is pregnant and have catered for her needs and made her feel like a queen .
No comment

Ordered the burger to go, and requested it be cooked medium. When I get home, I find the burger was cooked rare. I call the restaurant to simply tell them and the first girl I spoke with proceeds to educate me on how they cook their burgers. One doesn't need to go to culinarily school or graduate with a food science degree to know when I burger is cooked rare or medium. All you really need is a history of eating burgers. The manager gets on the phone, and she tells me she has already spoken to the chef who is adamant the burger was cooked medium. I send a photo and they refund my money - but proceed to tell me I should order medium well next time. I told her no, your chef needs to learn how to cook properly. If I want medium, I'll pick medium. If I want rare, I'll pick rare. Customers are doing their best to help restaurants but this place is not doing themselves any favors with customer service. Local resident - won't be returning.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a delicious meal here tonight.  The specialty cocktails are on point and the entrees was all fantastic - We had the Amish Chicken with a side of Brussels Sprouts, the Steak Frites and the Tagliatelle with Shrimp.  You can socially distance with ease here and the views of the Manhattan skyline are second to none - Highly recommend!

There are few servers in the world as attentive as Adriana D. The food is incredible. The environment is next to none. The barriers between tables makes me feel super comfortable during COVID. 10/10 would recommend. Thanks again Adriana.
Good place, great location, fun good atmosphere , will definitely come back after covid

Beautifully designed restaurant with a fresh take on American cuisine. You're greeted by a friendly staff and have a variety of seating options depending on the occasion. Great spot for date night, dinner with friends or with the kids. The steak and burgers were excellent, only to be outdone by the Donut Tower Dessert  Looking forward to coming back for another great meal!
No comment
No comment
No comment

If you're craving a good steak, you must try their steak frites. The waygu was sooo tender. We also had oysters and their Mac and cheese off their happy hour menu - both were fresh and delicious! Came here two times within the last two weeks because the food was so good.

Food tasted pretty good. Overpriced though. For 3 ppl with tip was nearly $300 and we left hungry. Small portions. Plus they were pretty rude at the end. After paying the $300 bill they said ok now get out we have someone else coming. I get if you have people waiting but at last be courteous after overcharging. I can see I'm not the only person to have such an experience looking through the reviews.

Mediocre restaurant with high class pricing. Great raw bar. 38 dollar overcooked- medium quality meat. 22 dollar small martinis, untrained table service. "Fresh donuts" that were stale and chewy. Wouldnt reccomend for the price.
No comment

It was all of our first time dining here and the experience and food were wonderful! The staff was attentive and accommodating in every way. We had brunch on Sunday 10/25 and the service was efficient, food was delicious and overall experience was amazing! Will definitely have to come back for dinner on date night
I think I just had the best burger in NYC. The service is impeccable and the food was amazing. Glad to see this place being a success story! Try it!

This restaurant was fantastic, the Wagyu steak, even the 28-day old burger with the bacon jam was like wow! The drinks don't even get me started, AMAZING ! Hopefully, if the world gets better soon, I would plan my birthday here.

My husband and I went for a 7:30pm dinner reservation at American Brass on Saturday 8/7. We arrived before 7:30pm and were seated promptly. Ordered drinks and appetizers and dinner. At 8:05 we began asking about our dinner and couldn't get a honest response. By 8:15 we asked for the check to pay for drinks and leave. Other couples who cane after us received their dinner and were eating. My husband and I questioned was this racially driven. American Brass will never see us again, or anyone we know. Horrible experience

Exceptional service. Excellent views. The menu was limited but everything ordered surpassed expectations. The taste, flavors and presentation were awesome. Truly an excellent experience. Very COVID conscious. We ate outdoors, everyone's temp was taken and the servers were exceptional safe. I can't wait to return. My only item is there is free parking on the weekend but you must know how to parallel park well!
No comment

Overpriced and mediocre quality. You are paying for the view and location. The service is great tho. Not much to write about the restaurant. Maybe when it opens indoor and the food gets better, I'll revisit.
Excellent service, food, and ambience! Will definitely return and share the experience with friends and family!

Spot on. So happy this place survived covid. Chilled corn soup was incredible as was the heirloom tomato salad and branzino. Cocktails were really good too. We sat outside but the interior is gorgeous. Whoever designed this place is super talented. High end everything. Raw bar was delicious too. Crab and kumamoto oysters were delicious. Cant wait to come back for more!

This place is exceptional. From the ambiance down to the crumb service, American Brass is a true gem. I had been here once before but my experience last weekend solidified this place as one of my favorite restaurants. As a bartender I like to think I have a valid opinion on drinks and I  was accompanied by my friend, who is a personal/private chef, yo celebrate her birthday. It was a Saturday night and we didn't have a reservation but by the time we received our first drink from the bar, we were seated at a table. We did the pre-fixe and for $63PP, it was an absolute steal. The portion sizes were generous but more importantly the flavors were so delicious. The service was memorable, with everyone clearly on their A game. At the end of the meal, we thought there was a mistake with the bill because our $50 drink/app tab from the bar had been comped by the GM. A seriously nice touch to an already amazing experience. Anytime I'm in the mood to treat myself or someone special I will certainly be back. Thanks American Brass :)

This place is exceptional. From the ambiance down to the crumb service, American Brass is a true gem. I had been here once before but my experience last weekend solidified this place as one of my favorite restaurants. As a bartender I like to think I have a valid opinion on drinks and I  was accompanied by my friend, who is a personal/private chef, yo celebrate her birthday. It was a Saturday night and we didn't have a reservation but by the time we received our first drink from the bar, we were seated at a table. We did the pre-fixe and for $63PP, it was an absolute steal. The portion sizes were generous but more importantly the flavors were so delicious. The service was memorable, with everyone clearly on their A game. At the end of the meal, we thought there was a mistake with the bill because our $50 drink/app tab from the bar had been comped by the GM. A seriously nice touch to an already amazing experience. Anytime I'm in the mood to treat myself or someone special I will certainly be back. Thanks American Brass :)
Great place , delicious food but the waiter very distant. He didn't even offer us a dessert.

This place was so good it might be my new favorite restaurant. Beautiful yet not overwhelming in decor. The portion sizes and prices are perfect. The staff goes above and beyond when it comes to taking care of guests and making sure each person has an excellent dining experience. I will visit again.

My husband and I ate at American Brass for our anniversary, and we were not disappointed. The food was delicious--I 110% recommend the burger. They also have a great beer selection from local breweries, and a nice cocktail menu. Our waiter was very friendly and the overall service was great. Also has a great view of NYC, ample outdoor seating, and is dog-friendly. We will definitely be going back!

Ate here yesterday. Staff was very attentive and the food was delicious. Seafood was very fresh and well priced. Burger was a crowd pleaser. Haven't been dining out much because of COVID, but I felt comfortable and will be back soon!
No comment

American Brass is my favorite place. 5 stars for atmosphere, food, cleanliness and friendliness. I come here a couple of times a week and it honestly feels like I've been coming here for 20 years. Everyone is friendly and welcoming and extremely professional. Everyone works incredibly hard to bring you a world class experience. Shoutout to the managers Pablo and Sammy who are engaged with the staff and customers and a pleasure to speak with. Richard, Joey and Phil behind the bar are outstanding to chat with and knowledgeable about the drinks and food. Phil even went out of his way to highlight the menu with all of the gluten free choices for my mom, who has celiac. Richard and Phil also made me some delicious mocktails recently as I stopped drinking but wanted to enjoy something. Jose, is my favorite waiter. He is full of positivity and I love stopping to say hi to him even on the walk by when I'm not stopping in. The food and drinks here are all absolutely amazing and fairly priced for the atmosphere you get with your meal inside and outside the restaurant. Anything you eat or drink will be memorable. For a killer view with your meal and a 10/10 dining experience, please check our American Brass. Thank you to everyone!
Had a great experience at American Brass! Servers were very friendly and they have great outdoor seating. Drinks were really good and the oysters were awesome! Definitely will be back soon.
No comment

Top notch and attentive but not overbearing service. Most restaurants are grabbing plates while you're still eating in order to turn the table. This place does the complete opposite. They were always keeping a watchful eye to make sure we were ok, but we felt like we could sit for hours. Super comfy atmosphere and most importantly, THE FOOD WAS AMAZING! We had steak and burgers and it was cooked to perfection. Focaccia bread to start was delicioussss. LIC is lucky to have this beautiful water-front treasure in their neighborhood. They have the perfect combo for a great dining experience: Amazing staff, delicious food and great location!

Sad. I realize restaurants are struggling and when possible I try and support them.  We reserved a place for dinner last night in one of their outdoor bubbles.  They charge $30 for the "privilege " of being a dinerwe agreed we'd still go because split amongst ourselves it want too costly; insulting yes but with few dining options in the area we said ok.  The food.  The quality.  The taste.  The freshness AND THE PRICES.  Really??????  Lousy, dry and old  Waygu steak sandwich on awful roll/ caramelized onions-where?  Mediocre truffle fries. $27 plus tax plus tip AND SURCHARGE .  Exorbitant!

Went there the other night because we had heard it was from the same people that did Maiella, which we love, and boy were we not disappointed. We started with the French onion soup and duck quesadillas, I can't say we've ever had any like it- we were blown away.  We had the filet and the bbq ribs for the entree and were as equally impressed.  Wish we had room for dessert but we will be back!!! Can't wait

Got the shrimp scampi.  Either they left our the seasoning or they used microwaved cocktail shrimp. No flavor and the serving size was miniscule. The side of quinoa was cold and bland. Very pricey. I was hesitant to post bc they are new and I want them to tide themselves over until covid restrictions passed but I also wanted to timely review take out places during the pandemic. I hope when eat-in options are available it's different.
American Brass is my new favorite restaurant.  From the food and service to the incredible NYC skyline view, everything was top notch.
I love this place!!! I went last week, It's beautiful and the food and service was amazing!! I totally recommend it!! And now the do deliveries!!!

American Brass is a great addition to LIC! The decor catches your eye the moment you walk in. Once seated, our friendly server walked us through the menu and answered any questions we had. The seafood tower was incredible and very fresh! The burger was epic and the sea bass fresh and tasty. I visited during their soft opening so I didn't get a chance to taste their cocktails, but I'll be going back to have one for sure!

First time in and had an amazing experience. The service was excellent. The raw bar had a great selection to choose from. The skirt steak was cooked perfectly and the ribs were fall off the bone delicious. Highly recommend the banana creme pie for dessert.
No comment

BEST IN LIC! Came here for the first time during COVID and was very impressed with the food, service, and protocols taken for COVID. We were seated in a greenhouse for dinner that had its own heater, making for an enjoyable dinning experience. I ordered the 28 day dry aged burger which was INCREDIBLE, I highly recommended. Some other stand out dishes the table ordered was the tuna crudo, pork belly, and scallops. Cocktails were great, overall a great experience. Can't wait to go back and check out the raw bar!!

I recently visited American Brass with my wife and another couple for dinner. What an amazing addition to LIC! The decor was modern, yet inviting, and we were welcomed by a friendly hostess and an impressive cold seafood bar by the entryway. We ordered mussels provinciale, clams provinciale, and the duck quesadilla to start. All were delicious. We then ordered the skirt steak and roasted Black Sea bass for our main course. Both were outstanding. We luckily saved room for dessert. The key lime pie, banana cream pie, and coconut cake were the perfect sweet treats to finish off our meal. Kudos to Chef Raffaele for a fantastic dining experience. I highly recommend and I look forward to returning!
No comment
No comment
The service was poor.  Only stayed for one drink and appetiser as three different servers tried to move us off table.
We had a great dinner with a great bottle of wine and the  staff was amazing.   Can't wait to go back this month.

Loved the décor, very trendy.  Everything was excellent from the bread sticks to the dessert.  The raw tower was amazing, there were a lot of apps to choose from, loved the chicken pot pie and the strawberry cake was to die for! Highly recommend, the service was top notch and wait staff very friendly.  Great experience would definitely recommend to friends and would definitely go again.

I have gone twice in the last 3 weeks and it has been excellent both times. All the appropriate measures are taken, temperature on arrival, cleaning between customers in greenhouses, everyone wearing masks. The food was delicious, the service exceptional. It has been such a daunting time for everyone, so I am happy to support out local businesses. I HIGHLY recommend this place to everyone. Plan on going back in the next couple weeks.
Excellent!! The food was wonderful and even though I took my meal to go, the outdoor space they created is so beautiful and romantic. Can't wait to go back and dine outside.
So ass way too expensive sucks. Waiters are rude and the booths are freezing. Never again. Food was eh too. Tried to charge extra too. Forced to pay 60 dollars for three tiny dishes.

Terrible customer service. Don't think this place will make it past a year. Told us flat out that the time max for a table is 1.5 hours. Also, expectation is for you to do a full 3 course meal per person EVEN if they tell you drinks and an app is okay. So don't believe anything they say. We tipped because we felt bad for the waiter.  Irony is that a) we're LIC residents so could have been a recurring client, b) our combined salaries are $1M+, so turning away clientele with high disposable income that (I would think?) they would want to have, c) overpriced juice called a cocktail - $70 pitcher... d) there were plenty of seats available... so not sure who they were opening the tables up for?!? Would I go back? Never. Would I recommend? No.

I just had dinner there for thanksgiving. The food is so good and the service is excellent. We ate outside it was warm (they have great heaters too) and we had enough distance from others. I would definitely recommend!

Went for an outdoor brunch a couple of weeks ago and had an awesome experience. They were all super friendly and provided a water bowl for our dog. Loved the avocado toast, sausage/egg/cheese. Very solid B+ on the Benedict -- it's a hard game in NYC. Decor inside looks amazing. Outside view is phenomenal and there is a ton of outdoor seating. Didn't have a reservation but they were able to accommodate us immediately. Will certainly return.

i was incapable of making a reservation through their website. but it was my wife's birthday and we thought we'd take a chance. when i arrived the outside seating was empty. however i must have been delusional, as i was told that the restaurant was full. who'd have thought? i wasn't fond of the treatment of neighborhood locals by the gauntlet of gatekeepers that continued to convince us that there was no room in an empty restaurant. one of the gatekeepers offered to reserve a table for us the next day. i declined, as it was my wife's birthday today and not the next day. poor showing. very unwelcoming.

Great food. Good ambience!  We enjoyed apps and dessert on one of their opening nights. Feels like they will be a great addition to the food culture in Long Island City. Do wish they had a few more mid range priced options but for a fancy night out it's a great option.

The service was amazing , the food was phenomenal. Especially the banana cake and the rib eye, not a steak girl but the first steak I would actually go have. I was so content. Recommend this place to everyone.
Today I tried the shrimp scampi- absolutely delicious! My husband's favorite  is the bbq ribs. My son loves the American brass burger. If you haven't tried American Brass yet, i suggest you do.

This place is BEAUTIFUL! Chef Raffaele does it again! Everything from the ambience to the food was top notch.  All of the raw bar items are delicious and VERY fresh.  The charcoal octopus is a must, we had two orders.  The ribs were very tender and burger was cooked perfectly.  You MUST save room for dessert, they all have a beautiful presentation.  We had the pecan pie, coconut cake, and strawberry shortcake.  Definitely coming back again, there's soo many more things I want to try!!

American Brass was amazing !! Visited Maella for my partners birthday and had such an amazing experience that u had to try This restaurant . I loved the raw bar ! Oysters were amazing . The chef even came over to greet us ! Excellent customer service . Would definitely recommend . Great views , food and service !

We ordered the Friday special the Bouillabaisse, the sea bass and a side of mushrooms. Everything was delicious especially the Bouillabaisse. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Cute atmosphere. Would definitely go back. Hope they add brunch.
