No comment
No comment

Delicious Italian food, AMAZING waiters and waitresses, but unfortunately small pasta portions that made me feel like I could have made clam pasta at home and done it the same, if not better. I would go back for the apps and other dishes.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We came back here last weekend now that they're open for brunch and had a wonderful experience once again. They covered the entire backyard so you shouldn't have to worry about being cold during the winter months ahead. We shared the Pomodoro Baked Eggs, Burrata Sandwich, and Ricotta Pancakes between two of us. Everything was delicious. My favorite was the egg dish, which reminded me of shakshuka, very yummy. Service was friendly and attentive. I would certainly recommend paying them a visit if you haven't done so yet!
No comment
Just wonderful. It's a perfect date spot. Food is so delicious and simple. No frills Italian.  Service is always good. Owner is super nice as well. Highly recommended.
No comment

What a wonderful new restaurant! My friend and I made reservations to go have an early dinner on a Wednesday. We were bummed that we couldn't get seating in their backyard, but it just means we'll have to go back again to experience that. The food was delicious and the servers were great! They have a good selection of menu items, including ones that are vegetarian friendly! We loved the cacio e Pepe Riceballs and homemade tiramisu! Was sweet to see the chef and his family as well.

We are Cafe Spaghetti obsessed!  We come every other week for dinner.  The food is incredible. The staff is gracious and kind. We are literally obsessed with the place. It's a must if you are in Bklyn. I can't even recommend one dish because the entire menu is delicious! If I could give it more stars I would!
No comment

Okay, I have to give this place 11/10. From the beginning, Kayla was amazing and friendly checking us in. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and Mike & Bobby couldn't have given us a better experience. It was literally phenomenal. The Caesar, meatballs, fusilli, the gnocchi on special, and the tiramisu were amazing. If you're looking for a place that is anti-carbone with incredible food and even better service, this is it! I cannot wait to go back and tell all my friends.

Luis our waiter was an angel. He really helped make the experience. My girlfriend and I shared the arugula salad and truffle honey and ricotta crostini - both were delicious. For entrees we had the spaghetti vongole and branzino - in addition to being  delicious, we really appreciated the portions. I would love to return and further sample the menu.

The three of us loved Cafe Spaghetti.  We ate the Brussel sprouts, meatballs, branzino, ravioli, spaghetti with clams and the tiramisu.  All were excellent.  Don't miss the branzino, the ravioli, and the tiramisu.  Service was good as was the atmosphere.  Would return in an instant.

This place is really good - high quality food and service. Pricy but..it's nyc. Right in my neighborhood and it was worth the early reservation. The outside back is really nice but so is the front and inside. Inside is just pretty small. There is a bar to sit at too. The ricotta crostini is a must imo. Caesar salad was also very good, but im a big fan of caesar. They have mostly wines but some cocktails + beer. I got the pasta with crab dish and it was wonderful. Plenty of food and filling. My friend got the chicken and she liked it (it doesnt come with pasta fyi). Got the lemon sorbet which was fresh and v tasty. Overall the bill will be high but worth it.
Sal is the best, what can I say. Top 3 Italian in the city. Service is a1, food is a1. Doesn't get much better.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My girlfriend and I came to Cafe Spaghetti on an impromptu Friday date night. It's a couple of blocks away from her place and she had never been here before. We did not have a reservation, but we were lucky to be seated quickly at the bar. The bar is well decorated with quirky objects that facilitate conversation and make you feel like you are in a modern version of your grandmas kitchen. We ordered the Ricotta Crostini with truffle honey for an appetizer. The honey was thinly layered and barely visible but exploded with the right amount sweetness. Our bartender, Kyle, whipped up an olive martini for my girlfriend, which had an olive filtered gin concocted within the restaurant.  I'm not a gin person, but I took a sip of her drink to taste, as we normally do, and the martini was so smooth that even I would enjoy it.  I had a Manhattan which was, honestly, one of the perfectly mixed mixed Manhattans I have had in a while. Kyle kept us entertained by telling us stories of other concoctions created at the bar and connected quickly with us. For the main dish my girlfriend ordered the Orichiette with broccoli rabe, which she devoured. I ordered the Fussili with ragu which was honestly the freshest pasta I have tried in a while. The sauce to meat ratio was perfect. We ordered hazelnut gelato for dessert, which was made in restaurant and tasty. However, we will be coming back for the tiramisu! The bar has a massive coffee machine / espresso maker for serving up the freshest cappuccino, which my girlfriend enjoyed with the gelato. I ordered a hot toddy which I highly recommend. I don't like hot toddy's, but wanted something warm that wasn't cappuccino. Kyle recommended it and whipped it up quickly. Calling this the best hot toddy I have every had is putting it lightly. Definitely coming back here in the future! Would totally suggest grabbing a bar seat as some of the tables looked a bit cramped. Didn't get a chance to see the back yard garden. The seating outside was heated and everyone I saw in there looked cozy and unfazed by the cold.

Great place to enjoy fine food, good wine, tasty sweets and relaxing ambiance. My friends and I went for a Dinner. Everything was delicious and freshly made. The waitress was attentive and cordial. Our selection of desserts were delightful.
No comment

Cafe Spaghetti is truly one of the most special restaurants in Brooklyn. We recently came in for our anniversary, and the food and drinks were spectacular. However, nothing could top the truly incredible, attentive service we received from the staff. Our server, Will, went out of his way to make sure this was a memorable evening for the both of us. We will absolutely be back, and cannot wait to bring our family and friends, too!

Amazing fooooood!!!!! My Nonna from Italy would be proud. Spot on!! Everything was amazing. Rice balls, meatballs, tasted like my nonnas. Fresh mozzarella, salad etc. Service was on the money. The food never stopped coming.  Prices are reasonable. The staff was super nice. The outdoor space it beautiful. Come early, opens at 5pm, 4:30 there was a line already forming. By 5pm, there was 30 people waiting to eat. They where able to sit everyone. Very happy, I will be here agian.

Really enjoyed my experience at this place. I came here for a birthday dinner with a large group of people and from the beginning the staff was really the shining star. They were so amazing and friendly, attentive and welcoming. The ambiance was beautiful we were seated the back yard with candlelight and personalized menus. The food was well distributed, with all sorts of tastes. The wines were paired well, and the food was filling. I had a lovely time with friends all thanks to the wonderful staff. Would definitely come here again for a special occasion!
No comment
11/10.  Place is a home run. Definitely try it out if you have the opportunity. You will be happy you did.

Incredible! New neighborhood spot with a gorgeous backyard and even better food. Can't go wrong but we got the Cacio e pepe rice balls, ricotta toast, eggplant parm & ricotta ravioli. Save room because the tiramisu is also excellent!
Truly amazing. The space is beautiful, staff are super kind, and the food... delicious! I can't wait to try the weekend breakfast. Welcome to the neighborhood!!

Really great to see a family friendly place open up in the neighborhood - we live in Brooklyn Heights so its a bit far for us but still much closer than most places.  The prices here are relatively affordable, although the portions are a bit small for a "family" italian restaurant.  But the food is really good, definitely worth going back to on a regular basis.  We had the cavatelli with butternut squash, it was good.  Also had the fettecini alfredo, which was really good, and then ordered chicken on top of it, which was cooked perfectly (still tender as opposed to overcooked like it is at a lot of other places).  Got the branzino, which was also really good, it came with some butter beans as well but not much else and seemed a bit small for a $31entree.  In general, I dont complain about food portions because most places give too much, and I realized prices have gone up due to inflation, so I am not really complaining but just thought it was worth mentioning because here you might want to order an extra dish or two if you are eating as a family.  the back area is enclosed with a tent, so it was almost like eating indoors, which was nice with kids.  The tiramisu was really good , as was the hazelnut gelato.

I made a trip to Cafe Spaghetti at the suggestion of Gaetano P. I'm very happy that I went, and I plan to become a regular. The space is very nice, and the backyard is fabulous. The crowd is mixed, a combination a new comers and old timers. The staff were all on their game, and the soundtrack was a trip down memory lane. I opted to dine at the bar, and I sampled several dishes and wines. I recommend the Arugula Salad, the Rice Balls and the Octopus. The prep on everything was very simple, and very tasty. I sipped Verdicchio and it paired very well with my food. I can't wait to return.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Excellent lunch in every way. We sat in the heated patio, which was great because tables are spaced apart and it feels airy. We ordered the Caesar salad, arancini, breakfast spaghetti and orecchiette with sausage. Not a bite was left. Just a perfect Sunday experience. Super friendly staff made us feel very welcome.
WOW! Some of the best meatballs I've had in the city. Really enjoyed the Spaghetti alle vongole and Spaghetti Pomodoro as well. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu!

A 10/10 meal from Sal and his team at cafe spaghetti. Everything from the crostini appetizer to the tiramisu for dessert were perfect. Even better than the food was the ambiance and the team bringing it together. Everyone was friendly, knowledgeable and awesome! Will 100% be back!

We came here for dinner on a Wednesday night, and it was so good! The restaurant has so many seating options, including front porch, backyard, dining room (which is super cozy and quaint), and the bar. We were seated towards the back of the dining room. The entire staff is so friendly from the hosts to the bartenders and servers. We ordered the cacio pepe rice balls (note: not arancini per se because they are not served with marinara sauce), fried artichokes, spaghetti alle vongole (came with a few tomatoes - that's what the macchia rosa means), orecchiette, and tiramisu, along with a couple Spaghetti spritzes. Everything was phenomenal, reasonably priced, and decently portioned. Would recommend coming here, especially if you're in the Carroll Gardens neighborhood!
No comment

column3: Central Fort Lauderdale, Fort Lauderdale, FL
column6: A perfect meal, from service and ambiance to out of this world pasta and heavenly  tiramisu. We sat at the bar which meant great service from bartender Kyle, who took the time to answer all our menu questions and chat Italian alcohol, and made a delicious spritz! The pomodoro was delicious, but the crab pasta was one of the most delicious pasta's we've ever had. You cannot skip Tony's tiramisu.
No comment

This was our first time at cafe spaghetti, our children have been there many times and been raving about it. Well me being me, I was like, how good could it be? I have to say, it was even better than they described. We were there for brunch today and I was just blown away, everything was unbelievable, I had ricotta pancakes that were just delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant, you will not be disappointed.

While the food was good, the service was terrible and the portions are way too small.  If you are coming here hungry, don't!.  I had to eat another meal once I got home.  The only thing that came out fast was the check.

New favorite in the neighborhood. Everything was beyond delicious and the atmosphere is so intimate and fun. Our server Alex was so kind and made amazing recommendations. We had such a romantic dinner here, I cannot recommend it enough. Run here!

Came here for a friends birthday dinner. The service was great, staff was pretty attentive and made sure we were pleased throughout the entire experience! The reason for the 3 for me was the flavors in the food just weren't there. I by no means am an expert of Italian cuisine but growing up blocks from little Italy and visiting the country, it just didn't wow me. We ordered meatballs, romaine cesar salad, rice balls, spaghetti pomodoro, the ravioli, and chicken francense with spinach. The apps aside from the meatballs were pretty bland, didn't really get a ciao y pepe taste. The spaghetti tasted like salt more than anything, to be honest it overpowered the actual tomato sauce. I will say the meatballs and ravioli were good, chicken was a bit dry and lacked flavor. We ordered the tiramisu and that was ok. Like I said for $240 expected more flavor and maybe bigger portion sizes. Don't see myself returning.

Amazing! What a wonderful addition to our neighbourhood. Our caesar salad, crostini and pastas were absolutely delicious! They have nice wine selections and other libations. The staff couldn't be nicer, made us feel special :) Looking forward to our next visit!

I was thrilled to get a reservation after the restaurant was reviewed in the New York Times. I was first in line to reserve weeks ahead, their minimum. (They did have walk-ins, as I learned.) All staff here, from hostess to servers and busboys, were unbelievably friendly and attentive. They really seemed to enjoy their work and their visitors' presence and enthusiasm. The food was outstanding. I had spaghetti and clams and broccoli--highly recommended! They even provided sparklers and ice cream for my birthday. I was so touched. I live locally and will go back. Must try the tiramisu!
So cute! Great service! Delicious food! Be prepared to wait without reservations. Worth it!

Sat outside in the back patio and had a lovely meal. Our server was attentive and friendly and everything we ate was fresh and tasty. I also appreciated how quick the service was and how well staffed the entire business was we particularly enjoyed the rice balls and the watermelon tomato appetizer.
Friendly service. Knowledgeable wait staff. Great food! Outdoor patio in the back is perfect for a summer evening

Overhyped and mediocre at best. Why it is so hard to make a reservation is beyond me. Don't come in with high expectations for the guanciale. Gelato was redeeming. Service was very good. Environment and ambiance were both nice.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I would be a vegetarian if I could eat like this everyday! I've been to many fine dinning and top restaurants worldwide and I have to say the food here is exceptional. Each dish has its own unique flavor yet incorporate well with others. The Ingredients are carefully chosen and prepped. It has been awhile I feel amazed by the restaurant menu and that made my day!

This is the kind plant based food that will win over skeptics; To simply put it the experience was exceptional! I came for lunch and dinner.  The menu focuses on using vegetables and grains instead of overly processed substitutes for meat and dairy items. All of the dishes I tried had incredible flavor profiles each distinct while complementing one another. The server recommended ordering 2-3 items for a party of two since the portions are for a sharing. I can't wait to come back; this is now becoming one of my favorite restaurants.
Great vegan spot on the tip of manhattan. Bummed that I couldn't try their dosa, but everything else hit the spot!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Love love love this spot. It's perfect for a cute lunch and the almost-entirely vegan menu hits the spot. The flavors were surprising and beyond delicious. The ambiance is cute and airy. I highly recommend the avocado lettuce cups (light and refreshing with an addictive sauce), hazelnut and jimmy nardello dip (so flavorful and I could have licked the bowl clean), and charred honey nut squash (which paired so well with the incredible mole and has delicious tortillas for a carrier). The only downside is that it's very expensive for the amount of food you get. But if you dole out the price, you'll be rewarded with amazing flavors.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Pretty excellent plant-based option, and really nice ambiance. Was fairly impressed by the flavors of the dishes. Cocktails were ok, would probably stick to the wine list in a future visit.

Came back and tried a few more things. Had the endive again - Got two pieces, but one piece was extremely thoroughly bitter, a bit inedible. The mushroom walnut pasta was just excellent, very hearty and substantial, great taste and textures. The purple ice cream came kind of somewhat melted. It was OK. The skewers were delicious, love the textures and smokiness of the tofu, although if this were my only or main course, I might be sad because this kind of portion does not constitute a meal. Service was again very sweet and nice. For those looking at restaurant week, be careful. I chose the restaurant week menu, but realized later that I ended up paying more than if I had paid à la carte for the same items.

Very, very overpriced for both the food and service. We went in today for a late lunch and were flabbergasted at how laughably poor the service was. Our food took over 45 minutes to arrive and everything except one dish was cold. Not on if you're going to charge $28 for 5 dumplings. Our bread never arrived and our drinks didn't make it to the table until after the second course. Only 3 other tables had guests, and there was a full team both front of house, kitchen, and serving team. A table who was seated 15 minutes after us got served their drinks and meals way before we did. Will not return and will definitely pass along the word to other vegans and vegetarians.

Ambiance was perfect. Beautiful interior for the restaurant itself, and the tin building is popping for drinks afterwards. GET THE FRIED ARTICHOKE. You won't regret it, those are some of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. I want to bring my entire family here. The mushroom bolognese is also fantastic. I could do without the katsu, but that's just me. It wasn't anything exciting. Service was fantastic as well! Looking forward to coming back!
Loved the concept & they were able to deliver on the concept.  Highlights included fried artichokes and purple yam ice cream. Everything is vegan. Service was attentive and atmosphere nice.

I was not sure what to expect when I went to this restaurant. Vegetarian food is not my thing, but I do love vegetables so I decided to try this spot. Overall the food was fresh, lite, and packed with a lot of flavor. I was thoroughly impressed by this restaurant. The appetizers, main course, and the wine list were all excellent.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went last week. There were construction workers drilling away. It was loud, over the top, obnoxious. This is something the owners could've arranged for a better time, perhaps with no customers in the building. The service at the counter was slow and cold. The bagel was okay for someone in a hurry, someone looking to post photos of rainbow bagels or tourists.

Came here on a really cold morning when we didn't know where to eat. I found this place on my yelp and my whole group was so excited to come after seeing the colorful bagels. We walked in and it was very packed. We saw soo many different flavors of cream cheese. I didn't even know some of these flavors existed. Luckily, our order didn't take too long. The experience was fun and the bagels were really yummy. Would definitely come back.

New york bagels really hit different. There were so many options here including the insta famous rainbow bagels. Also, can we just admire the mountains of cream cheese? I opted for my favorite bagel combo (cinnamon raison bagel w strawberry cream cheese). As you can see, my bagel looks quite voluminous and delicious (it was). If you don't eat atleast one bagel during your ny trip, you are doing it wrong.

I didn't have a chance to try many bagels this trip but Liberty was the best. A hundred tomes better than ess a bagel. The space was nice and clean the service was fast and the bagels were amazing!! I wish we had these back home, I would eat here everyday!! We had the nova lox on everything bagel and the egg and bacon. Drool worthy!
No comment
Best bagels in NYC. Both locations are consistent and have a great menu. Bagels, bagel sandwiches, cream cheeses, etc. There's something for everyone here. UberEATS has great promotions as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Liberty Bagels was always busy when we went during our trip, but had a fast-moving line and fair prices. They have a million bagel and cream cheese options, including trendy rainbow bagels and funfetti/oreo cream cheese, and their lunch deli offerings looked amazing. It has a great location right by Central Park and 5th Ave.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great variety and delicious bagels. Even with the long, they were very efficient. I was super impressed and will go again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We placed an order of a few Asiago cheese bagels with cream cheese for pickup. The bagels were really good and their prices very reasonable, especially in comparison to nearby Sip and Co. The Asiago cheese part of the bagel is a slice of cheese melted on top. My husband doesn't like toasted bagels, so that made it a bit toasted. The flavor was good. For drinks, we got an iced coffee and a fresh squeezed orange juice (in a bottle). The coffee was good, but the orange juice did not taste freshly squeezed. It tasted like bottled orange juice from concentrate. We ordered for pick-up, which was a good decision, because the line on a Sunday morning was very long. The order was ready on time within 20min.
I see why the place was packed. The bagels were fire. The cream cheese samples were fire. The bagel sandwiches were fire. We didn't get the coffee but I'm sure that would have been fire too.
No comment
Delicious breakfast bagels and the rainbow bagels were a fun treat I brought back home from my travels!

Amazing bagels and service! A very nice gentlemen with glasses offered to let us try some of the cream cheese they offer. They had over 10 different types of cream cheese. The Oreo cream cheese was so good. It tasted like ores cheesecake. We order 4 bagels and a coffee and it only took about 5-10 minutes to receive our order if though they were busy. I highly recommend!

So many choices... from the bagels to the flavored cream cheeses, there were so many options that I was paralyzed with indecision.  I finally landed on a French toast bagel with cinnamon walnut cream cheese.  Apparently the French toast bagel can't be toasted which would have elevated it to another level.  As is, it was good enough and hit the spot.  However, next time, I'll order something that can be toasted so that the cream cheese can get all gooey and delicious.
No comment

When in New York, you got to have bagels! Our first bagel run was a terrible representation of what it should be so my friend searched up places nearby our hotel. She saw the colorful bagels and was sold! The place wasn't too busy plus the line gave us some time to think about what we wanted to order. We ultimately decided on the Bella Nova with Scallion Cream Cheese on the Rainbow Bagel. After the first bite, we knew this was a true New York bagel! It was so packed that it was a struggle to not make a mess but each bite was so worth it. Surprisingly the cream cheese was on the lighter side and it didn't overpower the lox. My friend and I shared one so that we would have more stomach space for the foods that were planned out for the rest of the day but I really wish I got to have the whole thing to myself -sob- Before we were done eating, we were already planning to come back the next day to try their other bagels!
No comment
No comment

Holy New York Bagel! I woke up knowing what I needed for breakfast, and wouldn't settle for a bagel just anywhere, so I looked up reviews of bagel-specializing cafes and I am so glad I picked this one! We were staying right next to Carnegie Hall, and it was a 5 minute walk to Liberty. The bagels are HUGE, and the bagel sandwiches... well, I think you'd have to be a python to bite into one! We loved the Nova sandwich and toasted everything bagel with salmon spread. Highly recommend this place for an authentic NY bagel experience- skip the crap cafes that might seem like a more convenient choice because this is right next to central park and even if the queue seems daunting, it moves very quickly. Thank you, Liberty Bagels, for making our morning and keeping us full until dinner!
No comment

Liberty bagel is a part of New York culture.  It is highly recommended and they toast the bagel extremely well while having every bagel you can imagine, including the famous rainbow bagel.  I loved the Turkey bacon with avocado and egg and their salmon bagel is solid and fresh

The everything bagel with the lox was delicious!  The blueberry bagel was also great.  We had that with the steak and the savory sandwich was great.  The pastrami was also great.  They definitely do not skimp on the meat.  Definitely a great NY experience.

Bagels are amazing! Just make sure if you order pick up to check if they got your order right. I gave them a nice tip for my order and then found out they didn't give me all my bagels. I got a dozen bagels to take to my coworkers and they only gave me 8. I was cheated 4 bagels. But didn't know until I got to my hotel room to count them. I was too far to go back and tell them anything.
Great atmosphere! Amazing selection of cream cheese and that rainbow bagel  definitely coming back!
No comment
No comment

Ahhh the famous rainbow bagel spot. We were staying in NYC and about to continue our road trip when I found out that my sister was picking us up bagels from Liberty Bagel... score! I scoured their menu and settled on an onion bagel with egg, cheddar cheese, tomato, and avocado. It was complete perfection and my first time trying an onion bagel. It had amazing flavor and was lightly salted. I'd go back a million times. Expect a line, but it's worth it.

This bagel shop is just okay.. Went on a holiday weekend and this happened to be the only bagel shop open around this area. The lox bagel with cream cheese rang up to around $15! There was nothing particularly special about this bagel - the bagel didn't have that great of a texture and it got soggy after a few minutes. I would not recommend this place if you're looking for a "NY bagel".

I'll be honest, I was hesitant to try Liberty Bagels. Any "viral food" makes me nervous. After a morning in Central Park, we decided to head to this spot, known as the birthplace of the "rainbow bagel." It was busy, but for a Saturday morning it wasn't terrible. I opted for a traditional bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel. It was SO GOOD! This bagel lived up to the hype and made the wait well worth it.

i've heard of Liberty Bagels and wanted to try them out. maybe it was an off day, but my bagel was not even close to reaching New York bagel standards. ordered a egg everything with scallion cream cheese and tomato. the bagel itself was passable, but too bread-like and not chewy enough, also the cream cheese barely had any scallion and the tomatoes were sad and pale. overall very bland. although there is a good amount of seating, this location had a bad / spoiled smell when i was there so i ended up getting my bagel to go.

Located very close to south entrance of Central Park. Seems like a super busy place at least on weekends. I ordered a bacon egg and cheese bagel....with tax it was just shy of $10 which I guess is to expect being this close to Central Park. However the bagel was tasteless - bacon was so over cooked and the cheese had no taste whatsoever. Even that it was expected that the price would be higher I still expected so much more from a NYC bagel. I would rather have a place like this charge me even more but I would get high quality ingredients and a bagel that actually tasting something. The positive thing was that even though it was packed I was in an out in less than 5min.

Ate here twice on our recent trip to NYC! We visited the location close to the Plaza hotel. Ordering was a bit confusing, you order in the back of the deli and then pick up your food at the front, oh well, we figured it out. Other than that, bagels were AMAZING!! First time I ordered something salty, the bacon, egg, and cheese on the everything bagel and the second day the French toast bagel with cinnamon raisin cream cheese, calories GALORE!!!! But DELICIOUS!! 10/10 recommend!

Excellent bagel place!  I've walked by this place numerous times and wouldn't have even thought of stopping until I did a search for a bagel place. The highlight for me was the specialty bagels. I ordered rainbow bagels to go for my nephews and I had a jalapeño cheddar everything with cream cheese. You definitely taste the jalapeño! The bagels are a good size and there was ample cream cheese. They also have a ton of flavored cream cheese if that's your thing. The specialty bagels are $1 more at $2.95. 3 specialty bagels + my bagel with cream cheese cost about $15+. I'd definitely stop here the next time I pass by in the morning.
No comment

Worth $15 for a grand size bagel made your way. I know it may be expensive, but it's not everyday you get this kind of delightfulness inside your stomach. You might be satisfied I. Having just 1 and split it with someone, I couldn't finish mine.
No comment
No comment
Popped over from the plaza after the kids seeing this place on tiktok! Well worth a visit! Bagels were being made fresh and pretty much all the food was phenomenal.

I enjoy their bagels a lot. They are some of the best that I can also get delivered. They are fresh and dense with great chewiness. I love their maple bacon cream cheese, and they have a good selection of flavors. I usually get bagels from here every few weeks. Yum!

Beautiful & delicious bagels. I could eat this everyday. They have so many cream cheese flavors, and will kindly let you taste so you can pick the perfect one. Lots of vegan cream cheese options. They sell by weight and I wished i could have flown some home. I would come back to try their hot sandwiches next time.

Didnt realize they opened a midtown east location!!! My favorite bagels in manhattan + they have an incredible selection of cream cheese. Prices are indeed a lil steep but it's worth it. There aren't that many seats inside but luckily central park is like two blocks away and you can also sit in the little plaza on top of the apple store.

I would opt for another bagel spot in the city. Service was borderline rude and curt despite not being busy (no line at all), but that was whatever. My concern was that my bagel order was given to another customer who opened it turned it over in her hand and then let them know it was the wrong order. The workers took it back, rewrapped it and then gave it to me. Not the kind of health code food spot I'm interested in eating at. I took a few bites and threw it out and bought a different bagel somewhere else. The bagel was fine, I was just a bit grossed out about someone else handling my food before me (and obviously not that customers fault!).
This is the way bagels are supposed to be. The choices - bagels and spreads - are plentiful. And they're service/system is well-oiled. This is a NY bagel, no question about it.
No comment
No comment

Really delicious bagels; any kind you could imagine plus seemingly endless cream cheese options. It was really busy when we arrived but they're seasoned pros and know how to get people in and out quickly. My brother and I both ordered breakfast sandwiches on everything bagels and they were out within 5 minutes or so. For fun I got one of the rainbow bagels unsliced and it was great the next day. There's not a lot of seating inside (and it's tight quarters), but there's public seating with chairs and tables just around the corner, plus you're close to Central Park.
No comment
Fresh and tasty bagels! Really good stuff. Typical bagel shop in that it was busy busy around 945am - quick and efficient service.
No comment
Pretty disappointing. I could only eat 1/4th of the bagel because there was so little cream cheese. Maybe a tablespoon total of cream cheese on the whole
No comment

Located just off 5th Ave, I visited Liberty on Sunday morning.  My wait was about 15 minutes total. I ordered a classic lox and cream cheese bagel, a pumpernickel and cream cheese, and a bialy. All tasted great. A couple of ordering hints - walk all the way back to the cash registers (bypass the folks standing around waiting). Once you order go back to the front and pay, they will call your name when your order is ready.
The bagel are good.  The staff is friendly. So far I've only tried the cream cheese bagels. Tomorrow I'll try an egg sandwich.

Good variety of bagels and excellent selection of cream cheeses and bagel sandwiches for good measure. They are famous for their rainbow and patriot colorful bagels. While really pretty, they taste like simple white bread. My daughter loved the rainbow bagel with jelly. I thoroughly enjoyed my everything bagel with scallion cream cheese. My husband liked the cinnamon bagel with nutella. Service is quick.
No comment

Delicious bagels and cream cheese. Process for ordering, paying and receiving food is efficient. We tried the rainbow bagel with regular cream cheese, The Works on a jalapeño everything bagel and The New Yorker on an everything bagel. Everything was good.
Bagels are very yummy. I had the French toast bagel and my daughter got a blueberry. Service was great and fast.

Bagel Bonanza!! Gosh i love bagels, especially with Nova! When we got to NY, we knew bagels were going to be top of the itinerary! We hit up LB twice and it was primetime. This LB was not as good as the other one. I don't know why- but that happens sometimes! I got the ET with jalapeño cream cheese and nova! It was a beautiful bagel!!
Always packed but worth jt..just push your way through  a must try if you are in New York City

Rainbow bagels were on my kids' NY City bucket list, so this is how we ended up here for lunch. The place was crowded and busy, and it wasn't very clear that you had to choose at one counter, order and pay at another counter, and finally pick up your order from yet another one. It all felt a bit chaotic - but we figured it out in the end. The bagels were delicious, and so were the different cream cheese options (the strawberry and lox&chives were both delicious. Cleanliness could be improved.

I'm pretty sure you can get better and cheaper bagels and sandwiches somewhere else in NYC, but I just came here for the Instagram worthy rainbow bagels. Despite being busy the food came out quick. I got a lox sandwich with tofu scallion cream cheese on a rainbow bagel. Bagel itself was much sweeter than the bagels I normally eat (not sure if it's a typical NY bagel thing). Tofu scallion cream cheese was definitely the highlight for me- it tasted exactly like regular cream cheese with just a hint of tofu aftertaste, and they have wider selection of tofu cream cheese than other places. I asked for toasted yet the sandwich was barely toasted, so make sure you say "extra toasted" to get a better crunch.
When in NY please stop at this wonderful place for your bagel fix. I love love love that rainbow bagel, with regular crème cheese. Can't wait to go back!!!
No comment
No comment

I was looking for a local bagel shop, and the rainbow bagel initially caught my eye. I did not end up ordering the rainbow bagel though because in person they each looked a bit drab. I went with a classic sausage,egg, and cheese with a coffee. The everything bagel was delicious and had a hind of garlic. I did not think the sandwich itself had much to write home about, and the coffee was rather weak after a bit of skim milk. It is a solid bagel place in an area saturated with food carts and other locations. I would not mind ordering here again, but I am interested in checking out other locations nearby.

This Asiago bagel should tell you all you need to know about this place. I asked for the Asiago bagel toasted with cream cheese and immediately was told it can't be toasted. Never heard this before but still got it. Got home to eat it and this is what I got.

Delicious bagels and an abundance of choices!! I purchased some bagels right before my flight and they made it to FL nice and fresh! They said they shipped but I can't seem to find out the information since no one has replied to my email.
Quality bagels and fast pleasant service. Many different varieties and interesting cream cheeses.
Great service and staff. Everyone is super friendly and equally as important--- the bagels are so fresh. Cannot recommend enough.

Pure Awesomeness! The bagels and the other goodies are very tasty. The they don't hold back on the cream cheese and the lox are a good portion. The line moves quickly and the service is upbeat and pleasant.
Super quick and everyone is so nice!! Really love their tofu based spreads. It's doesn't have any strange tofu taste or smell, taste just like cream cheese but not too heavy.
Excellent bagels and service! The bagels tasted fresh and soft. The fillings and toppings were delicious. Very clean place. I would go back!

Large selection of bagels and cream cheeses. I got the classic nova, which was a bit salty, but I like that. Customizations were respected. Quick service. The decorations are cute. It's a bit expensive but they pack the bagels full.

They forgot to include 2 special bagels and flavored cream cheese l asked to put in one of my sandwiches which I paid for when ordered!  Basically I ended up paying extra $10 worth for nothing! Not sure if this is how they usually run the business (intentionally missing 1-2 bagels/orders in the bag) but it was very disappointed when you walked 9 blocks to get their bagels.  Couldn't enjoy much of the rest food thinking i got ripped off!  Please be sure to check your order before leaving the store or order small quantity at a time.  I ordered total of 10 bagels (6 assorted bagels & 4 bagels/sandwiches from the menu) and since there were a big crowd I didn't check my order til when I got to my place.  :(
Delicious bagels and a huge variety of spreads! It was so good! We loved it here and wish we lived close so we could go again.
Good BEC, horrible logistics for the customer and if you've never been there before, you'll stand out right away! Need to restructure their line-system

Liberty Bagels is the quintessential bagel place in New York City. I had the New Yorker: egg bagel topped with an egg, brisket, and hash brown. The staff is great here, and they let you sample any of their homemade cream cheeses.
Had the midtown sandwhich with a hazelnut iced coffee. So delicious! And great and fast service.
No place to park from Mon thru Sat. However, the bagels are awesome. The front staff are awesome. Stop by if you can and get your bagels on.

Looking for a quintessential NYC experience? Head over to Liberty on your way to seeing the Plaza and Central Park. I had the jalapeño cheddar everything with scallion bacon cream cheese and it did not disappoint. Chefs kiss for this one!
One of our must see on our trip. Livery bagel did not disappint! We got the rainbow bagel with birthday cake cream cheese. So seeet and more like dessert, but so good!
No comment

Very close to Central Park so it's a good location. I asked for a jalapeño cheddar everything bagel but there was no sign of cheddar and I realize my receipt says jalepeño everything bagel, no cheddar. The green color makes me assume that the jalepeños are incorporated into the bagel dough which is interesting and not something I've seen before. The ordering process is very confusing and pricing not transparent. You order at one counter and pay at another. I thought I was ordering a set item on the menu but it ended up being a lot more expensive than I expected. Apparently the bagel I selected cost extra. Also, there was an additional charge for paying with a credit card which was not disclosed. In summary, the bagel tasted good but the experience was bad. There are plenty of bagel places in NY that I'm sure would provide a better experience.
Close to The Plaza.  Had the rainbow with butter and a Liberty with Cake cream cheese. The bagels are lighter and sweeter here on the other coast. My kid loved hers so we'll probably visit again.
Fantastic place, near Central Park, VERY reasonably priced, and flavorful cream cheese with chewy bagels....YUMMY!!!!
Love this place for Bagels in New York!!  Lots of options. I enjoy their colorful bagels that are specialized to the store, I believe they're called rainbow.

When I asked why I was being charged more than the posted price for a couple of items I was informed the business had raised prices a few days ago but hadn't changed the signage.  Hmm.  I'll bet this is a violation of a city ordinance.

Best bagels in my opinion. This is a very busy place. If you come in the morning there you will see construction workers to business people picking up their breakfast or lunch. I tried ordering online but it felt like it took longer for my order. Lots of cream cheese and tofu cheese options.
Good quality bagel. Messed up my order but manager personally stepped in and fixed it.

I really like the classic bagel sandwich that I got, Yummy, but my wife and I should've split one as it is large. The coffee was not good. I would get your coffee from the place next door. Overall service was good and like every other place in NYC it is overpriced.
It was ok not impressed.  I think the worst thing was the customer service they hurry you up.  I ordered so fast when I went back to pick up my food I saw what I really wanted.

Hit and miss.  Last weekend I came here for the first time and had an amazing everything bagel w/ vegetable. The bagel was light and airy on the inside and nice and crusty on the outside. This weekend I went back for an everything g with butter. The bagel was thoroughly disappointing. It was dense and seemed border-line stale at 8am. So one rave; one disappointing review. Average 3 because the veg cream cheese needed more veg less cream cheese if they are going to jack the price up that much.
Blueberry bagel was excellent. Next time I'll try the bacon, egg, and cheese bagel. Looked delicious.
Great selection, beautiful setting and aesthetic. The bagel and cream cheese flavor options are crazy!. The employees were amazing 10/10. Def my new favorite spot!

Hands down THE BEST spot for a bagel and cream cheese, whether you're looking for something savory or sweet you'll never be disappointed. With great variety and even greater portions Liberty Bagels has found its place in my heart FOREVER.

Great bagels and sandwiches but DAMN are their prices high. Way above market standard in NYC, even in midtown. Almost $6 for a bagel with cream cheese? That might work for the tourists but not for local stiffs like me. I'll take my money elsewhere and maybe have some left after I eat lunch.

I had a very unpleasant experience with Liberty Bagels this morning. I had to repeat my order several times. It was as if they were not paying attention to what I was saying. Then after paying and waiting 10 minutes I asked where it was and it was clear they had ignored it. They made me repeat the order all over, still took their time filling it, and made no apology of any kind for the inconvenience. To add insult to injury they still got the order wrong (wrong kind of spread and they shorted me on the sliced nova).  It was so disappointing because their food is very good.
Best bagels in New York City. Hands down. Handrolled kettle boiled authentic. It's hard to find a good hand roll bagel now

I absolutely recommend Liberty Bagels for a classic but inventive New York bagel. They have so many different flavors to choose from in bagels and cream cheese. They also offer salads and coffee. We got the rainbow bagel with honey walnut cream cheese and the everything bagel with lemon lox dill cream cheese. The lox lemon dill cream cheese was such a light and refreshing flavor. All was delicious and ordering was quick. 10/10.

Such good bagels! Wasn't even going to go here when we walked past, but looked up reviews and they were right. The wait time is not bad at all for how packed it gets in here. Got the protein bagel and it was delish
Loved our visit to Liberty Bagels! The food was delicious, and order was quick despite the lines. Very limited on seating, but that was fine for our party.
Great selection and value.  Had Novacado on jalapeño bagel toasted, very good.  Coffee was pretty good too.
Excellent quick service bagels!!  Went twice and was super happy both times. Fair pricing, large portions for the sandwiches.
They have changed menu and don't carry a lot of the same things before they changed management
I ate a hair in my dish . And than meatballs was not fully cooked. The customer service was not professional. So I only can give 3 stars.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with a big group so we were able to share a lot of the dishes, some of my favorites were the Peking duck, steamed egg, crab soup and the lamb dishes! The service was quick and we got our food served in a timely manner!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Best Chinese meal of my life!!! We had the 1/2 pecking duck, tofu with black truffle and fried udon noodles. All three dishes were amazing. Also, I highly recommend their new drink white peach oolong tea with cheese foam... OMG! Chefs kids!!! Beautiful and clean ambiance. EXCELLENT customer service. 10/10 would recommend.

A really good Chinese fusion place on the fancy side. I really enjoyed the crab and pork soup dumplings! I would not recommend the rosemary lamb chops however; they were deep fried but lacked juiciness/tenderness, and I had to dunk them in chili oil to enjoy them. The service was great, and the ambience is nice.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
We ordered Beijing duck, crab w/ rice and mushroom soup. Everything was pretty yummy. The crab sauce is a bit too salty for my taste. The Beijing duck was good, exactly what I was craving.
Came for the peking duck, and it was good. For an extra $15, you can get tofu soup with the duck bones, which was not bad. Will come back just for the duck.
No comment
great but too much people waiting. Like the food but sometime the food on mean is different between website and the paper one
No comment
No comment

Celebrated a Friendsgiving here. The ambiance was intimate but lively. The whole staff was very accommodating to our party of 12. All the dishes we ordered came out promptly and tasted delicious. I would recommend the duck, pork belly, and cumin lamb.

New favourite Chinese spot on Bowery. Looks upmarket, but don't be fooled by slick slightly generic decor. The kitchen is consistently solid. Very good Pekin duck. Comes already sliced with good crunchy skin, not too fatty. Comes with a generous serving of wrapping pancakes ( most other places give you just a few and charge you for extras). Good amount of cucumber and scallion and hoisin sauce. They also include sugar and pineapple for some reason, as if hoisin is not sweet enough, but you don't have to use it. Please order the duck special that includes duck bone soup which is delicious and a generous portion.

One of the most authentic Chinese restaurants in the tri-state area we discovered recently.  Tried some of the signature Shanghai, Peking, and Szechuan dishes and they are all excellent.  Excellent wait staff who pays attention to the guests.  Items tried: Lotus root with sweet rice, Beef and tripe appetizer, Soup dumpling, Sliced eel with scallion, Peking duck, shrimp with ronjin tea flavor, even the complimentary appetizer Mala cabbage was excellent, you can tell they use authentic spices for the right taste. We will be back for sure, plenty of other dishes to try.

Recommend their peking duck (I would say 8.5/10), crispy skin & juicy meat. Truffle egg was ok (7/10), it would taste better with a bit more truffle oil. Soup dumplings was good (7.5/10), make sure eat it when it's still warm.

The service was really great, the food even better. For the quality and the amount of food, the price is very reasonable and one of my top recommended places in Chinatown I'd take a guest if I had someone visiting from out of town.
No comment
Good food, service and atmosphere. Good for large parties as well. Had the biggest table of the night and food came out very quick as wel.
No comment
The service was excellent but we ordered a couple of "spicy" dishes that were barely mild. I'll take SF Chinese food over this any day.
went during the afternoon and there were many seats available. i was surprised by how good the food was. their duck is a must have!

Horrible, the worst and most rubbery spareribs: as if they simply boiled it and then poured sauce on top of it. I literally could not chew 50% of the meat. Just take a look at my picture. This, plus a small bowl of rice: 30 bucks!

Stumbled upon this place with my boyfriend on a trip to NYC (we're from LA). We are pretty avid Chinese food lovers and were on the hunt for a Michelin star in NY. Jiang Nan absolutely nailed it. It was his first time having duck, it was seasoned and cooked to perfection as were the sauces that accompanied it. We ordered noodles as well, not knowing they had shrimp in them (bf is allergic to shellfish) when they arrived we let out server know and he promptly brought us a replacement without shrimp. Highly recommend Jiang Nan!

The food was very meh, not at all worth the price. We got the whole Peking duck, duck soup, braised pork belly with black tea, sweet and sour fish, and deep fried milk. The best part was the soup from the duck carcass. The Peking duck was a bit dry and the skin wasn't crispy and fatty. The sweet and sour fish was not crispy enough and felt like it had been sitting for too long after they fried it before they poured the sauce on. The braised pork belly also didn't melt in your mouth. Overall, nice ambiance but pretty average tasting food that you can get for cheaper or better tasting elsewhere.
No comment
No comment
Food was amazing! Got the spicy bullfrog and braised bamboo. Both was good for the price. Recommend eating here in you're in the Chinatown area.
No comment
The worst pork intestine I've ever had... Why is it covered with thick flour? Too hard to chew...
Very happy to be here, a very nice place for dinner. Definitely a good place to come back again.  Very chill and comfortable atmosphere.

The food was really good. i got the eggplant in some sauce and it was really good. there's a lot of meat options too but i'm not into that. didn't try the drinks but they are super pretty and look good. the appetizers were good, i got the okra which turned out to be fresh instead of cooked which was interesting. they gave us rice and always made sure the water glasses were full!
The food was delicious.  Service was good.  Great place to meet up with friends since the background music was soft so you can actually hear each other.

My friend and I decided to try this place after walking around in the city and built up our appetite. The people were very friendly. We ordered the pecking duck, albacore and crab with rice, and stir fried pea leaves. Everything was prepared perfectly! This meal really hit the spot!

One of the most authentic Chinese restaurants in Manhattan. All the dishes tasted like they were straight from a table in China. We got the stir fried cauliflower, soup dumplings, tofu with seafood, and deep fried chicken, and steamed lotus root. All of them were delicious! Will definitely be back to try the duck and grilled fish.

Service was great, great selection of Chinese cuisine. Food taste is equally matched to the presentation! Pineapple beer was definitely a must try, surprisingly juicy and tasty! Braised duck was presented nicely, the cumin lamb hot plate was delicious and honestly must say, the house made cabbage was very addicting! Btw, this was my second visit and the food did not disappoint!
No comment

Managed to give a completely wrong order to the Uber driver, only for them to say - just order it again. Lack of clear competency / intelligence and basic human cognitive abilities for all the employees here.
A little pricy, but dishes are really good. Nice atmosphere, good service, could give it a try
The food was excellent and the place was was modern looking . The hostess was dressed in a northern china theme ,which represents the northern part of China
Qian tai xiaojiejie feichang reqing..fuwu ye meichanghao ..dangran shiwu ye meichang haochi .tebieshi  kaoya
Very good authentic Chinese food. We had the grilled fish, prawn and some veggies. All with great flavors
nice food. nice service. the waiters are friendly. the children loved it. awesome! will be back
No comment
No comment

My friend and I came near closing on a weeknight so the place was basically empty. We shared the braised tofu appetizer which was tasty. I got the spicy beef noodle soup, and my friend got the normal braised beef soup. Everything was tasty and comforting.

Great place for Taiwanese beef noodle soup ( my  dad approves!) and he is very picky about his beef noodle soup, all the luwei sides are delicious too very classic flavors reminds me of my childhood. Service is great quick and courteous. I've been to two different locations in flushing and east village and they were both clean and well kept great eatery ambience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: The chicken miso noodle soup is basically just chicken noodle soup but the place is warm and I've type only been there once I j didn't fw what I got so like...maybe don't get that my friend got the beef something something and apparently that's good

My sister and I came here for dinner and both got the Braised Beef Noodle soup! It was super empty, and definitely underrated. Service was fast, and the broth was so flavorful and delicious! They gave a lot of meat in the soup, and the noodles were chewy but soft. The portions were also pretty big!! Prices were pretty good too-We paid ~$36 total including tax and tip. We had been craving some soup, and this definitely hit the spot!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is a place on my list where I have to go every time when I visit NYC. Love the beef noodle, it keeps the authenticity Taiwanese flavor and not changing a bit. Staff were really friendly, and there were not that many people there when I went, so the space is quite enough.
No comment

Came here yesterday.  The place is small and comfy and the service was fast. Furthermore,  the food was very delicious especially the Fried porkchop. I love how it is crispy on the outside and as you bite into it is caramelized and melts in your mouth. I would come back and try another dish.
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

Second time at this place and confirmed my assumption last time that only their noodles (esp beef noodles) are semi authentic Taiwanese, while the others are not that great. I would still come back for their beef noodles though, and it's good knowing that they almost always have seats available!

Pretty good spot! Tried their popcorn chicken before togo and it was delicious so decided to visit. We ordered the soybean milk, dandan noodle, and beef braised noodle soup. Didnt expect the dan dan noodle to have soup / watery but it was still good and the noodle texture was very good. The soup for beef braised noodle was also delicious. Super friendly staff! Worth a try
No comment
No comment

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: We came here on a rainy Sunday afternoon around 1:30 and it was really quiet which was nice.  They quickly took our order and food also came out quickly.  We got the braised pork over rice, beef noodle soup, and Dan Dan noodles.  The braised pork was very tender and melt in your mouth.  The beef noodle soup was also really good - noodles were cooked Al dente and had a nice bounce when you bit into them.  The broth was also super flavorful - I kept on drinking spoonfuls of it.  The Dan Dan noodles were super hot (both in temperature and spice).  It was tad bit spicy for me to actually enjoy - it was very numbing.  Try to order the soy milk to balance out the spice if you do get the Dan Dan noodles.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Four Four South Village is a fun spot, specializing in Taiwanese eats. Their beef noodle soup is pretty good, as is their gua bao. They have some basic drinks and desserts as well. Hitting up their ai yu bowl on a hot day was refreshing.
The tomato beef noodle soup was very good. Broth was pretty hearty without being too salty. The beef was slightly dry but still pretty good overall.
No comment
No comment
I stopped by for a quick lunch and the decor inside was cute. I ordered the dan dan noodles which were tasty and had minced meat and peanuts in it.
No comment
No comment

Ordered take out through delivery app. Ordered Taiwanese braised pork on rice and fried pork chop over rice. Thinking these would be lunch sized, was shocked these were full bowls of rice with ample meat for a hungry crowd. The braised pork was fatty and falling apart . The fried pork chop was well marinated and had similar coating to the popcorn chicken . Was very satisfying and plenty leftovers.

Wow what a hidden gem! I just walked in after the restaurant I was planning on going to was closed. The pork bun was delicious. I also got a beef stew. Both were flavorful and very filling. You can watch them make noodles in the back, it's reasonably priced, and there's lots of room

I came with a group of 4 people. We ordered some cold dishes and luwei as appetizers, those are really good! The braised pork rice I ordered was pretty good too. I also love the lemon slushie I ordered! But the beef noodles and other noodles my friend's ordered were just average. The owner was very nice. He gave us free grass jelly as snacks in the end! The restaurant is very spacious and comfortable! It's a good place for hanging out with friends.

I don't have pictures of the dan dan noodle but that's what I've told Taiwanese friends that I've taken is a must try. It's different than any of the dan dan noodles I've had and way better. Not to mention, the other dishes, the popcorn chicken and pork chop over rice were both juicy and crispy. I'm moving soon so won't be a few blocks away anymore but will definitely still make the trek out.
No comment
No comment

Got the braised beef noodle soup and the bubble tea. The beef noodle soup has a relatively light, but comfortable broth that is not too overpowering. The noodles have a decent texture and thickness. The beef are a bit chewy to eat but are still okay. Liked how they have two pieces of cabbages in it to make it a more balanced meal. Don't really like the bubble tea too much though as it has a slight sour flavours in it (if it is not accidental). Overall a pretty good place to get a bowl of Taiwanese beef noodle soup.

I ordered the spicy beef and tendon noodles soup, seasonal greens, sweet-sour plum juice, and snow cake; all of which were flawless and quickly served in a perfectly quick and precise set of time to where I didn't even have to wonder how long it would take for it to arrive and in such satisfying portions too. The food was all prepared and made to perfection and despite how full I felt it gave me the urge to keep wanting more and to invite more people to come and experience the food and environment with me. As for the server, he was very kind, swift, mannerly, and efficient. The place was spotless and taken care of incredibly, everyone working I could tell was spot on in their performances. May this restaurant stay and continue to grow because the world should experience such excellence!

Solid price point that hits the spot and spacious! Taiwanese food is on its hype game and this is not Taiwanese breakfast so that's refreshing lol. A little oily but the flavor and authenticity was there and I love a place that offers tendon :) service was quick and my friend got a good and comforting chicken stew. Hits the spot and felt full afterwards - what more can you ask for?

I was craving Dan Dan Noodles for a while so decided to head here to quell my craving.   Too bad it's not the same dish I'm accustomed to.   This is a Taiwanese restaurant,  so that might account for the excessive pickled mustard greens which rendered the entire dish sour.   I much prefer Sichuan Dan Dan Noodles instead.   That said,  it was still a pretty good dish.

The food here is so good and so are the drinks! The Lemon Slushie with Mango is excellent. I highly recommend the spring rolls, popcorn chicken, bao buns, and dumplings for apps. The Szechwan Dan Dan noodles are so good as well.
This place is really good. I had beef tendon noodle soup. Beef and tendon both very fresh and tasty. Broth very flavorful. Also had cold cucumbers, also very tasty!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Stumbled upon this place late at night when all the restaurants on st mark's were busy. The beef noodle soup and popcorn chicken were good.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We were looking for a nice but not super-expensive place to have dinner before a show at the Public. This was the perfect spot! It's a cleanly designed comfortable restaurant specializing in Taiwanese noodles. What a satisfying meal!!

I ordered the popular beef noodle soup. They've got seating inside and outside but I chose to sit inside because it was hot out and there was AC. I like how they give a good amount of broth with my dish. The inside seating is very spacious and they have hand sanitizer available on every table.

Came in for lunch, wasn't crowded, service was fast. Soup was excellent - tender beef, good mix of different parts of the animal, excellent tomato broth, well cooked noodles. The bubble tea slushee was a little disappointing, not much flavor to it.  But the soup was amazing!

I try to support this place because I had a great experience at their outpost in Flushing.  However the food at this location in Manhattan just seems different (and not in a good way).  The beef with rice dish I ordered was comprised of 50% fat.  I get it someone has to get the fatty pieces sometimes but seriously where is all the meat going then?  I'll give it another shot otherwise I'll strike this location off my list and just think it never existed.  So much potential yet so far.

My sister and I came on a cold winter day; we were craving some hot noodle soup and this place did not disappoint! I got the one of the beef braised noodle soup and beef crepe roll to share between the two of us. The braised beef was tender and the soup itself was pretty flavorful. The crepe roll was a nice juxtaposition from the noodles - it was crispy, juicy and the cucumbers gave an extra crunch and freshness!
Tastes like my moms. Been searching for Taiwanese beef noodle soup and this is the spot. Unassuming, but just as good as Taipei.
popcorn chicken could've been more flavorful but the service was super fast and the beef noodle soup portion was huge

Noodles and dumplings were among the best I've had. I'm a NYC native but honestly not sure if I've had Taiwanese noodles.  The texture really was perfect.  The place is welcoming, with comfy booth seating, and the service was friendly and efficient.
No comment
Best Taiwanese beef noodle soup I've had in the city! This place is seriously underrated

The beef noodle soup is excellent. The noodles are a very nice texture that's chewy. Portion is insanely humongous. Can feed definitely at least two, maybe 3 to 4 people. Pork and chive dumplings are not particularly special. Pork bun is fine, has sugar sprinkled in

Went in without very high expectations, but was very impressed. I had the spicy beef & tendon soup noodles and the pork gua bao. The noodles were done with just the right level of firmness, the beef was tender and the soup was delicious without using too much oil. The gua bao was a whee bit on the small side but the pork was very tastey, soft, fatty and the cilantro was plentiful. So far, this is my favorite bowl of beef noodle soup in NYC (please note I got the spicy bowl, not the regular beef noodle soup).
Literally the best Dan Dan noodles I have ever had.  Go get some now! Oh yeah and the braised egg was the  too...

I ordered on UberEats with a promo of buy one get one free. Forgot to add the other one so called the merchant. The merchant REFUSED to add one when it was still in preparation. If you try to get away with every promo and couldn't afford that, just don't do it next time. Doesn't look good on you. The merchant's attitude is what made it worse. Would not recommend.
Went there got early dinner and ordered soup 111. The broth was lukewarm and the beef rather chewy. When I told the waiter he just nodded and brought me the check. Disappointing experience.
No comment

I've only waited 25+ years for a truly authentic Taiwanese restaurant to show up in Manhattan. High quality ingredients makes this place even better than joints in Flushing. A must-try, and for me, many times until I've tasted the whole menu.

Omg, SO GOOD!!! Totally authentic, the food made us so happy!  So glad this restaurant opened in Manhattan.  Favorite today - Taiwanese Braised Pork Rice + Beef Roll + Assorted cold dish (jade cucumber + black fungus in vinegar sauce + spiced edamame) + Braised Soybean Curd --- one note: the spicy dishes are super spicy though yummy!!!
Had a great experience with delivery and would order again. I love beef stew noodles and thought their offering was very solid. Will post more once I go in for an in-person meal!

Delicious food and attentive service. We sat outside in one of the beautiful private booths. Noodle bowls were big and hearty. My gf loved the spicy version. We also got some veggies that were perfect apps to the noodles. And I'd totally go back again for the soymilk. First place I found where I felt like it was similar to Taiwan.
No comment

With all the noodle places in Chinatown closed this place was a nice discovery.  Unlike Ho down the street you can sit without a reservation.  The food is great.  The beef noodle (spicy) is awesome.  The noodles are very chewy so they create a nice combo with the soup and extremely tender beef chunks.  The side dishes are also delicious.  the tofu is not too salty but very tasty.  Now something everybody should try is the pig ears.  Now hear me out :) They are spicy and not waxy :( Not many things I can think of that are crunch and spicy you hear me? :| ok, enough talking your ear off.  Check out this place and you'll give your friends an earful.  Sorry! Enjoy.

My friend and I order their signature three treasure beef noodle soup and braised pig feet over rice. The beef noodle was quite good but the pig feet was not cooked tender enough and it was also tasteless. There was barely any flavor there. The service was decent.
As a Taiwanese person I can say confidently that their food is very very authentic and delicious.
Authentic Taiwanese foods from a Taiwanese perspective. Long live the business and definitely need more local support!
The Taiwanese food were authentic. Haven't had any noodle or rice from this store that I do not like. Highly recommend it!
The beef noodles were incredible! So flavorful and a big portion for the price. I will definitely be coming back!

My friends and I went to Four Four South Village (East Village) last weekend. The restaurant layout was modern, open space and orderly, and the AC was strong. It was on Saturday lunchtime while McSorley's packed with a rowdy crowd, FFSV was empty both indoors and outdoors. The four servers were sitting and standing around, bored and lacking in interest. Well, no business...understood. Suddenly, I felt a bit of sadness. Being a long-time New Yorker, I had remnant remembrance from my childhood in Taiwan of these veteran communities. What a bowl of delicious Taiwan-style Beef Noodles (and other appetizers) meant was much more than the food itself. It reminded me of homesickness from overseas students and immigrants from Taiwan back in the old days in the US when Taiwanese-style Chinese food was scarce. It also reminisced an almost forgotten historical era timely preserved through homemade food tradition by a group of uprooted and dislocated veterans sabotaged by civil war. Four Four South Village will be quite an appealing restaurant for many New Yorkers alike if it knows how to introduce this interesting food history to broader customer groups. While doing so, expand its menus with different homemade Northern dishes well known from these veteran communities to accommodate various taste buds. Chinese and Taiwanese food cultures are full of history and legends. I want to see Four Four South Village flourish.

I'm so excited to see that Mimi Cheng's opened up in Brooklyn on Atlantic near Court st. I hadn't tried the ones in Manhattan. But I popped in today to do a pick up. I love the cute minimalistic decor. I tried their pan-fried pork & chive dumplings and they are so good. Finally! Dumplings with a nice thin wrapper, good filling, and a spicy, vinegary chili oil dipping sauce. Also ordered the spicy dan dan noodles and a side of stir fried greens. All yummy. Definitely will be back. (For folks who know the area, it's the former Gumbo Bros. location.)

I have never tried MiMi Cheng's until this location opened in my neighborhood. I must comment, the guy at the cashier and the Asian lady both made us feel right at home. Super friendly people! I loved everything, it actually taste like Taiwanese and reminded me of comfort food from home. See my photos for what I ordered. I would definitely come back!
Great new spot! We ordered the noodle soup, scallion pancakes, and veggie dumplings, as well as extra sauce because it was that good! My son literally licked the plate clean.
Great food. I love Georgian cuisine but this is hands down the best one I've been to

I have been to every Georgian restaurant in nyc and ubani is the best - everything tastes fresh, homemade, and flavorful - even though it is filling, I feel good after eating here- I appreciate the new wine list and selection- staff also are all Georgian it seems; very friendly; and the restaurant has an intimate vibe- it truly is the best Georgian food I've had - and one of my favorite restaurants in nyc

Came here on a Monday night with a reservation for 6:15 (was pretty empty then but differently filled up closer to 8). The service and interior were all amazing, and I would love to come here to study/chill!! But the meat platter my friend and I shared was extremely dry ): looking at other reviews I think we just ordered the wrong thing

We have been here at least 5 times now and always have a great experience. The hatchapuri is super cheesy, the Georgian salad with walnuts has the tastiest walnut sauce, the chicken mtzvadi is juicy and tkemali sauce is tart. The honey cake is EXCELLENT! I think it has a layer of dulce de leche and a creamy layer and a honey layer.. so good. Highly recommend. Don't skip the compote either, get a pitcher to share. Yum!

Came in on Saturday evening without reservations.  Ubani feels informal and has a casual vibe. The menu is a one pager of starters, main courses, desserts and drinks s we opted for kompot (berry) to start . Which was not too sweet, cold and refreshing. Ordered 2 types of khachapuri which were cheesy, buttery goodness and for 2 quite filling . Salad is recommended to break the carbs up. We also got a portion of Khinkali dumplings. These are quite big and meat was well spiced .  Overall we enjoyed our meal and would come back for more main course options to try. The only drawback was noise level that was from proximity to other tables talking loudly . I would avoid busy dinner times if you want to talk normally lol

What a gem! We found this place just walking thru Soho and how fortunate we were that we chose to go here. The food was outstanding. The server was extraordinarily helpful and friendly. What a treat! Just be ready to fill really satisfied!

First time trying Georgian food and was totally blown away by how yummy the food was at @cafeubaninyc! The cauliflower was grilled perfectly and retained the natural juiciness and sweetness of the vegetable, with the walnut sauce being a good addition but not overpowering. Elarji is made with coarse-ground corn flours Sulguni cheese. It maintained a surprising balance of cheesy but not to the point where you can't finish it as a meal. I would describe it as cheesy grits (kind of)! Absolutely loved this place and really wanted to try their desserts but was too full by the end of it.
Low key beautiful cafe/restaurant. The service was outstanding and they were so kind and helpful when ordering. Everything was delicious. the prices are very high for what you get.

A really cute brunch/lunch place! This was my first time trying Georgian food and I loved it! The boat shaped bread (part of the adjaruli lobiani) was amusing and seemed freshly baked. It was a perfect texture and definitely stood out to me. The cauliflower was also great and the walnut sauce was well-seasoned. The dishes were also well-presented. The server was patient with helping my friend and me decide what to order. The one thing I would caution is that there weren't a lot of vegan options, but there were a good number of vegetarian options. I also liked the general vibe of the place - low-key but cozy with wooden tables and water color paintings on the walls. Would definitely want to come back here!

Went here for brunch and everything was amazing. Interior was clean and super nicely decorated with plants. Service was very attentive and welcoming, we decided to get the watermelon matcha and the adjaruli khachapuri. Never heard or tried of either but was blown away but how good it was. Being a huge matcha enthusiast, I thought I had every matcha combination possible (never thought of watermelon) but it was truly the best matcha ever! Perfect summer drink would recommend it the most. The adjaruli khachapuri is best for cheese lovers and the dough is pillow soft. Would definitely come back again!

It is a super cute restaurant! Really wanted to try the brunch but we just missed it. The food was good but I felt like the menu is mostly full of appetizers. I don't think they had any seafood options--just meat and vegetarian. Heavy on cheese. Worth a try!

I had the honey cake to go. It was tasty. It had a few layers. Not the same as the honey cakes that I've had elsewhere, which has much more layers and texture. I won't order this again. But I'll come back to try something else. The staff were super nice and helpful.

Had high expectations for this place because of the reviews but our experience wasn't great. We waited over 25 minutes for our food and the service wasn't great. The khinkali was decent - the dough was a little too thick for my liking but the honey cake was great. The sweetness for the cake was just right. I loved the matcha latte - it was very smooth. I'm glad I got to try this place though!

SO GOOD. good food, drinks and overall vibe. service was great! i got the pistachio tart and a hot matcha latte. both wonderful :)
