My first experience with Georgian food, which I've been wanting to try for years, and it did not disappoint. The waiter was very helpful and kind explaining things. I knew about Kachapuri and it was divine.  I was surprised about how soft the dough was.  We had a really unusual roasted cauliflower with pomegranate. Salad with walnut dressing. A platter of grilled meats with fantastic "salsa" style sauce on the side. It was all terrific and I can't wait to go back and try more.

I was in town visiting my daughter for my birthday and she suggested that we come here for a quick lunch between two walking tours.  We both absolutely love Adjaruli Khachapuri but it takes some time to prepare. Knowing that we only had around 35 minutes for lunch, the kind gentleman behind the counter jumped into action to see if we can make it work. After he checked with the kitchen and assured us it will be ready in time, we went ahead and ordered it to share along with their Georgian Salad with Walnuts. Such great service! He brought us the yummy salad quickly and the piping hot khachapuri came out before we were even finished eating the salad. Everything was so delicious and it was a perfect combination to share: hot-baked bread boat cheesy goodness with a cool tomato/cumber/grape salad. Plus, the restaurant is super cozy, light, and cute. We could not have been more pleased with our meal here! And they even wrote "Happy Birthday" on the serving board that the khachapuri was on! How cute is that?

What can i say  as an Native Georgian who lives in Ny for 20 years and tried every Georgian place i would never be fully satisfied, but i can proudly say that food quality and service quality is a top notch here in Cafe Ubani. Staff is so friendly, attantive really cool and Ambience makes you feel that you are where you supposed to be, no rush just chill and Food is very delish and divine.I would 100% recomand this place
Amazing! Such a unique type of food. Will definitely be bringing anyone visiting from out of town back here to try.

Came here for post dinner dessert & coffee. The interior is cozy and cutely decorated and the wonder / manager welcomed us warmly and answered questions we had on the menu. My friend and I shared the honey cake. It was beautifully played. It was also incredibly rich and moist. The layers created a nice chew not often found in cakes. The honey provided the perfect sweetness and flavor. I loved the dusting as well. I would definitely came back again just for this cake and to try their dinner items which also look good!

service and staff was amazing. we ordered the meat and cheese khinkali, the nutella croissant and the napoleon. overall, everything was amazing and I can't wait to go back to try more things on their menu!

These guys are great. I love Georgian food and so happy it's become more accessible but sadly it's my least favorite Georgian restaurant. I've tried a variety of dishes from there and the guys are just so warm and cordial that I really really want to enjoy at least one of the dishes there but I don't know, its just all lacked the quality that I've grown accustomed to in nyc and Georgia. :(
The service is great and the food is delicious. People who like cheese must try adjarull khachapuri.
We dined at Ubani again and were impressed one more time. This place is the true ode to Georgian cuisine, and not only that..... a dash of charm and verve.... on top!

Great service, beautiful interior, incredible pastry selection; had an insanely delicious warm Nutella croissant on a Saturday morning here, along with a silky egg-and-cream cheese croissant, and the owners gave me a free iced coffee. Phenomenal gem in the neighborhood.
Great place, great coffee. Owners were very friendly and welcoming.  Did a great job with the interior.   This is the type of small business I love supporting!  Congrats on the new spot!
I've never eaten such delicious meals in NYC, highly recommended...staff very nice and friendly...So kind people.. You feel like - you're at home
Such a nice place.  Dry good Georgian food, I am Georgian myself so very picky when it comes to our food. We had a great time, food was great and staff was lovely. Highly recommend

Amazing little cafe. Highly recommend. Started by two guys from the country Georgia, they're super friendly and the food is authentic Georgian and extremely delicious, with beautiful presentation. Get the cauliflower with walnut sauce dish - it's really amazing! The matcha with watermelon or strawberry are unique and delicious as well, worth the slightly higher price. They go above and beyond with their service and it shows. I think this will be one of my favorite spots in the west village.

Wonderful new neighborhood spot! I had really been hoping to see some sort of coffee/pastry shop move into the neighborhood for awhile now, and Ubani is the perfect place! The croissants are honestly some of my fave that I have had in NYC (they offer plain, almond, nutella, and pastry cream filled ones), the prices here are great (especially compared to other spots in the area), the interior is lovely, and the owners are super friendly! I have nothing but rave reviews, and cannot wait to come back and try the dinner offerings soon!!

We grabbed dinner here on a snowy afternoon, and the food was AMAZING! We will be coming back again soon.

One of the best places in NY! Besides the fact that food is amazing and incredibly beautiful/flavorful, the atmosphere is something you do not want to miss out on. You feel at home from the second you step in. Coffee and baked goods in the am is to die for and dinner tops it all of! You HAVE to go and see it for yourself, thank me later:)

We really enjoyed getting dessert here. Casual, nice ambiance with a good amount of space. Very friendly service. The two different desserts we had - chocolate-style cake with nuts and a neopolitan cream layer cake - were delicious and went great with our chamomile mint teas. Definitely would recommend!
My dinner was amazing literally everything I ate was good  no complaints will definitely come again
Quickly becoming one of my favorite spots in the neighborhood, with friendly service, delicious food, quality coffee, and a relaxing ambiance. Nothing not to like.

Great place for a good drink after dinner. The watermelon martini was very good. Would go back if I'm on the area.

Ended up at Little Rascal after The Egg Shop was packed on a Saturday morning. Happy we did! The place was completely empty, we were the only ones inside. I ordered the vegan bowl which was great and super flavorful but way too oily for my taste. My boyfriend got the Turkish quesadilla and liked it a lot. The portion sizes are HUGE too. Made a reservation for two on a weekday evening, sat outdoors. Ordered the zucchini pancakes, prawn muhammara, and grilled chicken. Flavors of everything was delicious, light, not too oily. Really enjoyed all of it. Zucchini pancakes were crispy outside and gooey inside with cheese. Prawn was fresh, the muhammara wasn't very flavorful though. Pricey though at around $38 post-tax.

Really loved the food and wish I could have tried everything on the menu. The dim-lit bar ambiance was relaxed and really enjoyable especially since it was cold outside, it felt particularly cozy. The bottle of red paired perfectly with the vibe.
Loud and very average food. Not authentic and over priced. Too many other good places nearby to waste your money here.

Just ate here last night and it was excellent. Lamb Brochettes was AMAZING! God so succulent and perfectly seasoned. Had the full branzino too which was delicious. Manti to start and the zucchini fritters were both delicious. Wine selection was nice. Had a rioja and my wife had the Pinot noir and both were very enjoyable. Turkish breakfast In Istanbul spoiled us so much that we HAD to find one closer to home. See, the thing about NYC is, if you're craving something just google it (Gen Z swears by the term GFGI 'Go F* Google It'). That's how we found out about Little Rascal. Their Turkish breakfast spread is spot on! If you ask for extra bread or cheese, they'll happily bring you more. The Turkish Bagel was yumm as well. The atmosphere & the service are reminiscent of Turkish hospitality.

When we first walked in we were seated immediately. We came around 5pm on a weekday so there was no wait. The restaurant had a warm atmosphere. This is a perfect date spot. The waiter was very kind as well. We ordered the Trio Dip, Grilled Octopus and Chicken Brochette. All three of these dishes were amazing. The bread came out warm and it was delicious by itself. Dipping it in the trio sauce made it even tastier. The trio sauce included cacik, Hummus and Babaghanouje. I would recommend ordering any of these. You will not regret it.

We just happened to walk pass this place on a rainy day and it looked so cozy that we decided to try it. They had the storefront windows open and we grabbed a seat in the corner looking over Elizabeth Street. It's a small spot with a very romantic feel. I love the ambiance it's dark and very cozy. This is the perfect date spot. We didn't try the food this time, but they had a decent wine menu. The food looked very good and next time we are coming back for dinner!

The lentil soup and the chicken kabab was really good, and the service was awesome. I was told that the chicken is halal but I can't verify whether or not if it's true but definitely would go back if it's zabiha halal
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Good food, great service and was well priced. We got the meat platter which was amazing and quite filling for two people along with an appetizer.
No comment

Very quaint and quiet spot in front of the Butcher's Daughter and much better in my opinion. The Prix Fixe brunch was amazing, I loved the bread, cheese, jams, and olive spread. The grilled cheese and scrambled eggs were amazing as well. I highly recommend for an intimate, delicious, quiet brunch

This place is my absolute favorite restaurant in NYC. The food is delicious. DELICIOUS. That bread is to die for. The ambiance is so quaint and relaxing, charming. The wait isn't long. It's a hidden gem! Excellent for brunch

Love the vibe of this place. Warm and inviting, both in its decor and comfortable seating, but also great service. Owners really take pride in their craft and it shows. Cocktails are interesting, Turkish coffee is great, and prices are just right. This would be a go-to for me if I lived closer.
No comment
No comment

Amazing food! The menu included some foods I didn't necessarily expect but it was a nice surprise from what I thought would be a traditional, standard middle eastern menu. The lentil soup was so flavorful and had great texture. The beef dumplings were so tiny... I imagine it takes forever to wrap each dumpling by hand. The sultans delight (lamb and eggplant) tasted amazing as well. Highly recommend! And the ambience of the place was quite rustic and romantic, with wildflowers and candles on the table.
No comment
Great Turkish breakfast! Alican the server was warm & accomodating. The bread was fresh & the food tasty. Endless glasses of Turkish tea too!

The best Turkish Breakfast/brunch place so far so good i've been in NYC. Everything was tasted fresh. Stuff was friendly. Very cozy interior. Will definitely be back for breakfast. we're fan of Turkish tea. Hope next time they can leave the teapot on the table. :)
I live right next door and I can't believe I've never tried this place! Went last week and was so impressed with the food!! Will definitely be returning.
Dark and comfortable. Service was great. Just stopped in for some red wine and hummus. Yummy delicious. Coming back for a Turkish meal.
Bordeaux before dinner. Great service and decent to big portions in food. Best to share the platters and entrees.

Great Turkish food in soho. We got a reservation quickly on open table and were seated immediately when we got there. Food was good, portion sizes pretty generous. We ordered the slow roasted lamb,the meat platter and the the okra, and the trio of dips. The meats were yummy, the okrA was okay. Instead of the trio I'd recommend just getting the babaghounsh since the meats come with the cacik
No comment
No comment

This place is a joke. The food is mediocre, small portions, and way over priced. It's so dark you can't even see what you're eating! Here's the best part, apparently it was closing time and they wanted us out (after having spent $700 on our bill). These clowns (the servers) start banging on pots and pans, making as much noise as they can to "give us the message" to leave. Really? Maybe turn on the lights and that will give us the hint it's closing time. avoid this place! Unless you want to spend an arm and a leg and still be hungry!!
No comment
Great Mediterranean place! My favorite dish hands down is the lamb burger. I am addicted along with the octopus salad! Won't find it anywhere else !
I came here for coffee and bellini's. I know - great combo. It reminded me of Turkey and it's wonderful laid back cafe culture. Grab a Turkish coffee and enjoy.
Excellent food...awesome staff...real nice and accommodating to us with our 10mo old!  Definitely going back soon!

The food was yummy but the service was real slow. Sometimes I enjoy a lax serving environment in the city - it can take your mind off the hustle and remind you to drink your coffee slowly and just enjoy your damn breakfast; but, like, I have stuff to do so can you pretend you're being lax but actually be quick about it? Seriously, the omelette was so tasty, but I won't be coming back cus it kinda sucks feeling ignored.
Drink prices were through the roof, bartenders were disinterested and seemed annoyed any time you ordered a drink. So many other options nearby, I would not recommend to anyone.
Stopped by on our way back from NY. We tried the grilled octopus and the lamb chops.  The lamb chops were excellent but the grilled octopus was one of the best I have had...perfectly done.

Went with a big group for dinner and loved it.  Started with humus, babaghannouge, phyllo rolls (chicken & beef) and moved to grilled lamb, beef and chicken.  Finished with a show-stopping slow roasted lamb.  Everything was perfectly seasoned and cooked.  The Argentine Malbec was perfect and well priced.  The owner could not have been friendlier and is clearly proud of his heritage and eager to share his Mediterranean heritage and cuisine.   Really liked it.
No comment
Quite, quaint and sweet little bar with romantic lighting, great service!! They stayed open longer just to serve us and went out of their way to make us feel welcome!! Totally recommend
No comment

Great place, cozy, charming. Hosted a small  birthday dinner there and it was perfect. Wonderful food that is cooked to order and very fresh. Turkish meatballs were excellent. Sangria on point. Waitstaff very friendly. Portion size just right, you leave there comfortably full, not like kind of hungry or ugly full (if you know what I mean).  It was perfect.

Cozy little place in Soho: quite dark, candlelit interior with very interesting music. We had some good things to eat which we all shared. We had a delicious cheese platter, the hummus was good, but not great. Same for the bread: good, but not super. The mixed green salad was good and the branzino excellent. Service is very friendly!
No comment
Came here last night for dinner and the ambiance was really nice!! The food was great! Get the tzatziki sauce and then order some meatballs!!
Cute place. Was here for a company happy hour so the setup wasn't typical. They ran out of guiness and delirium on draft so i was definitely bummed out. None the less enjoyed their food a lot.

What a great little place...Great Vibe and yummy food..We only tried the turkish meatballs dish which was served with some sort of yellow rice..but it was amazing...the service was awesome too...can't wait to go back here and spend some quality time...

The WORST experience I have ever had at a restaurant. The owner is aggressive, rude and couldn't care less about customer experience. If you are looking for getting humiliated and paying for it, then it is the right place.
No comment

Ducked in to warm up with drinks on a chilly December day. The space is incredibly cozy & warm. The drinks were well made and service was relaxed yet attentive. Its two brothers that man the place entirely and we enjoyed chatting with them. I can't attest to the food but everyone around us eating brunch looked content with gorgeous plates in front of them. Looking forward to sampling more next time.

Nice ambience but the menu is thin with some gentle approximation of Arabic food. Seems wildly over-priced. Eleven dollars for a small dollop of Baba? Too bad, second strike out with middle eastern after Ali's in Brooklyn. You may need to go Detroit. This hipster pump fake is making think they should start vetting these reviews.

Popped in to little rascal for a cocktail with a few friends. Got the watermelon martini which was good enough. Doesn't look or taste like it has any watermelon but whatever. My two friends had the garmet margarita and the cucumber cooler. It was probably the best of the lot and I would recommend. Worth dropping in for a drink or two.

Well. I can't judge the food because we never got the chance to experience it. We arrived and we were told we were going to get the next table available. We waited 20 minutes and then right in front of us the waiter gave the table to other people.  He didn't apologize or cared and just told us " I didn't know they had a reservation " and invited us to leave. WTF !!!!!!
Booked reservation but when arrived was informed they wouldn't have a table, bigger tables apparently are more important to their business.
No comment
No comment

We stopped by Little Rascal for a few drinks but ended up staying there for hours because of amazing service and authentic Turkish food on the menu. It has a cozy atmosphere with subtle jazz music in the background. We had a variety of appetizers including cacik, piyaz, kisir, ezme, eggplant salad, borek, and the crazy good manti. We've been told the mezes and main dishes have a touch of homemade quality and it definitely shows. Our wine recommendation of rose by the manager was excellent. A great place to catch up with your friends and wind down with wine in a friendly location.

Fabulous pre-fix brunch with delicious Turkish tea!!! Variety of cold and hot meze (appetizers) served with warm bread. The menemen egg dish adds richness to the brunch. Overall we are very satisfied with their food and service!

This is the cutest little place with wooden interior, a fake barn door, and mood lighting. Absolutely lovely place to get a drink or a meal. We got babghanoush, Turkish meatballs and octopus and everything came out great. They also had some unique Turkish wines and beers. Located in the heart of Nolita on the corner of Elizabeth and a stone's throw away from the shopping areas!
One of my favorite restaurants in city for both brunch and dinner. It is my hidden gem where we gather with my beloved ones and always enjoy their tasty menu and great service.
No comment

2.5 stars.  I really wanted to like Little Rascals, from the location, decor and the menu.   Unfortunately,  the food (Turkish Meatballs,  Chicken entree and Baklava) was underwhelming and the portions small.  The service was also lackluster, inattentive and slow - it wasn't even a busy evening (just a lot of takeout orders and the sole waiter/bartender was splitting time with friends at the bar).  It was my husband's birthday and the restaurant missed at making it a special evening.  I will not be returning.
No comment

Stopped by for a mid-afternoon snack break on a summer Sunday.  Loved sitting by the open front window, people watching and enjoying a much-needed respite from the sweltering day.  Drinks & available appetizers were a perfect choice to recharge our batteries as we headed towards Chinatown.  Unusual rustic vibe for NYC.  Memorable!
We stop in during a random Sunday night and like everything... Fancy atmosphere, delicious food and great service. We will come back for sure and strongly recommend it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The perfect experience of Turkish(& international) cuisine! Great atmosphere as well!
Don't ever come to this place. The owners are so unprofessional and very rude. I was very taken back by their demeanor, and the food was sub par to put it kindly.
No comment
Such an adorable little hole in the wall. Unexpected and charming. Sangria is amazing!!
Such a lovely, chill spot for an afternoon drink! Charming little hole in the wall with a good happy hour menu.
No comment

Amazing Turkish restaurant, we got chicken and Turkish grilled meatballs, meat and chicken was so juicy and delicious. We spoke to the owner, he always around and serving some tables by himself. He brought spices and new recipes from Turkey. Bakhlava it's super fresh amazing desert. Love this place.

The worst.  3 items were not on menu when no one was here and they said they were sold out. ( it was 7 pm and we the only ones here). There was a cockroach on the wall ( not their fault), a hair in our rice, they spilled grease on one of her hang bags and then the owner yelled at us.  I would never return but btw waiter was really nice

I was doubting their food in the beginning. I ordered the chef's selection which was $28 came with 4 different things. Totally recommend! The food was really good!! I also had their manti it was just so delish. I also had their Turkish meatballs and it was so good! Will definitely comeback here for their delish Turkish food.

Unimpressed. Had an 8:15 reservation and we were seated by 8:50, staff of one was unapologetic. While it's a small and cozy venue, the server also serves as the bartender. When we ordered we were advised they were out of our dish. Perhaps a better way is to advise customers at the front end. Atmosphere is good and food is decent. Don't go hungry or in a hurry.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The place has a nice decor and ambience but the food is incredibly bland and tasteless. Gave it 2 shots, both times the hummus tasted like it had been heated up in a microwave and the lamb tasted like nothing. The service is slow and unfriendly.

Do yourself a favor a stay away from this place. Understaffed, unprepared... it took them almost 3 hours to serve a brunch for two and they didn't even have half of the items on the so called "prix-fixe" menu and yet charged the full price.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here from a recommendation to find a relaxed place near Soho/East Village to get something to eat and get some work done. The cocktails and entree (I got Grilled Wild Salmon) were both delicious and had a unique taste. The ambience is great, dark and moody enough to offer an interesting vibe but quiet enough to work or study for a couple hours. Will be back!

Wonderful little place, cozy ambiance, lovely & friendly waitstaff... Despite its small size, Little Rascal actually serves some of the best Turkish food in New York, both appetizers and mains are delicious (and I grew up in Istanbul.) Thursday nights they have a great DJ and it gets quite fun. I've been there many times and never was disappointed. Check it out!
No comment
No comment

A very cute and cozy bar/restaurant in the Nolita area.  A friend and I popped in for a glass of wine and to catch up.  I wouldn't call their wine selection amazing (and it's a place that doesn't take their wine program seriously - as there are no details of the wines listed - just the varietall), but it was exatly what we wanted for the occasion - a cute and cozy bar with inexpensive wine.

All appetizers are $8 or less. Their Piyaz -- white beans salad was seasoned to die for, the lamb that my friend ordered excellent,  baba ghanoush very tasty. This Turkish restaurant is actually really, really good, more than reasonably priced and they have a few good wines &beer on the menu, including a GREAT gluten-free beer. They have a BIG projector, so it's a really good place to watch the World Cup. Go! #watchworldcup #nycrestaurants

Went there for brunch. Shame that the service was so bad all around (almost left after 15min). I have to say the food was pretty good, well half the food since the potatoes never came. When I asked I was told "the potatoes" come later !!! Well it's OK, the tip will come later too
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We had dinner and drinks on NYE and had a good time. DJ Memos was playing and creating a very nice ambiance, service was prompt, and the food was good. The babaganoush, turkish meatballs, and okra stew with lamb were all delicious, and the baklava was some of the lightest and flakiest I've had. Highly recommended!
No comment

Delicious brunch, love the olive paste and their bread. Have to get the grill meat ball or any or the grill meat! So good. Although the service is good, but somehow they didn't bring us extra bread after we have asked twice. A small place so either go early during weekend of reserve a seat.
No comment

My initial impression of this place was lovely: cozy atmosphere, great lighting and delicious food (the meatballs are perfection). With that being said, I've never been treated so poorly by management. My friend wrote a similar review, so I won't belabor the topic; however, we were asked to move tables and then asked to leave because we had "been there for an hour and forty-five minutes and that's a sufficient amount of time." To which I wanted to subtract at least fifteen minutes for the time it took for us to gather our stuff, prematurely close out our tab and move tables after they told us another group needed our table. Let me emphasize that we had a reservation, ordered multiple starters, three dips, a salad and an entree (oink), in addition to ordering an entire bottle of wine. We certainly would have ordered more, or perhaps a cocktail, but we were not given that opportunity because our meal was rushed and we were asked to move tables to "finish our wine." Again, we may have ordered more, but we were asked to move and close out our tab. I know New York is not known for its manners, but since when did it become ok that the paying customer essentially gets kicked out of an establishment for doing nothing but enjoying the food and beverage it serves? Unacceptable. Little Rascal, your food is divine and your waitresses are doing their best, but it seems the protocols they have to abide by need to be reassessed because moving people around like cattle and then asking that they leave because "their time is up" is no way to treat your patrons.
Beautiful food in a beautiful space. This restaurant never felt packed yet was full of vibrant people. The staff was also nothing but gracious. Certainly looking forward to returning.
No comment

This place gets 2 stars for the ambience and the chicken that was on my salad. Otherwise fairly disappointing. When we got there we were told there would be a 30 minute wait, but that we could sit at the counter and have a drink while we waited. We said yes, had a drink (I had white wine sangria, really good), 40ish minutes later we flag down the waitress and ask if she knows how much longer the wait will be, and she goes off for a minute then comes back to say that they're booked up for the night. Uhhh, seems unprofessional that you told us a 30 min wait before??? She says we can eat at the counter and we say sure cause we're really hungry. We all ordered their Quinoa and Kale salad with avocado and goat cheese, and added chicken on top. The salads come fairly quickly, and the chicken was soooo good. But the salad itself had seemingly no dressing, and a very small amount of quinoa, but a decent amount of walnuts. We weren't sure if they had added them in place of the quinoa, but walnuts were not included in the description, and considering that tree nuts are one of the most common allergies, that seemed a little risky to me. The ingredients in the salad otherwise were really good together, but it wasn't as great as I had expected, although, again, the chicken was incredible. In all a disappointing experience, but maybe it was just an off night.

Amazing food & atmosphere!  There are so many rich flavors to taste. Everything we tried was delicious!  The service was excellent and shout out to Annie, who was delightful. Looking forward to our next visit.

We were walking around downtown and randomly wanted to have Turkish food.  It was our luck to chance upon this cute restaurant in Nolita. It's a cozy place that feels very comfortable and not at all pretentious. We ordered babaghanouge and lentil balls (forget its name) as appetizer. The lentil dish was so good.  Then there was meatballs & octopus casserole as main. Very delicious.  We rounded out dinner with baklava and Turkish tea.  I wish they offered Turkish coffee though.  It was a great experience and we will definitely head back for future meals.
Shadey business practices (makes you pay with square and then will not give you an itemized  receipt) , rude service, PHYSICALLY ABUSIVE OWNER

So I am still sitting at dinner and felt a need to review this place. I just had the WORST octopus I have ever had. It tasted like cat food. The hummus was a good started and so was the wine. But that doesn't make a place good. My friend had the meatballs and he said it was like a well done hamburger. The chicken "kebap" was edible. So stay away from here.

It's delicious. It's hard to compare Mediterranean food to anything when there are Cafe Mogadors in the world. But this place is Turkish not Moroccan, so its hummus and babaganoush are just a little different. Delicious though. Very very good and really nice service. All of the appetizers were top notch, and the lamb is so good. Watch out for the skinny side of the big green peppers, they're spicy!

We just stumbled upon this cute little place trying to find an affordable restaurant in the area one Saturday night. The place is small and has a cute and cozy atmosphere that's sort of classy and cool but not pretentious. We got seated right away without a reservation. I got the lamb brochette for my entree which turned out to be surprisingly great. The portion wasn't as generous as the portion I usually find at Turkish restaurants but I really enjoyed my meal. We didn't stay there too long but I could see how the bar could get extremely packed at the later hours of the night.

It is such a good Turkish place. The food is just excellent they have the best appetizers. Main course I had octopus casserole and my friend had shrimp casserole and it was really good. Beside these ambiance is awesome and  very friendly service. Definitely will come back.
This place was a good surprise. The staff were super friendly and the food was amazing! Worth trying for sure.

Absolutely the best Turkish in town. Try the meatballs, delicious! The seasonings and marinated chicken is also very good. Bulgur rice was the side on meatballs and very soft blended. I tried the salads as well, great dressing and nicely presented. A small and intimate cosy space, helpful and friendly staff.

Stumbled across this place on the way to another restaurant (which was too busy to accommodate at the time). The outside of Little Rascal looked interesting and so I went in. I was surprised by the high quality of the food. I would say the establishment is a bit understaffed but they make up for it with charm, good ambiance, amiable nature, and (last but not least) good food. Definitely worth a look for anyone interested in tasty, fresh, and (moderately) healthy food in the Soho/Nolita area.
This place was right up my alley. Cozy, warm and inviting. Octopus casserole. Wow. Recommend a reservation.
Dreadful experience - dreadful service. Didn't have any of the wines on the list. Extremely rude and inattentive waiter.  Right around the corner from where I live, but never coming back.

Very overpriced. How are two lentil patties the size of a quarter worth $10? The owner is a pretty unfriendly guy who seems like he's in a trance. Wine by the glass is priced as high as possible. The menu has been the same since it opened three years ago. Used to come here but it's a really strange place, and for food this ordinary prices are way too high.
I wish the portions were a little bigger cause the food was superb. Must go. Great ambience and amazing service.

Had a really fun weekday dinner here. The staff was welcoming and warm throughout, the mini towel napkins were adorable and peculiar, and the food was tasty and great for sharing. I thought the chicken kebabs, fish and octopus were especially good -- tender, juicy, flavorful. The kebabs in particular reminded me of ones I'd had while in Turkey. This is a sweet little spot with a nice easy vibe.
No comment
I had the best ezme in manhattan here. none of the other Turkish restaurant have this special food.
Great (trendy) ambiance, good music, young crowd. Hard to tell this is a Turkish place ;-)

Very fresh and delicious Turkish food, best I've had in the city! The staff/owner are very good people. Very relaxed and candlelit on the inside and the best playlists. Definitely a perfect date spot!
Clean, great tasting food. A must try amongst Nolita's plethora of options.
No comment
Delicious, healthy authentic food with a warm neighborhood feel. A+  service is amplified by a killer music & wine selection!!

Came here hungry twice, the turkish chef did not disappoint us on these two occasions. It's this rare place where the bar serves excellent entrée. The ambience is casual and relaxed, and they have a wide selection of cocktails too. It's a fun place in the neighborhood. It's a must try!

Simply the best Turkish style Mediterranean food ever tasted in NY and US. Very friendly and generous owners. Chicken kebab, red lentil soup, Turkish meatballs, Cacik, hummus and the bulgur rice are what we had and must be tasted IMO..Great wine and beer selections, friendly staff, glad we have a new friends and great spot to visit regularly.
Excellent food and such a warm feeling. Will come back again and again. Super friendly staff amazing food and a great energy

Sat at the bar when I went here. My friend loved the turkish bread. I really liked the grilled chicken plate. I could eat that every day. Perfectly cooked, not dry or oily. It's what you would want chicken to taste like all the time. The service was a bit slow and seemed like they wanted us to eat quickly because they kept trying to clear our stuff away when we were still eating....despite us ordering drinks continuously too! The female waitress was really nice though. Good restaurant to get a relaxed dinner - nice, dim lighting, not too loud.

This is more a drinking place than a restaurant, to my view, though nothing wrong with their food. It is charming and welcoming! Their drinking (wine and beer, etc.) list is extensive, especially some very good and rare found German beers. Their food is simple and somewhat revised version of traditional Turkish food - neater in the look, clearer in terms of spices and less muttony in the spell. All in all it was pleasant, though I did expect it would be more old style Turkish alike when I booked it!

After a long day of exploring the city, we stumbled upon this restaurant and I have to say that it was our luck!  The food is excellent, especially the babaganouge!  I would  also recommend the spinach/mushroom salad.   The waitress was very nice and was even able to recharge our cell phone while we ate, since the battery died from too much navigating.  This restaurant is wonderful.

Discovered this place one night after being displaced from Sandy (live in the FIDI) and what a delight! The servers are all so polite and the atmosphere is very romantic! Wine list (try the Gruner) is also exceptional and their food is always fresh and dances on your palate! Great place for a date night or to meet up with friends as there are plenty of seats in the house.
Such an amazing place! You can't go wrong with great food and a great staff! I live in the neighborhood and this is one of my go to places!

The food is just okay, but the waiter inexplicably charged an additional (and exactly) 10 dollars to each of our 4 portions of the bill--or $40 to the total bill. How does one do that?--Sorry, there's really no excuse and wow, how bold a move. Luckily the last of us was paying attention and piped up. Be sure to check the charges. They use the Square app to process transactions and make you sign on the spot one-by-one at the table, so it's the perfect opportunity to scam you as you're making convo and ready to leave.
No comment

Very cute little place with a pleasant rustic feel. A bit overpriced for what you get, but I thoroughly enjoyed my Turkish meatballs and babaganoush appetizer. The reason I give it two stars is because it honestly may have been the worst service I ever experienced. My party of 15 was completely forgotten about. It's pretty hard to miss 15 people. We waited about 45 mins for our food and when we approached the server they ran to the kitchen with a face of panic. He could of forgotten to put in the order, fine, mistakes happen. However, after putting in our original orders, there was no apology, nobody came to the table to ask if we wanted anything for the next two hours, nothing. Our entrees came with greens instead of rice which nobody wanted, and when we asked for rice they said it was "sold out." Ok it would be nice to inform your customers beforehand. The servers are rude and the whole staff seems disgruntled. I would not recommend it if you plan on having a nice evening. There are many nice places in the area that know how to treat their customers.
No comment

Should have been a cute addition to the neighborhood, as we're lacking in the middle eastern cuisine camp. However, you're better off with Balzem or even Hoomoos Asli. Although the latter is more of a super casual to go place and not a sit down. Back to Little Rascal - intimate setting, great wine list, excellent drinks. It fits perfectly with the casual but nice offerings of the people who frequent the neighborhood. But the food! It's barely edible. Not one person in our group enjoyed the meal. Portions were small, food was tasteless, and nothing tasted marinated. I wish I could say that the ambiance and the people compensated for the food, but it really doesn't. Not that this is supposed to be a review for the other places, but unless you're just coming for drinks, I think this is a PASS.

Awesome food, friendly staff, great atmosphere! We had manti, variety turkish mezes and wine, they were all very delicious! We spent hours and felt very comfortable and had a lot of fun. We will definitely go there again, highly recommended!!
No comment

Big fan of this awesome wine bar and dinner spot.  We recently did a buyout for an engagement party.  Everyone had an amazing time with excellent service, stellar food, and great drinks.  Would highly recommend for a private event, casual cocktail, or dinner stop for some delicious Turkish cuisine.  Halil (the owner) is super cool and really went the extra mile, marinating lamb for 2 days just for the party.  5 stars!

Went on a Saturday for lunch. Service is very absentee so if you want something you'll need to aggressively flag down waitstaff. The food ranged from quite good to just ok. We had hummus & bread (tasty), lentil soup (tasty), and chicken kebabs (chicken was good sides weren't). Our waiter didn't bring water until we asked. In sum, reasonably good food, but don't expect much from the waitstaff.

This is one of my favorite places. Great atmosphere to have brunch, dinner, or a drink at night. The food is exceptionally tasty Turkish cuisine. You should try the traditional Meze dishes to start with and follow up with the meatballs or fish. The service is super friendly and the owner Halil is a great host.
No comment

I ordered for delivery a salad and the lamb brochette. The salad was really small and the lettuce was completely wilted and black... The lamb wasn't cubes but very, very small scraps that were very tough and cold. There was nothing to it at all. It was disgusting. And the tomatoes were not roasted. It was incredibly overpriced for what I received. I don't know how they can serve this. It was also late. Not ordering again, the worst experience I've had with a restaurant
I'm a fan of the food and ambience, but service is really slow especially for big group. The owners are also the bartenders/waiters, one of them is really nice and I would come back to this place
Owner wasn't friendly. Small portions, even for entrees.
Great food, Table a little small and near the window was drafty. I would give 3 1/2 if possible but would rather upshot as very nice waitress and staff. Good sangria. NIce atmosphere.

Little Rascal is a great neighborhood spot. I loved the simple rustic feel, the personal service, the wine selection.. including off-list. The food was savory, fresh, abundant and priced well. I asked for a side dish and the chef made me an off-menu plate of well seasoned sautéed greens...perfectly matched with my entree. It is owner run, so there's no canned restaurant group feel you get in some of the city spots. It'll be a regular for me.

Wonderful ambiance! We were seated right in the window and it was nice to feel the cool outside air. Loved the decor, lighting, etc. The babaganoush was really good. Someone below mentioned they weren't given enough bread-- the owner brought more bread for us and we didn't even have to ask! The wine was yummy and great beer selection. The food, though, fell a little short. Meatballs were dry, and the lamb wasn't anything to write home about. If anything, maybe I'd go back for drinks and appetizers.

Was on the search for something new in the neighborhood and ended up at Little Rascal.  Turned out to be a great decision - perfectly spiced lamb, good wine and beer selection, and a very relaxed atmosphere.  Certainly will be back.
Got here early and it was perfect for a family meal- good food nice design and service

Food is absolutely delicious! Host was very nice and helpfull. The reason this review does not get 5 stars is because it was very windy and chilly near the window. After some remarks from us and our neighbours, they closed only half of the windows(...). As a result, it was still a bit cold when sitting near the window.

tried this place on a whim, as it was one of the only places that stayed opened with no power during the week of hurricane sandy. my husband and i are loooving it more and more everytime we visit. the dishes weve tried have all been delicious. the kebabs are perfect. lamb chops and mezzes are wonderful, too. we are recommending this place to all of our neighborhood friends...the owners and staff are very nice, as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Everything was just fine. For a Midtown Manhattan restaurant it is actually disappointing. With all the great choices in Midtown, particularly for Italian food, there is little reason to go to Osteria La Baia. The service was ok, as was the food. The room is nice, but nothing special. On a Saturday evening it was half empty. Overall it was disappointing.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Upon recommendation, we dined at Osteria La Baia before attending a play. The food was amazing. Clearly fresh pastas and sauces. I commented that I don't know if I can cook pasta out of a box ever again! And I cook ALOT!! The service was wonderful. The noise level was very low. We were able to get a last minute reservation which was a wonderful surprise. We will definitely return!

Amazing experience and service (especially Walter and bartender Roberto!) food and drinks were good as well as dessert. Ambiance was very elegant and classy. Also very clean. If you are the Broadway district, it's a must try before a show!

A gem in midtown. Perfect for a pre or post show dinner or meeting friends after work if you work in midtown. They have an excellent wine list and great cocktails as well. The spicy soppressata pizza with mushrooms onions and hot honey was delish. Pastas are great too and they have an incredible private room. Very vibey spot, check it out!

Really yummy Italian restaurant in the heart of Manhattan. Really enjoyed the sbagliato and the mushroom risotto! Really big restaurant we were able to walk in - will note it was a week day. Service was friendly and the over vibe is pretty relaxed and upscale. Not loud and very spacious.
No comment

I went here with my colleagues from the UK after a long day at the Javits center. We arrived late for our reservation but they held the table for us anyway! They accommodated 15 people! The food was delicious and the wine was outstanding (so I'm told). I was 5 months pregnant and they made special arrangements just for me. Hugely appreciative for the outstanding staff!

Out for a walk in NYC and used Yelp to help us find a good Italian restaurant...and it was really good. The setting, service and food were amazing. Lobster pasta was indeed tasty and my wife said the lemon drop cocktail was good also. A great find outside of Times Square!

Nothing too amazing - I would rate this a 3.5 instead of 4. My friend and I shared everything and it was perfect. We started with burrata, and ordered the soppressata pizza since I was craving it. Everything was pretty light and portions looked pretty big. I only came here because it was close to where I was at the time. I wouldn't really come again. A little pricy for my taste, but the atmosphere is classy. Good spot for a date, and there is a bar as well.

We decided on this restaurant based on the reviews and location. We had reservations at 6:30 on a Saturday night so were seated right away. Most of the waitstaff were attentive but our server seemed to be preoccupied with his coworkers. We started with the Burrata, which had a great taste and silky texture. I ordered the rigatoni alla Norma and was very happy with my choice. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce had a wonderful smoky flavor. I've tasted a lot of pasta but this sauce was one I will not forget.

Looking for some great Italian in NYC, look no further. This Osteria hit the spot. From great service to delicious homemade pasta, La Baia delivered perfectly for my business dinner. The atmosphere was relaxed with the dimmed lights, but energetic with everyone enjoying their dinner and company. We enjoyed the burrata and the grilled octopus for our appetizers and moved on into pastas for our mains. The lobster garnanelli pasta looked amazing but I had to have the pappardelle bolognese, which was absolutely stunning. The plate presentation was gorgeous, but it was quickly empty as we didn't leave anything behind. We then finished the night with the warm zeppoles, which somehow disappeared despite how full we were from dinner. I can't wait to revisit Osteria La Baia the next time I'm in town. Bon appetit!

The lobster garganelli here was the best pasta I've ever had in my life. I cannot wait to go back and order it again. Enzo was a fantastic waiter and made great suggestions. The side potatoes were also really good!
Accidentally ordered a vegan pizza because I thought the toppings sounded good but it was not what I expected. We were the only ones there when we had lunch on a weekend

There are better places to eat in this area of NYC. The food was good but not great. The thing that really stood out on my recent visit was the service. Our server was not very attentive to our table disappearing for long periods of time. It's a shame because the restaurant is in a gorgeous space. That's just not enough for me to recommend it.
Super delicious pasta! The ambiance is a little formal for my taste, but I'm from California LOL. Really good service. We had the lobster pasta and Bolognese. Bread was delish too.

Came here for pre show dinner and it was amazing! Haven't had dinner in the theatre district in a long time and I'm so happy this place opened, I feel like it must be one of the best less touristy places food was awesome, albeit pricey, and atmosphere was perfect. Service was so sweet too! 2 of us ate the lobster pasta and I didn't even get a picture of it - outstanding.

Came here tonight for dinner and surprised restaurant wasn't more full. Our table and meal was incredible. Had red snapper, lamb chops, Margherita pizza, meatballs and pappardelle. All were absolutely incredible. Service was solid. The miss for me was the drinks. Making an Old Fashioned or a Manhattan at a place like this should be a no brainer. Upcharge too for Angels Envy...okay with that but drinks were actually not good! We were going to hang at the bar after dinner but no surprise now as to why literally not one person sitting there. Please rethink your bar service. Drinks were awful. And expensive!!! Go for the food!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great experience. Took five kids and seven adults this evening. Did not expect such a fancy atmosphere (or we wouldn't have brought five kids) but they handled it so well. We ordered as we went and the food came quickly. It was close to empty, so we weren't competing with other patrons. But the margherita pizza was great, oyster appetizer was fresh, and everyone enjoyed their pasta dishes. Only comment is the price, very expensive if you just consider the food. My spaghetti alle vongole had about four clams. But again, delicious!
A wonderful Italian homemade pasta and delicious sauces I had a pizza for appetizer and it would taste delicious my eight-year-old really enjoyed it
No comment
No comment

Delicious Italian food. The orchiette pasta was amazing and clearly homemade. The margherita pizza was also very good. My cocktail was unique and delicious. The staff was very friendly and the decor of the place is really nice. Overall highly recommended.

We had dinner here after a day in NYC. The place had a nice vibe to it. Very clean and kind of a romantic atmosphere. The service was great. Very professional yet personable.  The craft cocktails were top shelf and our food was fantastic

The appetizer selection and the dessert menu was absolutely delicious. We had the tuna tartare and the burrata for the appetizer and tried the zeppoles, tiramisu and the chocolate budino for dessert they were all so well crafted and delicious.The service was a bit slow for a Saturday evening but, we weren't in a rush so we enjoyed our long dinner. The cocktails were also very good and the ambiance was very nice. Overall it's a very cute spot.

Recently had dinner here before going to a Broadway show. The food and cocktails were all 5/5 solid. Burrata especially was a great consistency and came with perfect bread for spreading. Margherita pizza was solid. For me, the atmosphere inside was just a bit too stuffy and pretentious. I'm sure for some people it wouldn't be a bother, it just wasn't my ideal vibe.
Came into the city for a trip with my father, and now we have this amazing experience to look back on! The food was delicious, service was impeccable and the atmosphere was perfect.

I came here for a business dinner and was looking forward to it but came out very disappointed. Ordered octopus as appetizer and it tasted rubbery (obviously overcooked) and had no seasoning. For entrée ordered fish of the day, which was rainbow trout. I asked waiter before ordering if it would come deboned and he said yes. I almost choked on first bite full of small bones! Inside the fish was filled of romero sticks! Didn't make any sense at all. Bottomline the fish tasted bland and wasn't able to get through because of fear of choking.  Also forgot to mention fish took 1 1/2 hr to arrive . It was a table of 20 people they were definitely not prepared for us. I ordered dessert because I was very hungry. The mascarpine which surely is not made here was delicious.

Delicious !  The restaurant is beautiful and the food was delicious.  Lamb chops is flavorful.  Lobster pasta was delicious  and the lobster meat was fresh. Budino was fantastic - chocolate pudding paired with raspberry.
No comment
No comment
Chef was accommodating, food was fantastic! Dave the server was also very knowledgeable. We'll be back!
Really enjoy the food! A little pricey but worth every bit. Definitely recommend trying the Arancini and the Short Rib Ravioli. So good!
No comment

The meal was delicious and ambiance was spectacular. The server and staff attend to your every need. Walter was an excellent server. The meal was delicious. Was a delicious lunch for my fiancé and I. Can't wait to dine here again.
Food was delicious with large servings. We ordered the tiramisu for dessert and it was wonderful, not too sweet and not to rich, just right!

For starters I live pretty close to this place, close enough that they invited everyone from my building for food as part of the opening so I was looking forward to dining here. My partner and I were told the only thing available was the bar we said that's fine and as we're awaiting the meal the manager (I assume this as he was wearing a suit, he was a heavy set man with glasses, light skin with dark hair) comes over to the hostess to emphasize no walk ins only reservations and she told him we walked in but she directed us to the bar now this was very distasteful because why are you having a conversation loud enough about your customers that they can hear you.. After hearing this I decided to check their reservation availability and they had tons of reservations for the exact time we were there and the rest of the evening in 30 minute increments. The bartender was nice, meatball was delicious, pasta was good yet sauce was a little off, chicken was just thighs (it was decent), steer clear of olive oil cake it tasted refrigerated as it was hard and cold. Limoncello daiquiri was good. Management needs to work on professionalism and customer service.
A really great midtown option. Have been here three times now, food is excellent and very fresh, nice waiters, lovely atmosphere. Highly recommend!

What a wonderful surprise we had, when we selected this restaurant on yelp. The atmosphere was warm and inviting the service was amazing, and most importantly the food was delicious. My husband loves osso bucco and he said it was the best he ever had. I on the other hand I'm a bolognese kind of person. The Bolognese was delicious. And then of course we had room for dessert, I had the Pana cotta which was smooth and tasty. My husband had the tiramisu which was very large and he really enjoyed it. We would recommend this restaurant to anyone. You won't be disappointed.

Had the pleasure of eating here last night. The restaurant is beautiful and the food is amazing. The service was on point. They made us feel so comfortable and made sure our glasses stayed full.  I had the Mushroom of the woods and my brother had the steak.  Both cooked to perfection. I definitely need to come back to try more of the menu

Living in NYC for over 40 years and having dined at fine restaurants over that time, I had high expectations for this restaurant.  Sadly, it fell short.  First the atmosphere. Osteria La Baia is beautifully decorated with high ceilings and a spaciousness that is appreciated. However, the noise level varies between high and deafening so depending on where you are seated, you will either be able to hear your guests comfortably or not. Now to the food. No doubt, there are highly skilled chefs in the kitchen. We ordered the Tuna Tartare, Vitello Tonnato, Lamb Chops and Duck Breast special. The tuna tartare was fine. It was 40% tuna and 60 percent avocado that was allegedly smoked but I couldn't tell. It was served with fruit slices and a small single sliver of toast. I would have appreciated bread for the tuna tartare but we had bread plates and knives but no bread on the table. The Vitello Tonatto was fine. When the appetizers were removed we asked about bread. We also mentioned that our water glasses were empty. A few minutes later, our bread arrived, the water glasses had been filled, the captain offered a complementary glass of wine to compensate for the issues. That was admirable but it would have been nice not to have the issues in the first place since they were simple. Then our entrees arrived. The duck was fine. The lamb chops ... well, none of the three were medium rare as ordered. One was medium, the other two were medium well. One was fatty but... they did have an excellent flavor and were nicely grilled. Then we were offered dessert and coffee. Our water glasses were once again empty but again, no one noticed. We ordered a dessert and were told that they were out of it. Now, if you are going to present a desert menu and you know a desert is not available, you really should mention it THEN. So we ordered an alternate dessert, the daily specail semifreddo. We ordered Illy Coffee that was on the menu and again, at the point of ordering, we were told that regular coffee wasn't available, only espresso or cappucino or americano. The dessert was fine and the espresso was excellent. Overall, a nice but noisy atmosphere; competent but inconsistent and variable kitchen, and the service? Well, I hate to say this but it would best be described as "Careless" and frankly, that is not acceptable for a restaurant at this price range. I doubt if I will be returning and I'd suggest that the kitchen staff look employment at other establishments where their expertise will be a part a fine dining experience.

This restaurant is an excellent choice. The service, food, ambiance, everything was spectacular. Our glasses never ran dry and we were treated so great!! We started with the burrata and it was delicious but so was everything else we had. If you are in the area, absolutely give this place a try!! We were there for a broadway show and it was just a short walk over with happy stomachs afterward !

From the moment you walk into Osteria La Baia, you know you're about to embark on an incredible dining experience. Service was top notch. The soup was perfectly balanced, meat & cheese plate was so much fun, and the mushroom truffle risotto was like a warm, comforting hug on a plate. If I could, I would eat every single meal here. Looking forward to coming back over and over. You don't want to miss this spot!

Had a reservation for three people at 1 PM and they graciously accepted us at 12:45 PM. Loved all of our food.  The burrata was great, as was the pappardelle Bolognese.  Our waiter understood our 1:45 PM hard stop but we never felt rushed.  Ambience and decor are lovely...like a small slice of the Amalfi Coast on West 52nd Street.  I will definitely be back.

Service was great snd the fish was exquisite. I didn't like my seating but when it's just two.. you don't get the better seats? I would love to go back again and would recommend it for 2 or more . It's was one of the highlights of my NYC trip.

Lovely spot for date night...food was excellent, we shared 3 dishes and they were delicious, especially the carpaccio. Highlight of the evening was the service. Everyone was so friendly and pleasant, they made us feel like regulars even though it was our first time. Walter made sure we had an exceptional experience and had great wine and food recommendations. Shout out to the young lady who recommended honey with the Quattro Formaggi, it was a perfect pairing. We'll be back soon!
The food was amazing I had ossobuco with polenta and was heavenly good and the service is even better, I recommend the restaurant to have the same great experience than mine

This upscale restaurant was beautifully decorated.  The prices were on the higher side.  But the food was delicious.  The skate was exceptional.  There were four people in our party and each person was happy with her meal.  The bread was good too.
Amazing food, great decor, excellent service, restaurant that is perfect for any occasion!

Really enjoyed this restaurant. Ambiance was awesome and perfect for date night. Waiters and rest of the staff were attentive and my water glass never went dry, which I loved. I got the Lobster Garganelli and my girlfriend got the Risotto. Both were delicious and good sized portions. We also tried the Burrata which was also very good. A manager also checked in on us which was nice. We recommend this and hope they do well.
Spectacular! The staff were so nice and so helpful and friendly! Great wine list. The food was out of this world. We shared a salad and had the best thin crust pizza in NY .

5 stars on the food and the ambience.  One tip though.  Do not order a drink without seeing the drink menu.  I requested a glass of Pinot Noir and gladly took the servers  recommendation.  However, he suggested a $28 dollar/glass of wine in which I had 2.   $56 later the wine was almost as much as our 2 entrees.   Well played gentlemen.  Well played!!
Such an amazing experience. The service was amazing and never mind the food being superb! Great ambiance as well. Go check this place out!
Wish could give six stars. Great amazing food absolutely amazing pasta and steak. Gorgeous ambiance amazing service. So highly recommend. Loved it!!!! Will go back often!

Made reservations for a pre show birthday dinner and had an amazing time. The food was delicious, the staff was very attentive. They even made sure a special birthday treat made it out in time for us to leave and make our show on time without being stressed.
Great food, attentive service and lively yet classy vibe. Get the Spaghetti Vongole....
Came here for Vday with my girlfriend and we loved it! Plenty of space, beautiful decor, and the food was delicious. Especially the wine, so good!

Wonderful service, excellent food. Sasha was our server and was so attentive and helpful. The table for 10 was spacious, which is lovely because some restaurants nearby really pack it in. Best risotto I've ever had in my life. Bartenders are the real deal. Loved the vibe - very happening and not at all pretentious.

The waitress seemed new but it was okay because she was great with getting the answers to our questions. The place is beautiful and larger than what you'd think. We had the grilled octopus, west coast oysters, and hazelnut soup to start -- all cooked well, the octopus was tender and not over cooked, the oysters were fresh, and the soup was perfect. For drinks we had a martini and wine. I enjoyed Carnaroli Risotto for my main and finished it off with sorbet, zeppole, and cognac.

This is a beautiful resturant that is becoming my go to place for business lunch.  Fabricio runs a very efficitent shop with excellant food in a stunning environment.  I ate there with my daughter and she had a Tonno Salad and I had the special red snapper cervechi and the Rigatoni Alla Norma.  All three were excellent.  I highly recommend this up and comer.

The experience was great overall. We were greeted warmly by the hostess Sheena, seated in the lounge and received excellent service from our waitress. The only thing that could be improved was the octopus. We found it rubbery and tough and the chef, Bryan,  made us a second one which was better but still not as tender as other octopus dishes we have had at other restaurants. All said and done, I would definitely go back."
Great food and service.   We celebrated Christmas party here and everyone had fun time.

Our server Miguel was very knowledgeable with the menu and what wine paired best. My partner loved the recommendation for her wine. I really appreciated how he paid attention to small details such as removing the crumbs from the table. We really thought it was special when the manager and staff came over to wish us a happy anniversary. I will definitely come back next time we are in town.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Great food, excellent service, wonderful wine all make for a good time. Such a cute, cozy yet modern restaurant. Truly excellent and can't wait to go back.

The food, ambiance, and the staff were all amazing!We were waited on by Sasha who was awesome. We also met the manager Ulysses who gave us great recommendations on what to do around the city. Overall such a great experience with incredible service and food.
What great dining experience!!! Fantastic food - top notch service. New restaurant in Midtown... but they have it figured out. Get here before reservations are hard to come by!!!

I tend to agree with several of the other posters. Not quite sure what all the fuss is about. Food was good but not great and prices were quite high for what you get. Our server was not interested at all. Even when we tried to engage she was brusque and not friendly in the least. I rarely review but this spot is sadly overrated in my view. We won't be going back.

Food was good but I didn't think it was worth the reservation hustle. I also agree with the other reviewers that the portions were smaller than expected. Granted - I wasn't expecting a Chinese takeout style portion, but the taste of the food wasn't remarkably complex for it to be portioned in that way. I loved the salt and pepper squid and fried rice, but the pepper steak chow mein tasted pretty average. The ice cream sundae was also fairly basic but it did satisfy my dessert craving.

Had a really great meal at Bonnie's. Highly recommend the mcrib, walnut shrimp, and mushroom sticky rice - all unique and delicious dishes. Docking a star because I felt the food was a little overhyped (the famous cacio e pepe was just ok) and it was way too tough to get a reservation

Going to have to call this one hype. None of the dishes quite "hit" for me. The oysters were drowned in toppings and lost any subtlety as the one note mignonette hit the palate. The honey walnut shrimp while executed flawlessly also fell flat. You can check out the rolled noodle dish cheung fun taking over a few places these days but piggyback bar has this one beat.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Some of the best Cantonese food I've had in the city, be sure to plan ahead as you need to make a reservation 2 weeks in advance. The char siu McRib is hands down a must order. They also were very welcome to special requests on some of the food (I asked the whole fish be uncut for a Lunar New Year tradition)
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pretty whatever about this place. Had the McRib, congee, and some other stuff that was all meh. Asked the bartender for chili oil and they looked at me like I had just told them I was a sex offender. Would probably have enjoyed it more if it wasn't so up its own ass and they let you sit at the (empty) bar to have a drink while you wait for your +1 to get there.
No comment

I thought the food was very good as were the drinks. The McRib was tasty, the long beans were delicious and the rice noodles were quite good as well. I love salt but I will note that everything was very salty especially the noodles and beans, I thought it was all very good regardless. We also tried the msg martini and the salted spritz both of those were really tasty. My biggest complaint would be the temperature in the restaurant, to be fair we went on one of the hottest days of the year, but it was almost unbearably hot inside.
No comment
