Would love to give Bonnie's 5 stars soon especially since they have such a cute backstory! Unfortunately I both called and emailed recently and wish they were just a bit more responsive.
No comment

Great place, relaxed atmosphere despite the level of food they are putting out. Reasonably priced, again for the level of food you are getting. Loved it. Servers were super nice and seemed to be happy working there. Got to give them a plus for that.

Justin is amazing!!! So attentive and fun. Let's get into the food. the crysyanthemum salad was a perfect palate cleanser and when we tasted the fresh oysters we immediately ordered 3 more. the orange wine bottle we ordered was the refreshing river that brought us to the immaculate dinner. THE MUSHROOM STICKY RICE!!!!!! We topped it off with the fish dish which put it over the top. This meal and experience was exquisite and we will come back for more.  --side note: as the birthday baby i receive the most delectable shot and utmost care from the well dressed and ever so classy bonnie sta
No comment

Exceptionalism on prime display--we thought we were special and wouldn't have to endure the overly salty dishes that many Yelpers have pointed out, but we were wrong. The cacio and pepe was absurdly salty!!! The jook (congee) was also a tad on the salty side. The oysters, chinese long beans, and honey walnut shrimp were all fantastic though. The drinks here are colorful and tasty -- we got the ribena highball and riptide and enjoyed them both. ALSO, just an FYI that the bathroom is basically a mini club-- the music is very loud in there, and the lights change colors. Overall, I would come back but I would not feel like I was missing anything if I never do

Love at 1st sip and 1st bite! Bonnie's is a Cantonese American restaurant in Brooklyn that serves nostalgic Hong Kong classic comfort dishes I ate growing up but with an American flare. The restaurant is very reminiscent of a 茶餐厅(Cha Chan Teng, a Hong Kong-style diner) with a very hipster Brooklyn interpretation. Also like a typical Hong Kong style diner, the restaurant was loud and lively.

Great meal at Bonnie's. Squid ($17) were crispy and light. I don't have a wok so this is a dish that I can't make at home. The lettuce bed was not soggy and the ranch dressing was on the runnier side but still good. 9/10. The Cha Siu McRib ($27) was much bigger than a regular McRib at McDonald's. It is a full sandwich. The hoisin sauce adds a smoky flavor and the thick cut pickles are fresh and really help counteract the sweetness and richness of the meat. Be warned that there is hot mustard on this sandwich and it's not evenly distributed so you may get a bite that's much spicier than the other bites. A wasabi-like level of spiciness. It isn't as fatty and juicy like a similarly priced Katz's deli sandwich. With this price, maybe value isn't its strong point, but it's pretty well executed. 8/10. The sundae ($12) was a nice way to end the meal. It's very unique, as the fried malted milk pieces were something I'd not had before. Buttered peanuts added more texture, which was good here. Normally I am hesitant to add nuts to sundaes, for fear that they will hurt the roof of my mouth, but these didn't. They were finely chopped. Ovaltine hot fudge was pretty sparse. I prefer regular hot fudge. 8/10. Service was prompt and friendly. Surprisingly busy on a Tuesday night. Maybe folks are going out to eat more these days, ahead of the transmissible BA5 wave which could elicit new lockdowns.
No comment
No comment

Overall good meal but they didn't tell us in advance that we'd be seated outside (it didn't specify on Resy) and the outdoor seating is simply plastic tables and chairs with heat lamps... the lackluster atmosphere definitely takes away from the experience. Highlights were the shrimp dish and long beans, skip the McRib.

Food is fairly good but it's way overpriced. Decor is not great as others have mentioned. Some of the dishes are fairly standard Cantonese fare (e.g. the shrimp with walnuts) and others are indeed more creative/modern (the cacio and pepe turned out way better than I would have guessed).
No comment

Great experience at Bonnie's. Food was delicious inventive and prepared perfectly. My favorite was the squid, perfectly crispy and super flavorful seasoning. Loved the chicken broth and the mushrooms and sticky rice too. The cacio e pepe was kind of a fun take but leaned more heavily towards being a faithful rendition of the dish. It was really good albeit maybe jived together less with the rest of the meal. The char siu McRib was tasty and prepared well I enjoyed it but I wouldn't go back for it, didn't really do much for me or add anything interesting. I would rather just get an actual char siu bun. The only dish I really didn't super enjoy was the stuffed whole trout. The flavors were nice but the meatloafy consistency wasn't for me. I got the black penicillin cocktail which was excellent. Service was great. My only real gripe is that their outdoor set up is not really suitable for cold weather. They have some blankets but it's not enclosed enough and the heaters just aren't strong enough for a cold night. Don't think they should offer the outdoor dining in the winter if they don't have the setup to make it comfortable enough. Loved the meal but sitting out on the cold definitely detracted a bit. Overall great experience, would recommend.
No comment

Every dish was spectacular and super creative. I've had Chinese green beans a million times but they felt special and so elevated for some reason at Bonnie's. Noodles were literally the perfect texture and chewiness. I like that they are thick  Also, prices aren't bad!

Take it for what it is and not what you want it to be, and you will certainly enjoy it here. Been twice and have enjoyed the food + service immensely both times! The Long Beans and XO noodles my fave both times. And the Fried milk pudding and Ovaltine ice cream is amazing. Extra points for their playlists

Absurdity is a perfect word to describe Bonnie's. I am appalled at the prices of the dishes for a poor take at Cantonese food. There is NOTHING that is traditional or authentic about this Cantonese food. If you want culture and authenticity, Bonnie's is not that. The food and prices are fitting for the Williamsburg demographic: a group that has zero knowledge on Cantonese food. None of the staff members are Cantonese let alone Asian. If you want gentrified food that costs more than an arm feel free to go to Bonnie's. Objectively speaking, the taste of the food isn't bad, but the price for what it is is atrocious. These prices really makes the person believe in inflation that's for sure. Got damn walnut shrimp had oranges in it smfh. Better off going to Chinatown, flushing, dyker, 86 st Brooklyn and etc for more authentic food. If you wish to support TRUE culture, this is NOT it. My mom would've got a heart attack seeing what Bonnie's has done to our cultures food.

Can't believe how much hype... it's terrible. Overcooked, seasoned and small portions. We would never go again and question if we should speak to management. Everyone left feeling off too. Food is not good and the only saving grace is service is fast.
really overrated and overly sauced food, the portions are small and the prices are 30% higher now they've gotten in the mich guide.
No comment
For a great number of us, it will be like revisiting disneyworld. The rides are all more sophisticated now but so are we. And we really like that.

This place is overhyped and completely overrated. We had the crispy fried squid (way too salty), the Chow Mein (peppers and meat didn't taste like much), and the Cheung Fun (extremely greasy). It really all tasted the same, and just like strong MSG and nothing more. No complex flavors, sophistication, or quality ingredients. Most places in Chinatown deliver this mediocre quality for half the price. We have no idea why this spot is so in demand. It cannot be for the food that's evident, but must be for hype and a certain coolness factor. We will stay away from it!

It's ok. Overpriced for sure and sooooo much hype it is hard to live up to. Had similar dishes recently in Elmhurst that run circles around the offerings here. Team works hard, kitchen cares, everyone is on their shit. Not their fault the likes of Eater and Infatuation and even the Times these days review the vibes and cool factor of a place and not the actual food. Again, it is fine food, but money is tighter and tighter these days - quality and quantity are not worth it.

I was really excited to try this restaurant. It's so hard to get a reservation but I'm really not sure why. The only thing that was good was the drinks. The food was very greasy, salty and just wasn't good. We don't finish our entrees. I definitely won't be coming back here.

The delivery menu is very limited, but that is the least of Bonnie's problems. We ordered the chicken nuggets which looked and tasted old. The breading was slightly rancid and the dipping sauce tasted store bought. We ordered the rib sandwich, the bun was soggy and in general everything was very unappetizing. And those two items were over  fifty dollars and took over an hour to delivery three blocks away.

Good but overhyped. Maybe I'm biased because I just spent a week eating in extraordinary, inexpensive Queens restaurants with my family. I'm not sure if the Infatuation is rating restaurants solely on vibes. Food was ok. I ordered the oysters, salt and pepper squid, long beans, cacio e pepe, Cheung fun, and ice cream.

Ugh, I wanted to like this place so much but it was underwhelming. I tried booking a rez here for months and was disappointed when I finally ate here. The best bites were the long beans and rice rolls and everything else was above average at best. This place is a lot of hype. Good meal, but not for the price.
The food and staff are so amazing that they are worth a yelp review! One of my top restaurants. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

Wowwww! Amazing from the gin msg martini, clams, mc rib, to the service. Everything was out of this world. Walked in at 5:30 on a Saturday, waited 30 mins before they seated us at a table and gave us the most delicious shooters on the house. Will be returning to try more menu items
every single thing was amazing. long beans and shrimp are a must. and if you like dirty martinis the msg martini is for you. also had a great playlist and staff
No comment
No comment

I stopped by here before a show and the set up is cute. They had nice music playing but it wasn't too loud. The waiter Nesto was super friendly and attentive, service was 10/10. Would def recommend stopping by.
No comment
No comment
Stopped Here On my way to an event . I'm giving 5 because it's just good energy - drinks are good. Looks good in here too. Def will come back and put this in my radar

Dropped in for a quick lunch snack. Nice and cool with AC, relaxed stylish environment and friendly prompt service. Had some fresh oysters with great sauces, drinks were solid, chili cheese fries over the top good. Place has a great vibe to it and everyone seemed to be enjoying the afternoon.
No comment

A very cute spot! Felt like I stepped back in time. Great bar tender! Wish the olives were pitted. Oysters were a bit on the small side but still good. The cheese burger was cooked exactly to my liking of rare. Overall really enjoyed OTB!

Fun place in Williamsburg to grab a cocktail and a small bite before heading to Baby's Alright or to any of the delicious restaurants in the neighborhood. Definitely recommend coming here and ordering a martini or a stiff Manhattan!
It was ok nothing special. The decor is absolutely stunning but that's about it, def nothing to write home about lol

Soupy oysters and bitter parcha cocktails no thanks. Ordered a tiki drink (i know, i know why would I do that there, never good) which came in a bourbon glass and didn't taste as described at all although I did get a whiff of cinnamon occasionally which was nice. My partner's frozen marg did however come in my tiki cup (it was cute) yet like my cocktail was tart (the passion fruit was not ready for harvest). The oyster tasted like they came straight from a salt mine and the vinaigrettes, well I'd rather not comment on that atrocity. Overall I'm beyond sad as I've been wanting to go here for years but there's always somewhere better calling me and well  now I know why my gut told me never to come. Sadly I'll say stay clear if you don't have funds to just waste nilly willy.

This was my second time coming here. The drinks are really good & strong. The cherry bomb & margaritas are good drink choices. The oysters are so good, maybe even the best I've had. Even better if you catch the $1 happy hour special (which sadly they don't do anymore). We got the grilled lemon wings which were a little bland & not so lemony. The chicken nuggets are so good & flavorful, definitely recommend. Would definitely return to try some of the entrees.
No comment
The staff were great and so was the food, drinks and atmosphere! I highly recommend otb

Got here around 4pm on a Saturday and they let us know we can seat ourselves since we were the only guests. However, by the time we were leaving, the place was packed.  The decor was super cute! It still has summer vibes the first week of October. We ordered 2 frozen painkillers, the OTB burger and the fried spicy chicken wings. Everything was great. The burger was juicy. The wings weren't really spicy, but flavorful. Drinks were pretty good.

I loved OTB - the service was quick, the margarita was strong, they gave me an extra oyster on the house and the wings were very tasty! The biggest seller for me though was that the next day I was walking by in a completely different outfit and the waiter said, "No wings today?" and laughed. THAT is stellar service. Will be returning.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: This place is such a vibe! Friendly staff and amazing music. The chicken nuggets are a must - super juicy and flavorful!

What a great find. A friend had heard this was a location to try their margaritas. So we did! After a walk across the bridge we sat in their outside located tables and ordered two strawberry margaritas and one raspberry. Very tasty and strong too. We proceeded to order some food later. We had chicken nuggets, super crunchy and they come with honey mustard and bbq sauce and French fries.  So far the food was flavorful and portions plentiful. I noticed on my way to the bathroom there was a chalkboard noting they sold $1 oysters Sunday through Thursday, and that is my favorite. We ordered one round of 9 oysters , and YUMMM served with a cocktail sauce mixed with horseradish. So yes, we ordered more oysters (12). Absolutely delicious! A great find after a great afternoon of walking and girl talk!
The absolute best dirty martini in Brooklyn. Hands down. When I say we have tried them all, we have tried them all. You won't be disappointed.
No comment
No comment

This has been my go-to spot for drinks, brunch and wings for years now. We even hosted our wedding after party here. Incredible food (I always get the plain fried wings), cocktails, and best customer service. The owner is involved in the everything and you feel the love. They're also now delivering!
Delicious drinks, food and amazing service. Next time I'm New York I'll be back here with friends. Dope spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
LOVE!! Oysters were soooo fresh and delicious! Also had their fried hot wings, yumm! Drinks were great as well!

Came to OTB during happy hour on Taco Tuesday and it was great! When I walked in, I was able to grab a seat at the bar with my friend. Their happy hour is great and has something for everyone. I grabbed one of their $8 negroni and later $9 margarita. The bartender was great and hospitable! I did not get a chance to grab food but will definitely next time.
Horrible service. Even worse Margaritas. The waiter was rude, and didn't care at all about our order.
Very poor experience, strange vibe, food made me sick. Drinks were expensive and below average. I never leave negative reviews but this place is not good. 2 stars because they have a pool table

We're glad this place is still open for delivery because they consistently have good food. Their wings are amazing, especially the blue cheese sauce that accompanies it. They would probably be better fresh, but still satisfying delivered. The batter of the chicken nuggets is light and crunchy. And the Mac and cheese is very flavorful. We love ordering from here to satisfy cravings for wings and comfort food!
No comment
No comment
The grilled chicken wings are to die for! The service also rocks. Staff is always super friendly and they're always so quiz with drinks! Great place to go on a weeknight.
No comment
No comment

This is such an underrated cocktail spot. It's perfect to sit outside at on a warm day- they have a cute set up with tables and yummy bar food like wings and oysters. Lots of summery drinks too, like an awesome mojito and plenty of frozen drinks.

Came here to have some oysters and beer. I was pleasantly surprised when I saw they had fried pickle chips!!! I had just came from omasil in the city that had offered delicious blue points for $1 so I was expecting the $3 oysters at otb to be better but it was neither better or worse. My friend and I ordered about 3 dozen . But I would've rather paid the $1 for the blue points.  the fried pickle chips were delicious!!! I will definitely be back for those! Atmosphere and staff very nice and quick. Pricing was not cheap.
Why aren't you here yet?! The cocktails are expertly made and with great attention to detail. Oysters are lovely and plump, which is not always what you get at other $1 oyster spots.
No comment
WOWOWOW!!! We stopped by for oysters and a snack. The reviews are true! Oysters were amazing and the wings incredible. The margarita was the best we've have in a while
I love this bar. Thats it. The wings are incredible. The drinks are delicious
No comment
No comment
No comment

You win Brooklyn  *shrug* .  I now have a reason to make the trek back over.  Found OTB after I got tired of being pushed around the dance floor in Bembe.  THANK GOD we left!! OTB is super chic with just the right amount of maturity.  I asked for a strong beverage and Russell recommended the TKO. It totally lives up to it's name.  At one point I just sat there and asked a friend to pass me my water *insert real tears* . The TKO was so yummy.  I enjoyed my drink with the mac & cheese.  This is not "Karen's mac & cheese."  It's quite possible that someone named Wanda or Shirley made it (you know what I mean). Nom nom nom. I love the ambiance and the service.  Hopefully I can come back for date night.  Additionally,  this place is really affordable.
No comment
No comment

Excellent cocktail bar! Had drinks with a friend here and we both loved what we ordered. We didn't do food but would definitely go back for the drinks. They had a few happy hour deals for drinks and wings. We sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and recommended good drinks. Atmosphere was great, very fun spot for for drinks. Definitely going back!  Added bonus, they use paper straws!
My boyfriend and I loveeee OTB. We always end up here after date night and have to get the oysters. Their Mac and cheese is also super flavorful! Always great service and great conversation!

Outdoor seating available. Great service and the oysters were some of the best I've had. The margaritas are also really tasty! I had the raspberry margarita and friends had the strawberry one, which according to them was delicious.

Stopped here for a drink and a quick eat. Love the atmosphere. Quiet enough to have a conversation w solid tunes in the back ground. Our drinks came out ten minutes after we got the chili cheese fries were ordered. Drinks were ok. Not very strong. But chili cheese fries were excellent. Crispy fries with tasty chilly and rich cheese. Enjoyed the zing from the jalepenos aa well. I'd definitely come again to try more of the food.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The service made me feel well taken care of, the aesthetics of the restaurant were creative and interesting. I felt comfy and the restroom sign is...interesting (you'd have to come see it). While my food was well prepared it felt like they used too much spice. Not that it was burning hot, but the fries and burger used similar blends and I found myself resorting to the condiments and water much more than I usually would to try to clear my palette. A friend in my party said that even her drink was spicy. I really enjoyed the restaurant beside this.

I've been coming to OTB for the past 4 years and I have never had a bad experience.  It's hard to fine a place in nyc that has fresh oysters and  this is the place to go to. They sometimes in the week they have 1$ oysters they are delicious. I have also had the Mac and cheese, fried pickles, French onion soup, OTB burger and the Coconut curry mussel. Every in there menu is delicious and every time I bring a friend they always come back and they love it. There food is not the only thing that is good there mix drinks are  good as well. If you like great food and drinks come to OTB.

While walking through town we stopped here for some mimosas after breakfast. They were good, not overly strong but not like drinking pure orange juice. Just enough to quench your thirst. I haven't tried the food but will have to next time after seeing the pictures people have posted here on yelp. When my party and I came the place was fairly empty but it was early. The bartender was super attentive. The bar had an overall good vibe - not to mention I fell in love with the decor!
No comment
No comment
Waiter was super nice and attentive but the food and drinks were verrrrry average and not a great value for the price.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Everything is good on the dinner menu. Anything bar food related is awesome. Also, who can say no to dollar oysters? Just, don't go for brunch.
No comment
I love this place! From the vibe to the drinks to the best bar food, I can honestly say I always leave happy. Nights are an intimate setting, so great for a first date. Can't wait to go back!

I love the ambiance of this place. I've been here several times with company and alone and both times have had a good time. The bartenders are stellar and the service is so inviting. Jameson and Amber have become my go to each time I go. They welcome me with open arms and chat me up each time I'm there. Thursdays are ideal for me because they have awesome specials. Their half off wine bottle deal is the best!!! You can literally have your own Wine bottle and dinner all for a really reasonable price. They often times play movies and have a great selection of music to groove to. Love it!

I've been here many times, and I'm always disappointed in the service. I think service is very dismissive and the servers always seem to come to a table, take 1 order and turn and run. I'm never comfortable when I come here and just think it should be addressed because I think the vibe is nice and the beverage program is decent.

Came here for a pre-concert drink. It's one great looking bar, spacious, with one of the biggest bar areas in town.  Bartender was nimble and nice. I had a $12 scotch cocktail which tasted like a whiskey sour. It was perfectly balanced and tasty.  Will come again, probably for the advertised dollar oysters.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Yum!! I loved this place. Such a cool atmosphere. I sat right at the bar and the bartenders were fast and really great at recommending drinks. I got the burger which was also delicious, I just wish it had been a little bigger! I'm rarely in Williamsburg, but this place definitely had BK vibes. Highly recommend and will be back next time Im in the area!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Me and my girlfriend came in and you guys were packed went to the bar and got a drink then both Lindsey and Ron both helped us get a table and took great care of us! Made it a very enjoyable experience! So glad we came and can't wait to come back!

Came for drinks with a couple of our friends and really enjoyed it. We tried a bunch of the cocktails and really enjoyed them. The atmosphere is nice and laid back. Our waitress was also really nice but had to go back to the bar a few times to ask about certain liquors. We started getting hungry so we ordered a few appetizers and LOVED them all. The fried pickles as well as the oysters were delicious. I am not a big pickle fan and I still could not stop eating them. I would defiantly recommend coming here for drinks and a bite.
No comment

Try OTB.  It's a great neighborhood gastro pub with delicious comfort food as well as surprising gourmet dishes.  I loved the salmon crudo, fresh oysters, and salad with Burrata (best I've ever had).  OTB has an extensive bar menu, too.  Try their cocktails.  You can come alone or with family and friends.  They serve lunch and dinner and Sunday brunch ( a definite must-try).  Look for changes in the menu and if Chef Sammy is available, have a friendly chat with him.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Loved this place til they double-charged my credit card, said they'd fix it, then stopped responding to my emails.  Can't call to address this! Very disappointing after spending a lot of time and money here!

Came here on a Friday night for a date night and really enjoyed the spot. The food was good, service was great and drinks were delicious. I found this place on yelp because I wanted something nearby home. I was offered an old menu drink in a cute disco ball tumbler and I enjoyed it. Oysters were great, they have some good deals.  I would definitely come back.
No comment
No comment

God, I love this place.  Excellent food, drinks, and service, consistently. I came in with my dad last fall and had a great meal.  Fast forward 6 months and the waiter asked me where my dad was.  Now that is legitimately incredible that a server would remember that in a place that is always busy after so long.  And thats just the service.  The food is excellent as well.  The fried, spicy wings are the best buffalo style wing I have ever had.  True to the traditional buffalo style flavor while being tender on the inside and crisp on the outside.  Pro tip, get the wings and a side of fries and dip the fries in the extra wing sauce and blue cheese.  Perfection.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Definitely get the cheeseburger. One of the best burgers I've ever had. The spiked hot chocolate was fabulous
One of my faves in that part of Brooklyn. Love the drinks. And the folks that run the place are really tops.
No comment

My favorite bar in Williamsburg. My first time here, I wanted a small snack of oysters to treat myself before I got on a plane for a funeral. I was a mess. There was a female bartender who I haven't seen since and she convinced me to get a drink--and then three. A dozen oysters became two, with fries. I was alone. I could've done more but I had to pack. I've always come with groups of three since and haven't been able to sit at the bar so I don't really know the personality of the other bartenders. And the servers sometime seem a little annoyed--probably because we are the only people eating late-night but whatever they're just tired. The drinks have always been decent, some yays some nays (we stfu and finish them all) but this place will always hold a soft spot in my heart because of that amazing bartender my first time here.

Awesome spot!  Great atmosphere, staff, vibe and eclectic crowd. Food and signature cocktails were out of this world. We had the freshest Oysters and amazing Lobster Rolls! Combined with signature cocktails, our three-hour dinner was about as good as it gets! Thank you for a perfect night!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I usually go to OTB for drinks but last evening I decided to have some food. I was sitting at the bar and ordered the ceviche. I said to the waitress/bartender that Im very allergic to gluten and could she check if I could have the ceviche. She said fine, brought it out. I looked at it and asked "is that soy sauce? I could get very sick. I can't have gluten." She checked and said yes and took it away. I then asked If i could have the dish without soy sauce and gluten free, she said she'd check and yes. She brought it out, I ate it, It was very good and then this morning I am very sick with a reaction. SO, whether the fault of her not being diligent or the cook not knowing what a gluten allergy is, don't go here if you're sensitive and could get sick. Because either way, they don't care.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has typical-American fare - nothing too fancy, but it hits the spot - but the key is they have an extensive drink and cocktail list, all tasty, all made with TLC - this makes it a fun night out. And they cater for groups!
No comment
An awesome drink menu with some really unique concepts... it comes in an old patient folder labeled "Alcohol Incident Log" which I really got a kick out of. They also have $1 oysters! SIGN ME UP!

Wow! Stumbled in here because Luger's didn't the cards... this place is amazing! The food is phenomenal. What a deceiving little place. Oysters fresh and crisp, steak frites delicious and cooked to perfection. The fries yum! Will be back! Me and my other friends were very impressed. Cool vibe good service too.

We had such a great lunch celebrating my mom. Jennifer was our server and she was exeptional, drinks refilled before they were empty, checked on us multiple times, and had great recommendations for food! If you go ask for her service for sure!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Friday or Saturday night with a friend. She had a glass of wine and I ordered some asparagus salad thing! The asparagus was good BUT, it took a seriously long time for them to get a salad out- my friend was basically finished with her glass of wine. Other than that no complaints.

Really nice place. Great atmosphere. I tried many things from the menu and everything tastes great especially for the bar. Once I even had a chance to eat their $1 oysters which were great as well. Small but fresh! Great selection of alcohol and waitress is nice. One of my favorite places.

Horrible service. The waiters specifically waitress have horrible attitudes and make it clear once they are off the clock they can barely maintain being decent human beings. Food is ok. Nothing about this place is special so I'd rather dine somewhere that has great service and food. Even for a bar/burger place one can do much better.

Came here on the recommendation of several friends.   The place is cute and the service is awesome.  The 2 stars is for the food.   I had the worst "lobster roll" ever.   It was soooo diced up I really am unsure when it was cooked, how fresh it was.   I didn't want the server to take it back because I wanted to give it a chance.   It sucked.  I probably won't ever come here for food again.  But I would definitely come here for drinks and to hang out.

Really, really good food. We had the scallops and the burger.  Food was great....portion sizes are small and leaves you wanting more cause the food is so good. Great whiskey and tequila selection. Small wine selection. Food is cooked to order, so takes a little while to be served. But worth the wait.  Music selection is also very appropriate. Loved it!

This is my go-to neighborhood bar. Love it!! Great dollar oyster special on Mondays. Awesome movies playing: always. Nice bites and a great ginger drink they make special for me. Service is great and I love how the bathroom has louder speakers...gives you a chance to really break it down in private before you head out back to your party.
No comment
I have eaten here twice with friends. Love the cozy atmosphere. Definitely a place to bring friends if you just want to talk in a chill place over good eats.

Came here after grabbing an early dinner at Peter Luger's. Bar has a diner feel. Place was kind of empty for happy hour. I got the staycation cocktail, which was OK. It's quiet and not that busy. Good place to catch up with friends.

I love this place. The food is good and the drinks are gorgeous. I really enjoy having a beautifully prepared alcoholic beverage delivered to me while I watch 70's movies. Decor is vintage and fabulous and I like the oyster special. (Not always crazy when the DJ o.d.'s on hip hop because it's a little jarring in such a relaxed place but it doesn't happen too often.)

OTB I'm sure is a way cool spot if you've got the cash to spend on $7-$8 basic beers (not even craft), or $12-$14 cocktails. My wife and I don't, but we were invited here by friends so we went with the flow. Their cocktail list is decidedly better than their beer or wine list, with very esoteric selections compared to the vary pedestrian beer list. The food we ordered was fine, just some fries and other small plates. Service was excellent for Wburg- no pretentious waitstaff here, very down to earth helpful people. The space is big and dark, and the evening we went it was very very cold in the restaurant (front section). If you've got the bank account and you're in the area stop in and get a cocktail.
Great date night spot! It's bit pricey, but it's Williamsburg. Great location off of Broadway with an awesome menu.
The mac and cheese is great for when you drunkenly leave Baby's All Right after a show. This is all I know.
Cocktails are DELCIOUS!! The pimm's colada was DELICIOUS and the happy hour special rule!
Excellent food and drinks.  I loved the cheeseburger.  A great place to hang out at the bar or with friends at the tables, very affordable, and satisfying portions.
No comment
Extensive liquor list and staff who know them. Best scallop ceviche we've ever had. Craft bacon. Need I say more?
This place is a bar. They do cocktails right and serve burgers, fries and mussels and a couple other food items. That's it - not sure what the fuss is about? All good, but not that interesting.
No comment
the mac and cheese is everything. stride of pride and the basil explosion are SO good. the inside is cute and i always have the best time here.
Great place! I got the danger zone and it was great. The staff is super friendly, and the interior is really beautiful.

I came here for happy hour on the Thursday evening before the 4th and really had a great experience.  I can't speak to the cocktails, but the happy hour was a good deal ($3 tall boy Tecanta and half priced wings), and the wings were hands down the best I've had in New York.  I went with the grilled in their hot sauce and the sauce was amazing and the wings themselves were quite large.  The addition of fennel on the side instead of the usual celery was creative and yummy.  I will definitely be back and would recommend this to anyone who is a wing fan but likes to get sauce all over their face in a classy atmosphere.
The siracha brussel sprouts and coconut curry mussels were amazing!  My husband loved his OTB burger as well.  The apple cider hot toddy was good.  Service was good.  Really enjoyed this place!

Came for a late lunch and I was really impressed. The food was truly delicious, subtle and fresh. Some plates on that menu are worth 1 Michelin star or the highest Zagat praises for sure. The service was immaculate. A big surprise and great discovery!

I love this bar! I usually come during the week but happened to be out with friends for the holidays on Saturday night. It was quieter than I expected but the food and drinks were amazing as always! The hostess? Was really fun and had a good energy about her but our server had that all too typical Williamsburg attitude. Felt like she was inconvenienced the whole time. Either way  it's not enough to keep me from coming back on my usual nights! If you love great cocktails and a beautiful atmosphere this is the place to be!

Laid back ambiance and amazing drinks. Came here for a date night with the hubby on a Friday night before heading to Motorino, we sat at the bar. Place wasnt too packed, which was cool with me. We ordered some drinks, the pickle platter, and the wings bc who can resist happy hour wings?? Everything was on point, the drinks were some of the best Ive had in a long time; I forgot the names but it had honey gin and lemon in it. The bartenders were friendly and attentive, couldnt ask for anything more! We will def be coming back.
No comment
This place is the greatest. Good everything. Selection, cocktails, food, bartenders, all stellar. Such a treat!

I've eaten here a few times.  It's a great place to take friends who are looking for something for everyone.  The wings are amazing.  Tried some rum cocktail that wasn't so good but their overall selection is great. Fine service. For the food and the room, I'd say 4 stars.
Great decor, great drinks, great ambiance, fair prices, good service. What else could you ask for in a neighborhood bar?

Very impressed!! I came up from Philly to visit the BF, and I had randomly chosen to go to OTB from what I saw/read on Yelp. I was definitely not disappointed!! I got a burger and he got the steak frites. His steak was cooked perfectly and my burger was juicy and had great flavor. We also split some oysters which tasted really fresh! We asked our waitress if she could bring us 2 shots of vodka (with a little room at the top) to go with our oysters, so that we could make oyster shooters (i know i know, but trust me, they are amazing!) and I definitely appreciated that the waitress did NOT look at us like we had 3 heads! They had an extensive booze list, especially for whiskey lovers. My favorite part was that they kept playing hits from the 90's, yesss! Oh, and they were also playing a silent film in B&W above the door on a projector, which was also really cool. I'm a new fan, and I will definitely be back! Nice job, Brooklyn!
Love the cocktails and the BURGER!!! Super fun at the weekends and very nice and chilled during the week. Perfect spot!
Great cocktails, pleasant and chill atmosphere, and good food. What more do you need?

This is a really nice looking bar with really nice bartenders. What's also really nice is $1 oysters all night on Mondays! And they were delicious! This would probably be an even nicer deal if you made it in time for their happy hour. I have only had oysters and wine here, so not sure about any other food and drink offerings at this time. Anyway, I had a really nice time at OTB.

I am selfishly thinking I won't review this place so nobody else will know about it, but what the hell, you will all find out anyway.  Everything about this place made me happy.  The space is lavish but comfortable, with plenty of room and awesome details.  The drinks are smart, tasty and well priced.  We had several of the dishes and they were all great, but the chicken wings were probably the best I had ever had.  The Post Office crew did it again.  Total win.

Imaginative and consistently excellent takes on classic. Great cocktail list and the team works together to make your visit memorable. Go for the drinks, stay for the food! Dig on the music, it is a nice place for friends and a date...

I really, really want to be able to give them a 5 bc the staff is so friendly and so much fun, the decor fabulous and the drinks amazing.  Unfortunately, the wings I ordered came under cooked and their menu is sadly lacking in vegetables.  So as a bar fantastic, as a restaurant needs improvement, averaging out to good.
Great ambiance, amazing food (chicken wings tie with Pok Pok for best in NY), great music, badass staff and the lighting will make your date look better than they should. What more do you want?
Oysters were super fresh. Go for the Oysters. Try the watermelon beer. Taste like a light beer with a light watermelon aftertaste. Awesome.
$1 oysters and $4 tall boys, enough said
I recommend the escargot and the scallop ceviche. Lobster roll was very tasty but not super lobster-y. Staff was very nice and there was a nice wine selection.

Drinks are awesome. Food is awesome (FROG LEGS, YES). And the staff rules. They also have a late night $1 Oyster special, which is a little fancy for me- by that time of night all I want are more wings and more wings. Hey, so the wings are great! But don't do that grilled sh*t. FRIED. SPICY. BUFFALO. WINGS. ONLY. YOU'RE. WELCOME.

I love the vibes and the fact that they play old school hip hop. The burger is amazing and they make a great cocktail- I usually get the dirty martini or the Busted Betty. Its a great spot to come to if you're trying to have a chill evening with a few friends for reasonably priced food and drinks. It's my favorite neighborhood joint.

Love it! One of my favorites in Williamsburg. Great decor, excellent music, yummy cocktails, amazing selection of whiskeys (and any other Liqour you can think of) and thê waiters/waitresses are super fun! And best of all!!! $1 oysters after midnight!
Really fun, but somewhat chill atmosphere. There were was great whiskeys the the bartender poured an excellent martini. Love the atmosphere. I definitely plan on returning.

Two plates of grilled wings and a salad to share, and maybe an interesting vegetable side off the menu. First time we went their drink menu didn't match what was behind the bar (super frustrating to ask for 4 different whiskeys and they are all out). But, happy to say the last experience was great. Good wine good food.
No comment
horrible food poisoning after having frog legs here. never again.
ate there on Friday. Delicious. great cocktails, good beer, place was packed. beautiful decor...

We felt very welcome from the moment we walked in. The staff is so friendly and courteous! Our server, Sheena was VERY knowledgeable and recommended drinks and dishes that hit the spot! We sat at the high top chef's counter, and kitchen staff was very real and down earth. You could tell that they all loved what they were doing. Sous chef, Aries, made us complimentary deserts. She was awesome! We even had the honor of having the infamous Marcus Samuelsson come to our table and struck up a conversation. The overall experience definitely made our night! I would definitely recommend!

Way out in west Chelsea, which is decidedly not charming, you have Marcus Samuelsson's newest restaurant...which is stylish yet welcoming. Staff were all friendly and attentive...they were very well staffed, so anyone passing by the table cleared plates and refilled water glasses. Our actual server was both lovely and very knowledgeable about the menu and the components used, able to answer any and all questions. We ordered two small plates to share. The blue corn bread was skillet style and came with a sour butter flavored with a Japanese pepper spice providing a surprise back of your throat heat. The Seafood and Waffles was an interesting composition, but it worked. The mussels were chilled. The octopus were room temperature with a bright lemony note. The bass was fried with I believe a light cornmeal batter, as were the shrimp. All were atop warm cornbread waffles dripping with a maple syrup with chimichurri seasoning which worked to denude some of the maple sweetness. The waffle also had uni butter flavoring it as well. Three of us split the plate, but there wasn't three of everything so my wife and I split a rock shrimp. For our three entrees, we chose Roasted Green Garden Curry , H&T Roasted Chicken, and Corn Wrapper Snapper. The green curry had a delightful lightness brought to it from coconut milk and a touch of lime. The chicken had crisp skin while maintaining sufficient moisture, but more importantly were the crispy Brussels sprouts with a touch of sweetness from black currants. The snapper was a definite do-over thanks in no small part due to a brilliant lime forward salsa verde spread over the cornmeal batter. Dinner was a big hit.

Service and ambiance were great, drinks were fine, and three dishes we quite enjoyed were the Addis York, she crab soup and sea bass. Overall, portions were way too small and the food was not good enough to warrant the high price point.
No comment

Let me start by saying the service was phenomenal. Our server was spot on with everything. Had the bread basket, hamachi, waffle, and grand jubilee. Overall I enjoyed it I was just not floored. I think this place is certainly worth coming back to and I will. There were other things on the menu I wish I tried. The portion size is a bit on the small side, so keep that in mind. Drinks were really good too. Overall worth coming for after work for an interesting meal.

They got everything there. The food, the ambience, the drinks and the staff are all top notch. It's a Marcus Samuelson restaurant so you already know what to expect. I loved everything about it. The regular menu items all taste amazing. I don't even like Brussels sprouts but everything the touch tastes exquisite. Just go.

I was really excited to try Marcus's new restaurant but unfortunately this experience fell short. The food was not great (with the exception of the scallops!). They also say it's all family style but the portions for most dishes are too small to share with a group.
No comment

I probably ordered too much food... But I loved everything about this - which is saying a lot for me because I've found his other restaurants just to be okay. It's Ethiopian inspired with a heavy seafood lean. At first glance on the menu and on Yelp, I couldn't find much that jumped out to try. Our waitress was really helpful. The Havitelli was amazing - has an unexpected spice. The Grand Jubilee was amazing, however it is very filling for 2 people. We had a reservation and had to wait briefly, and after a while we were seated at a bigger table since our table was taking a while to wrap up. I hope this stays around so I can try some other food options.

This place is adorable. Beautiful lighting & decor, a gorgeous wrap a round bar, an open face kitchen, and adorable private booths. I felt extremely welcomed from the moment I sat at the bar thanks to Johnathan & Shania.  I didn't plan on staying at the bar for long, as I had other plans, but everything was so perfect that I ended up being late to my event. I had a Hennessy neat (don't judge me) & a half dozen oysters. I'm somewhat of an oyster snob so I wasn't happy when the kitchen didn't let me pick a coast and instead split them 50/50. I'm more of a west coast oyster lover tbh, but hopefully this is something that can be changed going forward. Also, there weren't many vegan options which is something I look forward to at higher end restaurants. All in all, I will definitely return and sit at the bar for many more laughs and great conversation with Johnathan and Shania. Hopefully when I'm back in NYC and at the bar my options for oysters and vegan food are endless...TBD.

Great experience.  The food was delicious, the service superior, and the atmosphere was vibrant.  Plus, it was a great value.  Can't wait to return to NYC, explore Chelsea, and dine at Hav & Mar again!

We had the loveliest time at Hav & Mar last night. The food was delicious and so unique that I promise you won't find anything like it elsewhere. The staff and service were exceptional and even the decor of the restaurant is stunning. I highly recommend trying the grand jubilee, green curry, shecrab soup, and breads & dips. You won't be disappointed!

Hav & Mar was amazing. I have to give credit to Sheena and Eleno behind the bar. They made our first visit a wonderful and well rounded experience. The quality of the drinks served.... Their knowledge of the menu, couldn't have asked for better customer service experience. My boyfriend had the chicken dish and he legit said it was the best meal he ever had, along with the drink Eleno made him which was christened "the David" We will be back to try the dessert and can't wait to hear what Sheena suggests to pair with it I appreciate when the service team makes you feel special and at home .... So this is a well deserved shoutout!
No comment

I feel like 4.5 is more accurate! Hav and Mar was really, really good but with some dishes as bigger standouts than others I feel like it's *just* short of 5. The service was incredible - excellent recommendations from the staff and everyone was attentive and knowledgeable about the food. It's a large space that feels more intimate because of the interestingly spaced and shaped tables. I was particularly impressed with the snapper and the desserts. The wine selection was also very good, with many options by the glass including bubbly, orange wines and roses.

Phenomenal meal at Hav & Mar! We started with the biscuits and Brussel Sprouts as appetizers.  The Brussel Sprouts were incredible, one of the best versions we've ever had.  Entrees were the Addis York and corn-wrapped snapper, both just excellent.  The salsa verde on the snapper was perfect.  Finished off with the chocolate twilight for dessert, also excellent.  Great cocktails too!  One of the best meals we've had in NYC in awhile!

Marcus Samuelsson and his team of Thomas and Franshelis welcome you warmly ... and deliciously ... to this most wondrous of places. The space blends the Ethiopian and Swedish influences so it's both inviting and stunning. The kitchen is an orchestral theatre ... sit near it if you are fortunate to have that option. The aromas waft to you and you have both dinner and a show ... it's precision in motion with the collegial vibe that means that everyone is having a great time in there. You taste it in the dishes ... each one a lyrical dance in your mouth. Lusciousness is in every morsel and sip and moment. It is a masterpiece and my new fav place. And predicting it is soon to become impossible to get in as New Yorkers & our guests eagerly return for the nourishment of body ... and soul.

Food was amazing and off the charts. Beautiful interior and vibe. You could hear your other guests speak. Service was notoriously slow, w/ few exceptions. Server's response was breezy and patronizing. They forgot about our drinks entirely. To their credit they comped those, as they should have, after we received them an hour late. Improve the service and this is a truly awesome restaurant.
No comment
No comment

I went in December for my birthday I was happy to give my tastebuds a wonderful culinary experience...the sea bass was awesome the Scallop & Shiitake the mermaid black rice...the scallop and shitake...the sea crab soup...you will not be disappointed...the ambience was great...service was top notch. I will be back.

Ethiopian and Scandanavian?  Who would have guessed that combination.  But it totally works.  Creative drinks (aquavit), beautiful space, great vibe and amazing food. We went with 3 starters, Cerviche, Scallops and Salmon - all outstanding and then the Addis York Chicken which was equally flavorful and  superb.
Love this place and every single thing about it! Drink all the drinks and eat all the food you will not regret it!

I spent my birthday at this relatively new restaurant. The decor is beautiful and the service superb. The food is flavorful, exotic and delicious! We started with the assorted breadbasket which included blue cornbread, biscuits and Ethiopian bread with dips. Loved it! The small plates of lobster bird and she crab soup were fab! Our entrees included corn husk wrapped snapper and Dawa Dawa seared bass. We also shared mermaid black rice with lobster and a side of auntie collard greens with andouille sausage.They were all so sumptuous! It was all so filling even though it doesn't appear to be large portions. We were to stuffed to eat dessert.  I also really enjoyed my cocktails. I would definitely go again. The icing on the cake was a selfie with Marcus Samuelson!

Amazing experience! The space and ambiance were beautiful and unique, the staff was delightful, and the food had incredible flavors. The bottle of wine recommended by the waiter was perfect and paired perfectly with the meal. The waiter was also extremely helpful in assisting us making our order around gluten feee and vegan dietary restrictions. Lastly, the flavors and spices of the food were nothing like I've tasted before! Highly recommend coming here!

Without a doubt, absolutely a phenomenal experience. Every aspect of service was executed perfectly and seamlessly. I've never had Ethiopian food of any kind, so this was me going out of the box.  I'm So happy to go to a restaurant that makes it so easy and rewarding to try something new. I highly recommend this restaurant for their incredibly thoughtful/ tasteful food, and amazing cocktails!!!
Had an amazing meal here and everything was delicious. This place has a unique and refreshing menu. I can't wait to go back. The space is so beautiful and airy!

Overall good experience. Food was tasty and inventive and the service was overall good. The ambiance and vibe were also really great. Only a few hits against the spot; first the entree portions were a little small- luckily we weren't all that hungry but found the sizing to be smaller than usual. Second the entrees took what felt like forever to come out- the appetizers came out quickly but then the entrees took almost an hour after that. Would go back and try some more things!

No comment

Had such a nice night here. Food was outstanding, ambiance was was excellent. For dessert have the donut and the bunna & banana. Havatelli pasta was my favorite entree but the snapper, bass and roasted chicken were all excellent too. Sadly they were out of Addis York so can't comment.

The staff is very friendly and welcoming, and the ambience is exciting.  The Hav & Martini was very good, too -- but for some reason served without the aquavit-pickled onion.  Unfortunately, the food was incredibly salty -- and the Grand Jubilee for $92 was basically salty rice with two small pieces of lobster,  a few mussels that were very small, and sprinkled with some tiny shrimp.  If chicken was in it, I didn't see it. Quite frankly, I was a little taken back by this dish -- $92.  Quite embarrassing, really. However, I'll be back because the staff and service was great... but from now on I'll just order drinks and a bread basket.

Was so excited to try this restaurant, unfortunately left extremely disappointed.  Totally understand that it's still relatively new and have to work out the kinks but, there are some basic standards that were not met.  Waited too long for menus and water for the table.  That night , they were sufficiently staffed and still had to flag down waiter for attention.  The appetizers and entrees are meant to be shared and family style , which some dishes didn't warrant that.  One dish we ordered had one drumstick... how was that supposed to the shared?  Entrees came out before appetizers... the whole experience was a mess.  Good luck surviving the very competitive NYC dining experience.

Delicious food as usual by Marcus Samuelson. We ordered various cocktails on the menu and all of them were delicious. Highlights for food were the seaside waffle, smoked plantain, hamachi crudo, and you have to get the Adis York. We got three desserts and they were all incredible. Highly recommend you check out this place. Lots of seating for large groups and the staff is incredibly down to earth and friendly. They all love their job and are happy to be there.

Such a cute place with amazing Filipino food!  Service was great as well!  Highly recommend

SO good! Stumbled upon FOB after watching the owner on Beat Bobby Flay and so happy we did. We had the octopus salad & tuna appetizers which were so fresh and flavorful. Then did some pork filipino bbq & adobo chicken which were both perfectly cooked. Delicious food & great service!

Cute little spot in Brooklyn! Staff is so friendly and helpful. Oh it's BYOB!!! So grab yourself a bottle of wine down the block! This is the perfect Filipino brunch spot with so many different variety to choose from. I highly recommend the octopus salad it was very refreshing. The portion are huge also and the prices are very fair!

I don't get out to cobble hill often from Manhattan but every time I come to Fob I am reminded of how AMAZING this restaurant is! The 7up shrimp is hands down an absolute must-order! The sauce that the shrimp come in might just be the best thing I have ever tasted. Pro tip: save the sauce from the shrimp and pour it over your garlic rice. Eat the saucy rice with the spare ribs and viola, best meal you'll ever have! Other phenomenal items include the pugita salad: the tamarind dressing is a bit acidic and the crunchy onions really balance the octopus. Make sure to mix up the salad. The sisig is amazing! It's covered in pork rinds. It might be the best sisig I've had in the city. The Filipino bbq chicken is also out of this world good. Again make sure to get a side of garlic rice. The sizzling bistek truly comes sizzling. In the middle of winter they actually had to open the back door and momentarily take the steak outside due to the heavy smoke. It's a super fun experience even though it's not my favorite dish. Aaand the shakes, they're not a must have but they're also a very fun addition to a delicious meal. I don't love mango and yet I really enjoyed the mango shake with the black jelly. I would absolutely recommended this place for a low key date night or a group dinner. FYI it is BYOB. Truly an amazing meal every time. The menu doesn't seem to change but why mess with an amazing thing!?

The food is amazing! The bbq chicken skewers were tender and the sauce is so flavorful. The fish cooked in the banana leaf had great texture and so much flavorful. The sauteed vegetables were green beans and they still had a nice crunch and a nice garlic sauce. The rice was a little dry but when I added the sauce from the garlic beans it was great. The service is a little slow.

One of my favorite restaurants in all of New York. Great quality food, that remains consistent no matter how many times I return. The sisig is incredible, the adobo to die for, and the garlic rice the perfect side for everything on the menu. Another huge plus is the fact that it's BYOB, which rocks!

Such a disappointment.  Why can't I find decent Filipino food in NYC of all places?

If you don't have a reservation I recommend going right before the dinner rush at about or else it will be hard to be seated right away!  This Filipino barbecue spot has a wonderful home cooking taste. Comfort food if you will. Everything was really delicious and some of the flavors reminded me of soul food. Like the sigsig- savory shredded pork with fried crispy pieces on top. Has a vinegary flavor- as most of the food did have that acidic kick. The adobo chicken was a must,  juicy and hearty. I really loved the corn Bibingka, sweet, light, crumbly. Similar to corn bread but with actual corn pieces in it & topped with a light cheese curd. There was enough leftovers for the both of us to take food home and the bill came out to under $90 per person. This place is byob so its a win win!

Beautiful, well-done decor. Absolutely amazing food. Friendly staff. Great job at following/enforcing Covid guidelines. My new favorite spot in NYC.

We had such a delicious and craving-satisfying experience at FOB, I'm not even upset that it's probably just a teensy bit overpriced. We ordered too much food for two people- shared an app (sisig) and an entree each with 2 sides/entree- so next time I think we'll definitely go family style and share. I daresay the adobo rivals my mom's, and the pork BBQ brings me back to summer nights with my family. I also got the Sago and would highly recommend it! FOB is BYOB with no corkage and we saw many take advantage of that. The backyard has a really great, appropriately distanced setup. The staff is also wonderful and welcoming. They're obviously working very hard and we hope they stay safe and well so we can come back for more!
Food was a bit over salted but our meals were enjoyable. Service was super friendly and no-corkage BYOB is a treat.  A cute spot to go to with friends.

Would 1000% recommend the Adobo chicken! It's so good over garlic rice. Also the Ube shake, get it without boba though. Backyard space is immaculate. It's spacious and has such a chill vibe. Can't wait to try their brunch menu!

It's a Filipino gem in Brooklyn. If you want to try authentic Filipino cuisine, this is the place for you. The staff are friendly and not highly overpriced. The place is clean and they have a backyard seating which is a plus.

Guyssssss. I had such a great time here. Called ahead and the host saved us a wonderful spot in the back patio under an umbrella (it was threatening rain). He also told us the place is BYOB!!!!! Love. When we arrived, we were immediately seated in a lovely corner spot away from others. The menu looks so so good, and the waiter gave us his recommendations. Everything was super tasty, the evening was lovely, and definitely fairly priced. Will 100% go back.

Filipino food is supposed to be affordable and this place is nothing near that. It doesn't even taste like Filipino food the ingredients are just there just tossed around specially the sisig I just taste the lemon and bbq is too expensive $20 for two sticks of bbq chicken that's really skimp this caters to white people not it's roots what a shame

We ordered the Bibingka appetizer, Filipino BBQ, grilled spare ribs, and the Kamote, pickled papaya and garlic rice sides. There was plenty for the two of us. We espeically liked the Bibingka which could have easily been a dessert. The BBQ was smokey and had a great char, really a standout. The spare ribs were perfectly done. The only surprise was how mellow the banana BBQ sauce was. It could have used a few more spices. The Kamote was excellent and in a sense, served as our dessert course. We also like the crunchy fried garlic on top of the rice. All in all, a great meal and we will return!

This is a hard review for me to write, because I really wanted to like FOB. The atmosphere was a solid 5 for their beautiful outdoor garden spot. Unfortunately the food for me didn't match up. We got a tuna ceviche-style starter that was fantastic, and I had high hopes for the rest of the meal, but it was kind of downhill from there. The chicken wings were flavorful but flabby. The pork belly  didn't have a ton of flavor but I liked the dipping sauce. The sweet potato side was nice but the cabbage- which sounded kimchee like - was kind of bland.  Maybe we just didn't order correctly.

FOB is our favorite restaurant in Brooklyn for years. We come from Virginia to visit our grandsons. As soon as we arrived in Brooklyn we come to FOB, The food is outstanding. Flounder cooked in banana leaves, grilled beef ribs, bbq chicken, octopus salad with tamarind souce our favorites. Halo desert is to die for. I feel every time we come here the food seems to get better and better.

Came back again this year a few more times and really enjoyed the waiting service. I've tried  all of the entrees on the menu and definitely favorites are the beef dish, the adobe chicken, and the seafood dish with noodles. I always get their sisig and their halo halo dessert. I haven't tried their brunch but I hear good things and will come back again to try it. You can't go wrong with any of the dishes here!

I was looking forward to the chicken adobo but it was very salty. I was seated outside and was eaten up by mosquitos, they didn't turn on the fan or have any citronella candles on. Service was ok.

My favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. It's BYOB and next to all the good smith street cocktail bars. The PERFECT dinner for two is sisig and corn bibingka for apps, pork belly and chicken skewers (or substitute chicken adobo) for mains, and garlic rice and tomato +salted egg for sides. DO NOT underestimate those sides, they'll perfectly balance out the meal.

Sweet Filipino restaurant.  Service was thoughtful and attentive.  The flavors are authentic and yet different at the same time.  BF has some food allergies and they were very accommodating.  The garden dining area is lovely.  The server wore a face mask the whole time and the tables were sufficiently staffed spaced.  We felt felt completely safe and taken care of.  Go!

Love the food and the backyard here! We came on a chilly spring evening and were super toasty under the heat lamps in the back! I love the chicken skewers with the sides---the chicken is so moist and the sauce is sweet and delicious. Definitely recommend the sweet potato side dish!

DO NOT ORDER PICKUP HERE. Never order pickup from here. On Mother's Day, we had ordered for pickup. Got a text saying the food was being cooked, and that it would be ready by 5pm. We had nowhere really to go, so the four of us were stuck waiting in the car for almost an hour as they eventually decided to make our food.

Didn't know there was real good Filipino food in the Downtown Brooklyn area till I used trusty yelp. This place is pretty damn good when you live in Brooklyn and are too lazy to travel to Queens and Manhattan for some Filipino food. I would definitely recommend the steak with salted duck egg and butter shrimp. That shrimp was so tasty... the Octopus salad was delish as well.

Great Filipino BBQ. Make sure to get dessert. Can't go wrong with anything but gotta get the mashed sweet potato as a side

Awesome BBQ. I had the grilled liempo pork belly and my partner had the grilled steak. The meat was amazing and tasted like our BBQ's back home in the Philippines. We got the pitcher cocktails, and wow that was more than enough for two people, so be ready to drink if you order it! They were mixed using beer, so keep that in mind in you prefer your cocktails to be strictly liquor like I do.

This review is for the service only. Went in on Saturday afternoon where they only had 2 parties sitting inside with several tables open. We walked through the open door and were abruptly told to enter from the side entrance by the cook (?) which was literally the door adjacent to the open one. Not even a separate entrance but literally walking out to open a door next to the already open one. Weird but we complied. We waited for a few minutes until someone came out and we asked for a table and instead of seating us at an empty and prepped table in this half empty restaurant we were told to wait for 5 minutes as the server took one of the tables check and disappeared to the back . We're not picky people but the attitude was not it from the moment we entered and we just didn't feel welcome.

BEST food I had during my trip in NY. This little gem is a must, serving filipino food with an at home feeling! It was 4 of us at our table and shared all the plates. Service, food, vibe/ambiance everything was excellent! Every dish I had was soo good and full of flavor. Chef really put together an amazing menu making impossible for me to have a favorite dish. Manager was very friendly and checked in to make sure everything was good and server was great! Looking forward to coming here every time I visit NY!

One of the best filipino food places I've been to in Brooklyn. I loved the decor, the service was spot-on, and even the dessert was memorable since I've never had anything like it before. Their bibingka was very moist and warm which really added to its experience and I still dream of it now being back home in Toronto. Would highly recommend coming here.
Had the coconut pancakes and the grilled pork belly with fried egg and rice. Enjoyed both. Highly recommend.

Something different than the usual options on Smith St. Fob Brooklyn welcomes with a colorful dining room and beautiful backyard. Started with an ube milkshake, refreshing on a hot day. My partner and I shared the ssig appetizer in a cast iron skillet with an egg. Bits of jalapeño, chopped onion gave this dish some heat. Scraping the crispy pig bits from the sides was the best part. For the entree, we split the spare ribs with garlic rice and laing. The spare ribs, falling off the bone, were glazed with a banana ketchup. Garlic rice had just the right hint of garlic. Not a fan of the laing, which was sautéed kale in coconut milk - a weird combo. The table next to us ordered the octopus salad, and that looked delicious. Prices are reasonable, and ambiance and service are solid.

Wash your hands because you're going to be licking your fingers. Flavorful food beautifully presented to our group of 20 people. No waiting, just dish after delicious dish, appetizers, entrees, desserts, well coordinated friendly service that made the us all feel as if we were eating at a friend's house. We had overnight Adobo, halo halo, sig sig, and many other dishes. My favorite was the sig sig and overnight adobo.
