WOW! That's all I can really say as I walk home with a giant food baby after stumbling across this gem in Cobble Hill! We ordered a lot of food and all of it was amazing! We got the spicy chicken Langkawas (spicy chicken wings), the pugita salad and the bola bola (beef dumplings that were out of this world!) and then the pork Filipino bbq skewers. Honestly, the only change I would make is that next time I will bring more people with me so I can try more dishes! Highly recommend and will definitely be back!
Not worth the money if you ask me. Overpriced and very mediocre flavor. Nothing like An actual food cart in Manila. I will not be going back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for a late lunch and the food definitely did not disappoint! My friend and I got mimosas, the pork belly dish, and the sisilog. The rice that came with the pork belly was delicious and complimented the flavor of the porkbelly so well. Cute little spot in a nice Brooklyn neighborhood!
No comment

This is a great spot if you need some Filipino comfort food, like me! The chicken adobo was perfection and the ribs were tender amazingness. For a decent price we got a meal that brought me right back to my Lola's house eating chicken adobo and rice on her porch when I was a little girl. Can't forget to mention the wonderful atmosphere and great service! Thank you everyone at f.o.b. Brooklyn for a delicious dinner!
No comment
No comment

My family and I visited New York last week and we were in search for some Filipino Cuisine. We came across F.O.B Brooklyn and I must say, one of the BEST Filipino food I've eaten in a Restaurant! Your typical Filipino Cuisine is usually very greasy, but FOB Brooklyn was unique. They do not serve fried food which is great! From the welcome greeting from host Ahmet to Chef Armando's amazing dishes, OVERALL, EXCELLENT Experience! Highly recommended! Thank you Chef Armando, Ahmet and the entire staff for your excellent service. We will be back for sure!-Santos Family from San Francisco, Ca
No comment
No comment

Loved this place! Attractive decor, pleasant, spacious garden. Friendly and prompt service at lunchtime Saturday. Food was delicious. I had the smoked fish with garlic rice and fried egg, my friend had the thin sliced pork. Yum! Both were expertly cooked, very flavorful and generous portions (but not overly so). Highly recommend.

An amazing decore complimented by amazing food. The restaurant is well lit with touches of personal items that give it a very home like feeling. The food is made to order and tasted like it was made with love. There was 4 of us at the table and we ordered everything to share. Tuna kilawin, sisig, Filipino BBQ, grilled spare rib, beef rub and the sizzling bistek. All of the meets were juicy and tender and the tuna kilawin was so pleasantly refreshing that we didn't want it to end. I would totally recommend this place to anyone looking for great comfort food that will have them pleasantly filled
This is legit Filipino food, it's not too heavy or greasy just delicious. The starters, entree, and dessert is amazing !!

Everything I ate here was incredible. Service was also incredibly good and they've perfected the lighting since opening (used to be a bit bright). I would say this is one of the best restaurants in the neighborhood.
No comment

A pleasant experience! We ordered 4 different entrees and 2 sides. Every dish was delicious and satisfying although the sisig was a little salty. Their shakes were advertised inaccurately. On the menu, they showed taller cups which made sense to charge ($6.50 each) but when we received it, it was served in their water cups which kinda threw us off. Anyway, the drinks were tasty but not worth that price. The prices were a little high for their portion sizes. Service was excellent. The restaurant is beautiful. There is an outdoor seating area and they supplied bug repellent sprays (how considerate of them!) Definitely worth trying!
No comment
Great food, generous portions and friendly service. Sweet potatoes are amazing, as is the fish and the spare ribs! Absolutely recommended as is also good value
No comment

I really wanted to like this place. We ordered drinks and appetizer and two entrées. What came out instead were our drinks, one entrée and then much later after we had finished that one entrée, a side and the second entrée. There was no apology for lack of the appetizer that we ordered and my husband thinks that the chicken was undercooked. My stomach does feel kind of funny now. I am very disappointed as I had high hopes for this place. I hope they turn their act around.
No comment

In a word, okay.  Saw the NYT article and the yelp reviews and thought I'd make the trek out to give it a try.  Had the chicken adobo, which was tasty but portion was small (2 pieces).  Also had the seafood malabon (noodles) which was well sized but was just so-so in flavor.  The garlic fried rice was not great - too mushy with no salt.  Service was fine but food took a little while to come out.  Overall I'd say the flavor is 3.5/5, service was a 3 but value for money is a 2.  As much as I'd like to see more Filipino restaurants in the city, for the money and for the taste, you're better off heading to Grill 21 in the East Village or Tito Rads in Queens
No comment
No comment

I had grilled tuna (lamb) and seafood malabon(thick rice noodle), both delicious. The lamb was tender and juicy, how that possible? I still can't believe it was lamb. Don't forget to order Corn bibingka for desert!

Amazing Filipino food!!!! And they do brunch right!! Everything comes with garlic rice which is to die for and chicken skewers were my absolute favorite! They also have very good young coconut pancakes and they melt in your mouth
No comment
Yum!!!! Such good food and lovely service. Elise was an awesome server. Try the wings and morning glory. Thanks for the flavorful meal.
Delicious food, reasonable prices. And great service. What more could you want? Definitely a brunch that will not disappoint
Their sisig, adobo and bbq were good but a little pricey for Filipino food i think. Good for foodies who are trying Filipino food for the first time.

Delicious! FOB is so tasty and the staff is wonderful. I've never had a memorable Filipino food experience, even in the Philippines and FOB broke this curse. Next level, fresh and flavorful Filipino food! A must-go!
No comment

Had a horrible experience with this restaurant. I had called several days beforehand to reserve a table for my mother's birthday. The male attendant on the phone agreed to give us a 7:00 pm reservation. However, on the day of the reservation, we traveled in the rain to the restaurant, only to find that the restaurant was closed for the night and nobody had even bothered to inform us. It was such a disapponting experience. It was particularly humilating to my mother and her guests, who had heard about the cuisine and were very excited to try it out. In the future, I would suggest writing down customers' contact information and communicating with them  so that a similar incident would not be repeated. While I'm sure the food is great, the customer service is deplorable and I would not recommend this place to anybody.
No comment

FOB was overall a great experience. The decor was great, felt like we were in someone's dining room. The corn bread appetizer was crazy crazy good. The coconut butter was delicious and it was perfectly sweet. The bola bola dumplings were outstanding. I did not like the BBQ chicken skewers, the sauce was on point but texture was off. The grilled pork ribs were literally falling off the bone and could not have been better. Banana sauce was out of this world. Mac salad was great, garlic rice and green beans were average. We ordered the choconut cake and it was fabulous. Service was phenomenal, the chef sent us some hot chocolate with the cake and it was better than jaque Torres cocoa in dumbo. Manager came over and the waitress was on point. Wonderful experience. 2 appetizers 2 main courses and 3 sides with dessert was $65.
This is the best Filipino food in NYC. Authentic flavors, quality ingredients, attentive service.
No comment

So I totally had the expectation that the food here would be amazing based off the pictures I saw on yelp, but it failed to live up to my expectations. I will say the food is good, but there was nothing special about it. Of the five dishes I tried, the best was probably the bistek and the adobo. The skewers were good as well. The adobo was juicy and the flavor was alright, but I felt like it was missing something. The bistek was cooked well and the sauce it came with was good as well. The appetizers I tried were the sisig and the corn bibingka. The corn bibingka was basically a 7 dollar piece of cornbread and the sisig looks amazing, but it doesn't pack as much flavor as i was hoping it would. The strawberry shake I had was on the very sour side as well. Overall I just was expecting more and it really didn't live up to expectations.

This was an excellent dining experience. The ribs are terrific and very tender. The 7-up shrimp are great, and i suggest you ask for them extra spicy. The laing is a very addictive side that goes very well with the garlic rice, i suggest asking for the laing with extra chilis as well as this is how id recommend many eating Filipino dishes. The adobo was very good as well, and mixing the sauce from the adobo with rice as well the sauce from all other dishes is a must. I strongly recommend this place to picky and adventurous eaters alike.

I love this place. It seems to get better each time I go. Was thrilled to have a Filipino spot open in the hood and am so happy they continue to thrive. Best sisig I've ever had. We've had most of the dishes on the menu and have never been disappointed. Highly recommend to everyone.

The food took a long time to come out even though the restaurant was fairly empty. The portions were tiny for the price. $18 for a half rack of short ribs with no sides, $5 to add rice and veggies. The seafood noodles weren't anything special, super small portions for $22. I can't speak to authenticity, but the flavors, portion and presentation just weren't that special for the price.

I really don't want to write a review because I don't want this place to be more popular. But I desperately want them to survive and thrive on Smith St, where restaurants open and close seemingly every week. Consistently good food and in the summer they have a lovely patio out back.

Omg please come check this place out. We were next door at Zombie's and came for dinner. The BBQ Filipino pork, Adobe chicken, grilled chicken insal, spicy chicken langkawas, rice and everything else we ordered including the boba shakes for dessert, was absolutely amazing. And the service couldn't have been kinder or more professional. These guys should seriously be on the Michelin recommended list. Check them out!
No comment

Was here recently for a wedding rehearsal dinner. Yes, our families took over this small restaurant at 20 strong. The service was great, and their menu provided us with lots of food options to sample and try. They tried to be accommodating of our baby as well, but alas, their bathrooms did not have a changing table. We improvised in the moment, but that was definitely a minus for us.

Omfg this place is fantastic. We had jicama salad which was literally one of the best salads I've had in a restaurant and then two seafood entrees both of which were totally top shelf. Very pleasant staff and laid back vibe. We are coming back with a bunch of friends.

Very underwhelmed. Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. Place was quiet due to a downpour. Dishes didn't feel homey, a lot of tapas which is too expensive for filipino food. It lacked flavor didn't feel authentic. Had a pitcher of beer mixed with berries which was a bad combo. Sisig was not sizzling was too small of a portion to leave an impression. Garlic rice was okay but didn't finish chicken adobo since vinegar didn't fully reduce. Wings were alright and pork belly was decent out of all the dishes.
Really good food. Their sisig is delish. I also picked up catering trays from them for Thanksgiving and they were super friendly and helpful!

If we're in Brooklyn, we live to eat at F.O.B.! The food is like Lola's with a little more finesse. Dad's overnight Adobo is a classic, comfort food. The Filipino bbq will make you long for your huge family parties. Order the garlic rice with each dish and don't pass up the pechay.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I have been meaning try this place since it opened. We ordered the Filipino BBQ (pork) and the grilled chicken inasal. Both were hits, as well as the sides, washed it down with some San Migual (Filipino beer). Food and service was good, the garden was nice. We will definitely return.

Glad to have discovered this place and so close to home too!  With a Filipino significant other, I've been introduced to many authentic and traditional Filipino dishes and FOB definitely has them.  I had the bibingka, octopus salad, sisilog, longsilog, avocado shake.  Bibingka was exemplary!  Octopus salad was perfectly portioned and the dressing was a fantastic pairing.  Sisig was a bit salty and I personally craved more pig ear but it mixed well with the garlic rice.  Longanisa was very tasty, not as sweet as some others, which is perfect for me.  Avocado shake was a great refresher with chewy tapioca.   Definitely coming back to try some other dishes next time!
Ribs are amazing, prices are moderate and worth it, atmosphere is laid back and quiet, and staff was courteous and mindful. We'll certainly come back!

Quite possibly the best Filipino restaurant in all of the boroughs (and we've tried them all!) The place is simple and quaint. The food....mmmm... The ribs, beef and pork skewers are delicious. Their garlic rice is special. All of their side veggies are done to perfection. Really have nothing negative to say other than it is definitely more pricey than the other Filipino spots, but worth it. We even order take out from there periodically and it never disappoints.

Updated a year later; the staff has not changed, nice and always attentive. The food has gotten better as well as their drinks. Bring a crew or just yourself, everyone leaves full! Great menu, seems they made some tweeks here and there.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Well, this is fantastic food! We ate the most delicious bbq chicken dish I've had in quite a while. And the sauces are fantastic...  FYI it's BYOB. I recommend getting 2 sides with your plate... the meat dishes are not garnished with their own sides. But it's worth it! You know how some restaurants can feel like every dish is prepared in the same sauce? Well, here, every dish has a completely unique blend of flavors... great neighborhood place!

I grew up eating Filipino food and always had a hard time finding restaurants that serve authentic Filipino cuisine. I was excited when I heard F.O.B. was opening up in Brooklyn so I gathered a few friends to try out the place. When we got there, I was immediately impressed by the charming and cozy atmosphere. Our server was very kind and attentive. We ordered the tuna kilawin as the starter, beef rib kaldereta, sisig and chicken adobo. Everything we ordered was absolutely PHENOMENAL. Each dish was on point and far exceeded my expectations. I will definitely come back here the next time I have a craving for Filipino food!
No comment
No comment

I was extremely excited to try this place but Unfortunately, I was left disappointed. The Ube shake was delicious but sangria tasted nothing more than just beer. We ordered 3 main entreees, with some side dishes. The chicken came out raw & service was subpar. He was unapologetic, just simply took the chicken and said he'll have it cooked more. At this point we've cut into them already to see if they were both raw and they were. I'm surprised that the waiter decided to take the chicken back to recook it instead of a new dish or asked us if we would like a whole different dish. Never had that happen to be before at any other restaurant (and everyone can have a off day, even Chefs). However, the Chicken came back dry & burnt at this pt we gave up &left it as is and wanted to just finish dinner so we can leave. Garlic rice was a huge disappointment as well, no garlic flavor and all the other dishes were bland.

The place feels homey! The playlist is awesome too. Been craving for some silog and this place actually got what I wanted! The food is A1, the drinks are A1.. and i forgot to tell you, they have halo-halo too! Will come back next!!

A terrific spot for tasty food. Don't let the relatively bland decor fool you, the good is fabulous. Try the garlic rice and mashed sweet potatoes as sides. We had the chicken and pork skewers and lamb for dinner. All of it was gladly consumed.

column3: Town N Country Alliance, Town 'n' Country, FL
column6: I was so blessed to grow up with Filipino influence in my life and this place is just as authentic as my friends' family cooking. Food here is the bomb! I had the cornbread appetizer with pork belly entree and coconut rice and halo halo for dessert. Service was on point and atmosphere was cute with touches of Filipino culture. I live all the way in Rockland County and I can say with confidence that I will definitely dine here again!

Love this place. The menu is very unique with a lot of (meaty) options. Very reasonably priced and everything we had was very good. I went with a group of 4, and we split 2 apps, each had an entree, and we ordered 8 sides for all of us. It was a ton of food and ended up around $30 per person. Would definitely come back to explore the menu again.

My boyfriend is Filipino and he said this place is not as authentic as the brunch meals his mother had cooked back home. But for someone who has not had Filipino breakfast before, I thought it was pretty tasty! The decor made it feel very homey and cozy. I had the rice with spam and eggs. Spam had a mustard flavor coating on it that they must've fried with. BF got the rice plate with tocilog. We also got the sagot drink which has tapioca in it! Would come back here for their comforting food!

Had the beef and corn beef versions of the silogs (egg and garlic rice).  Both were so good!  It was a pleasant surprise that the corn beef was home made and not from a can.  We also shared amongst the 4 of us the halo halo waffles which was a great closer almost like the desert version of brunch.  Very refreshing combination of ice cream and waffles.  The vinegar spicy sauce was great so had to get more, reminiscent of chili pepper water from home in Hawaii.  The décor of the restaurant is very detailed and thought out and it makes sense because so it's the food.  Though we struggled initially to decide on somewhere for brunch, we ended up being completely satisfied with our decision on fob restaurant!
Deliciously cooked and well-presented. Very original taste without overdoing the sauces. Highly recommended!!
No comment

Had the short rib and chicken BBQ, both delicious. The server was friendly, the space feels homey and like you're eating in a living room, and all of the food was perfect. This might be my favorite restaurant in the area.
No comment

I came here for Sunday dinner, I like the interior decoration, it was very unique. Our server (Elise) was super cute and friendly! The menu is not so Expensive, which I liked, and our server explained different options to suit our taste buds. The food is fresh and flavorful, and very authentic. I will definitely come back!!!
No comment
No comment
Food took forever. First ones in last ones served. Got a $14 entree and it was just two chicken skewers and two bits of slaw like stuff.

Food was pretty good.  Had the angus beef, garlic rice, grilled fish, and an appetizer sissies or something like that. Service was pretty good.  What caught me by surprise is that there is a cc fee on the bill.  Is that a thing now?
Different take on Philippine Cuisine. Nice to see people eating here and trying the filipino cuisine which is really not mainstream. Hope we get there. Nice to introduce our cuisine to the world.

Amazing Experience! I go for Mother Day and the food was so great, our waitress was very sweet, smiling all the time, attentive to everything. Try it, you will not regret! they have very cool Shake too. Extremely Recommended!

I came here for the second time last week and was so glad to be back! The best dishes on the menu (so far) are the ribs which are tender and flavorful, the wings appetizer which had a nice peanut flavor to them, and the string beans side. I will definitely be back!
No comment
Excellent food (I had adobo chicken, pancit bihon, the house "chop chop" salad and halo halo) and the service was outstanding. This restaurant would be one of my top 3 in Bklyn.

I am truly happy to have a restaurant in the neighborhood serving Filipino cuisine.  As a Filipino who was born and raised in the Philippines, I must say that the chef is doing a terrific job representing the cuisine.  His execution of the dishes is flawless - a totally different level from the restaurants in Queens and even the ones in the lower east side.  I can't complain about the prices as I am familiar with Smith St. rents.  Overall, great food + great ambiance + great service = great experience.  This place is totally worth it and could count on my support.

Just went here tonight (Valentines Day). Unpretentious and enjoyable, the food was delicious.  We split the ribs and the flounder with two vegetable sides.  Really interesting flavors and good presentation.  We would definitely come with another couple to split one of the punches, which the table next to us had.  Can't wait to introduce it to other people.

We're so excited this place opened in the neighborhood. My husband and I went last night and really loved everything- the service, decor and especially food. BUT-- despite having charming bird-cage like light fixtures overhead, they also had the house lights on FULL BLAST. We both commented immediately on how crazy bright it was in there and, I hate to say it, it took away from the experience a little. If I had to go on a first date there I'd be horrified! Amazing how lighting can create an ambience. I hope the owners see this and take note to dim the lights for dinner, it really makes a huge difference. Hopefully they will and we will go back!

The food was absolutely amazing! It definitely has its own style of Filipino taste and done to perfection! I heard about this place through a friend who read an article about this restaurant and I had to try it with my family! We definitely are going to be going back here and bring more of my family and friends!

What an incredible food menu... Simple, easy, and delicious... We paid our first visit on a Friday evening... And the dishes that we selected were Devine.  Our first time really having first rate, Filipino, food... Aesthetically pleasing incredibly delicious.   The pricing is very very competitive... The dishes are in good proportion's, the food served hot.and ready.... Service was above average... There is a wait time for food, because they place the order... The food is not sitting in the freezer to be Heated it up... It's made fresh. The sauces were different, tangy , very accommodating to each dish.I had the organic chicken with a beautiful delicious sauce... As a side dish I had the Chinese cabbage... So good. My colleague ordered the traditional adobo chicken dish, it was a little salty for me... But I think I'm just sensitive, the color, texture, how it cut, was pleasing to the other person who ate it and enjoyed it... The side dish was a a coconut, mashed sweet potato... It was so good. We had the ice cream for dessert as well as the custard... And we shared each bite. This will not be our last visit for sure.

Great place! I ordered the picadillo for brunch And it was delicious. The portions are smaller but filling. The staff was helpful and nice. The interior decor is amazing and makes the place feel big and welcoming. I definitely plan on coming back to try dinner.

The restaurant has just opened but the staff were super friendly and attentive. The chef came out at the end of the meal to speak with us and make sure everything went well. The food was great- only wish some of the portions could be bigger! Will return!

Went during the restaurant's opening week. Had a great meal with a group of Filipino friends always eager to try out the new Filipino restaurants in town. This one did not disappoint. Loved the home style cooking that didn't try to complicate classic Filipino recipes. Loved the laing, whole fish, pork BBQ, kilawin, sisig and flan dessert. Will be back to try the duck and short ribs because those looked great too.

This place is amazing. Every dish I've had is outstanding, with the chicken adobo, grilled spare ribs, and laing as my favorites. I am half Filipino, and know authentic Filipino food, so for those reviews and people who complained that it's not authentic, understand that this is not going to be like your mom's cooking. The flavors are nevertheless outstanding and the skill happening in that kitchen is really wonderful. The service has been warm, inviting and great every time I've been. When I went with my parents the chef even came out and spoke to us and asked how we liked everything. I no longer live in Cobble Hill and this is the one place I continue to go back for.

This place was totally average. The dumpling appetizers we had were great and delicious. However, what was really disappointing was the portion sizes of the entrees. The menu features nice photos of each of the dishes. For instance, there's a photo of a stack of about 5 kebabs on a plate. So my husband ordered the kebabs and...two lonely kebabs show up. It wasn't nearly enough food, which I wouldn't be that offended by had their photos not been misleading. Not to mention, the food was just fine. I got the spare ribs - the sauce was on the sweeter side, but not really flavorful. We got the rice noodles on the side which were bland and grey looking, and the eggplant salad which is just a side salad with eggplant thrown on top (and barely enough dressing to taste it). Disappointing since the place is super cute.

This is my first time using yelp and actually rating a restaurant. I had such a great time here, I ordered corn bibingba, chicken adobo, garlic rice, presas (strawberry shake, lemongrass, tapioca) and halo halo (which they accommodated for me since I am not a fan of beans, they gave me the ice cream). My guest had grilled spare ribs with the macaroni salad and leche flan. All of the dishes was so good, perfectly seasoned, flavorful and juicy. I have never had Filipino food but I chose this restaurant for a project and I am glad I did because not only was the food delicious but the staff were very welcoming and even introduced me to the chef after I assume the server told him I am a hospitality management student. He also was very welcoming and respectful. I would definitely come back and I recommend this place to any and every body. You would have an wonderful experience, I know I did. I will come back for more and bring more people. I wish the restaurant nothing but the best and much success.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a fun girls days out with my family, and decided to dine here for lunch. Restaurant is very spacious with plenty of seating to accommodate big crowds. Menu had a pretty extensive list of dim-sum to lunch special dishes. Got the Sui-mai with Abalone to kick it up a notch. I really liked their Black custard bun with gold swirl. Soup dumplings tasted good- not the best I've had; dumpling skin was thin; though not enough soup in the meat filling. I especially liked the Braised lamb meat with Cumin- tasted so flavorful and just enough spice. Price is average for this part of the city and wait staff was friendly. Overall, a very enjoyable lunch in the heart of New York City.
Perking duck is good, the skin is crispy but some pieces aren't crispy. I really like the very thin tortilla that doesn't make full. The vinegar and bean sauce are balanced. Delicious!
No comment
Food is great. Environment is good in the outer space. Service is very good, very willing to help.
No comment
Excellent way to grab a delicious, healthy and inexpensive meal. Prettier than most dimsum in Chinatown, and very tasty.
No comment

Probably the best Chinese in the theatre district, up there with Joe's Shanghai (except they have a full menu outside of dimsum). I ordered a mushroom appetizer, some moo shu wraps for it, sprig rolls, sesame balls... all very good. I got it for pick up and it was ready early. The restaurant seemed kind of empty which is a shame, it had the right vibe for a casual sit down - I think next time I'll stay and eat in person. A+ local approved.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went back a few days ago with some friends and the food is still SO good. Both friends said it's one of their favorite places we went this trip. I honestly don't even remember what the service was like or what the place looked like because the food is so good it didn't matter. Definitely recommend the soup dumplings, green beans and custard buns. 10/10!!
No comment

While in the city with the kids we decided to eat lunch at Mr. Sun. It was a holiday so there was no crowd in the restaurant. We were greeted and seated right away. We ordered the chicken lo mein, chicken fried rice, half Peking duck, pork soup dumplings, and pork buns. Everything was tasty. The favorite for the family was the chicken lo mein though everything was really good. Overall service was ok. Nothing negative but it wasn't amazing either. The Peking duck came with thin pancakes vs the buns. Again, all was good. We would consider coming back another time we're in the area.
No comment

Came here for a quick dinner after work, before a flight on a Friday night and the food was very good! The place was not crowded and our food came out pretty quick. There was a good number of waiters/waitresses so the service was very quick (in terms of water refills, getting more napkins, etc.) I got the kung pao chicken which was very good (loved the peanuts on top). The meal was very affordable especially given the area and proximity to many office buildings. When working in the area again, will def be back for some takeout :)
No comment
No comment

The location is close enough to feel the frantic Times Square energy.  However - the food is excellent, service is attentive and caring.  Good happy hour deals, and tbh the dim sum was as good as if not better than we've had in Chinatown or in Flushing.  Probably more expensive but for Manhattan a true bargain for great food.  It's not romantic but neither is it a hole in the wall (which I happen to love too).  We were there for dinner, but would be a great lunch spot as well.  Close to many subways, which made it great for a group to meet after work and then scatter.
No comment
No comment

Visited while I was on trip to New York and loved the food at Mr. Sun. The Soup Dumplings with Crab Meat was absolutely excellent and I highly recommend. I also had the truffle dumpling with shrimp and that was tasty.
No comment

The best dim sum we have had so far! Everything we ordered is very unique and different. We had the house fish soup, duck dumplings, abalone siu mai, shrimp black truffle dumplings, edamame dumplings, pig custard buns. All dishes are delicious. A very exquisite take on dim sum. Service was awesome too. The restaurant is clean and quiet, in very convenient location right near the Nintendo store near the Rockefeller center. I would definitely come back. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Excellent garlic eggplant lunch. Just excellent. Service.Food. Ambiance. Rainy day. Highly recommend.

Off the hook!!! Just told Ling to bring anything off the Dim Sum menu that she thought we NEEDED!!  She was fabulous as usual and the food was as well.  We had 3 Peking Ducks as a chaser...  The best Peking Duck in Midtown, if not the entire City!!  Thanks for a truly memorable evening with our family!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great dim sum in this part of town. Pork soup was amazing but my favorite was edamame with truffles.
No comment

Ok listen. This restaurant made our night.  No need to go to China town. This was one authentic Chinese restaurant! We had Ma po tofu ( that tofu was fresh), the Lo mein now it was perfectly seasoned Al dente! Oh and do not miss their specialty: roasted pork! I will eat here again! Chef, YOU DID IT!

This place hit the spot. We got half order of the Peking duck. I know some people here said the skin could have been crispier, I agree. However, the duck meat was actually soft and moist so it was perfect. We also got the abalone shumai and the crab soup dumplings, very flavorful. There were only two of us with three dishes and we were stuffed. The portion is good for the price. The location was perfect for us and it's bigger than you expect. The servers were quick and attentive. I had a great time there.

The lunch specials here quite truly special. I ended up choosing the roasted duck/pork combo, and it was only for $14! The duck pieces were a bit difficult to chew, but the pork pieces were tasty and well cooked. Would recommend.
No comment
No comment
Good food. I went there Monday. Good service , the waiters are friendly. The duck is the best one I have.
No comment

I felt that this restaurant would be good but wasn't too impressed with my lunch order. I got the shredded beef with peppers and brown rice -and it was quite greasy. Instead of having gravy which was expected, it was none actually- just oil. With the smaller portions restaurants are now giving , the amount of oil in this small serving was unnecessary. Yet another reason coming why come into the office is pointless- you get bad lunch. I tried, smh

I visited Mr. Sun several times during my month stay in NY and I wish so badly to return. The service is amazing and the dim sum amazing. Go here and try everything!! Especially the Pig Custard Buns (my favorite).
Went there on a Tuesday night - the Peking duck and crab meat soup dumplings were so good!
The food is good and the staff is friendly the only thing I didn't like was the bathrooms they were next to the kitchen and it wasn't very clean

column3: Corona Del Mar, Newport Beach, CA
column6: If you want simple nothing special food, with a special guess  or two (roach) this is the place for you. Do not recommend it and will never go back. This building needs to be inspected.

Foods were great and the place was clean. One thing to note is that the restroom is somewhat in the basement but fairly clean. Service was good but we requested for a fried rice but was served with rice noodles which was also good but they did not attempt to correct the matter. We were obliged, yes we were required by the server to tip 18%.

So good we came back twice! My husband and I were in New York for about a week and had to make a second round to Mr. Sun. Everything we had was amazing, such good flavor! We found it on Yelp, and noticed a bunch of locals were recommending so we had to try it out for ourselves. We were not at all disappointed! I recommend the shrimp and crabmeat dumplings with truffle sauce, they were the star of our meal, but everything we had we loved. And if you have room for dessert, the pig custard buns were DELICIOUS!
No comment
No comment

What an unexpected surprise! Was in Rockerfeller Center accompanying family from out of town to see the Xmas attractions. Lunch time came around and we wandered around to find a place seeking little or no wait and decent seating. All restaurants in the area are generally touristy, crowded, and overpriced; it's Rockerfeller Center, it's expected. Being with out of towners who weren't used of walking (normally I'd hoof it down to chinatown lol), we had to stay in the immediate area. We stumbled across Mr. Sun. Totally unassuming from the outside and inside. The interior decor is modern and minimalist. We stuck with basics for our food order: duck fried rice, shrimp lo mein, pea shoots with chicken soup, Shanghai shrimp rolls, crab & pork soup dumplings, pork ribs with house special sauce, edamame dumplings w/ black truffle sauce. Every dish was absolutely excellent. Highlights for me were the pork ribs (oh the sauce on those!...), pea shoots in chicken broth (tasty as f!), and of coarse the soup dumplings (as good as Joe's Shanghai). We were not rushed, the staff was attentive and kept our water glasses refilled. Would I return if in the area?  Absolutely.
No comment

Ordered delivery from here and am very happy. The food was absolutely delicious. We gave the soup dumplings to a friend who has never had soup dumplings, and he said it was amazing. The mapo tofu was also amazing, definitely a lot better than the average mapo tofu. The spicy fish was also soooo good. The Chinese food at this restaurant is legitimate. Will definitely come again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I went to a show a few blocks away, texted with them at intermission and they stayed open a little later for me. Despite having no other customers, they even let me eat there after closing instead of making me take it back to my hotel room. I had a half Peking duck and the garlic eggplant. Easily the best meal I've had on my trip from CA, especially considering the service. Will definitely come back next time I'm in New York.

Yum. My daughter and I stayed in Times Square for a pre Christmas trip to watch her twin brother run in a track meet in The heights this weekend. The soup dumplings were damn good. Unfortunately, we ordered chicken Lo Mein as well but got chicken fried rice. Whatever- it was good. We didn't care as we were watching the World Cup final. Id totally go back.

Great food, great prices, very good and fast service, nice and quiet ambiance. We went there on a Saturday evening, around 6pm, on a whim. We got the duck dumplings, the pork soup dumplings, the pea shots veggies with chicken soup, and the half Pekin duck. The prices were more than reasonable, the pork dumplings were really good. We loved the duck, it was really fatty and soft. Not salty at all, just very savory. The veggies and the chicken soup were a very good surprise to use, we loved those as well. We would come back here :)

Disappointing. With all the hype about Mr. Sun, and the very positive Yelp reviews, I really expected something great from Mr. Sun. While nothing was bad, it was simply okay. Okay does not warrant four or five stars. Looking forward to trying them again and seeing them reach their potential.
No comment

Found a solid dim sum place in mid-town, a walk away from Rockefeller Center. They had soup dumplings and even abalone shumai. We ordered a couple other items. It was well cooked, what I preferred, and it was delicious!
No comment

Visited Mr. Sun while in town with friends.  If you are looking for delicious Peking duck, dim sum, and lo mien this is the place for you!! We ordered a half of the Peking duck, various dim sum and the chicken l mien.  The duck was flavorful and moist with crispy skin.   Each of the dim sum orders were excellent.  The chicken lo mien was hands down the best lo mien I have had.  You can't go wrong with Mr Sun.

A newer restaurant located right along Times Square. The menu has several options to choose from, we tried the honey bbq pork buns to start and the pork was cooked perfectly. The beef with pepper was delicious but the dish comes with no rice or noodles and you would have to order an additional side. We also tried the beef lo mein which was amazing and large enough to bring home a whole other serving. Not a lot of seating, so take out may be the better option. We were greeted with a fresh bottle of sanitizer and then brought hand wipes at the end of our dish which I thought was a nice touch.

Blink and you likely miss this spot but DO NOT! Went for the lunch special and the food's solid. Good portion, great quality/freshness. Mr.Sun's a great addition to midtown and I'll definitely be back to try other dishes on the menu.
No comment

Went during their soft opening and ordered half a Peking duck in advance (order placed on phone, they call you since it takes 30-45min to prep), pork soup dumplings, and the string beans with pine nuts. Great flavor on all the dishes, pork dumpling skins were on the thicker side but very delicious. Duck was great as well but a bit pricy at $48 for half a duck. Would definitely come back again!
No comment
Get the edamame and shrimp truffle dumplings!! Shumai wasnt anything special and tomato fish was interesting, not sure how I felt about it but wasn't bad
Best Peking duck among other dishes but that my fave. Everything is so clean and fresh with awesome silverware and presentation.

It was kind of difficult finding a good restaurant to eat around NYE in NY around Times Square without a reservation or waiting for hours on the guest list. Luckily we found this hidden gem! I highly recommend their pecking duck. It was sooooo delicious! The skin was so crispy and had a lot of flavor. The truffle fried rice was also great! Solid five stars! FYI this is a Chinese restaurant so don't be an idiot like the table who sat behind us who asked if this restaurant served sushi.

Took a fellow restaurant owner here for his birthday (since I know he won't let me pay if we eat at his place). He loved it and so did I! We had the Peking duck, shumai, pork soup dumplings, veg fried rice, sweet pea shoots with garlic, and shrimp dumplings. Everything was delicious! The wait staff was courteous and attentive and overall excellent. Highly recommend Mr. Sun!

Super surprised it wasn't packed for a Saturday evening, but it was so worth it! We went in a group of 9 people in my party and they were able to accommodate my last minute call ~ our group tried a bit of everything and the Peking duck was the group favorite~ they got all of our food in a timely order and every enjoyed their first experience at a with soup dumplings~
Interesting new Chinese restaurant recently opened in Midtown. We ordered their signature duck, which was crispy on the outside just how I like it. They also have lots of dim sum options!
No comment
No comment
Delicious!!! Had stir fried rice noodles, fish fillets with chili oil and egg custard dumplings.
No comment
Great lunch special with quality food at a great price.   The duck and roast pig were perfect.  Everything was fresh including the soup dumplings.  Great friendly service.
Amazing cumin lamb and duck. Dim sum was quite good as well. The service was excellent,  although there was a lot of banging of plates at the dish station right next to us.
My go to spot in midtown. Super authentic Shanghainese cuisine, always has a table open. Zero frill. Get the eel thing..

I've been to Mr Sun in person as well as ordered lunch take out several times (being a block away from my office).  Favorites being Cantonese bbq ( roast pork , roast duck) as we as kung pao chicken .
Awesome Chinese food in mid-town.  Eggplant was fabulous.  Dumplings pork and shrimp wonderful.  Tiger prawns were perfection.

Highly recommend this restaurant! It's an authentic Chinese restaurant with flavors from Beijing, Shanghai, and Southern China (dim sums). The menu is curated for both non-Chinese and Chinese customers. Peking duck is really good here at a decent price. Be sure to order that ASAP when you arrive as it takes 45 minutes. Dim sums here are amazing too. Black egg custard buns are incredible. Also recommend pork belly with abalone. Have to say that service is incredible!!! Our waitress was so attentive, warm, and friendly.
Not great, not authentic dim sum. The menu is small and what we got was rather underwhelming. We got dumplings that had truffle in them and they weren't great. Truffle doesn't belong in these dishes.

we've been there a few times. For now it's my fav Peking duck place in Manhattan. Roasted ducks they have here however are the oily type. If you prefer drier version then this might not the place for you

This place is located right near Rockefeller Center so I definitely recommend checking this place out if you're in the area and looking for something to eat. It's a nice clean and spacious restaurant which is always a plus for me. The staff is super friendly and attentive. And I like the food, they are pretty innovative when it comes to their dishes like their tenderloin truffle dish or their Abalone Siu Mai. They also have peking duck, which is one of my personal favorites, but it was a tad on the oily side which was not really surprising since duck is pretty fatty in general. All in all the food here is pretty good so if you're in the area you should stop by.

Staying at the Renaissance two blocks away, so super convenient.  Place is very clean, tables offer lots of privacy. My server and Chef  who brought out the food we super nice.  My server must have refilled my class 100 times with lemon water. Duck Tongues were a different style than I am used to.  These were steamed with soy beans.  Well done.  The fish with chili oil, a standard tasted exactly like it should.  I came for dinner so didn't do the dim sum but others did. The Peking duck looked great. I love positive dining experiences.
Best food I ever tasted. Came here twice already and food was phenomenal. Soup dumplings dough was too thick to my liking. Overall food was great!

I went here with a group of my coworkers and was nervous because I can be a bit of a picky eater, but I thought the vegetarian options I ordered were great. I had the vegetable dumplings, the fried rice, vegetable spring rolls, veg dim sum, and the tofu. Our server was polite and didn't rush us out of the restaurant, so I felt quite comfortable. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant if you want a quick bite on your lunch break or want to try something new!
Really great establishment. Clean. Lots of options to order from. I had the Peking duck. It was good but I with it was crispier and less oily. I recommend the black truffle dim sum to try for sure.
No comment
No comment

What an amazing find in the heart of the theatre district.  Soup dumplings, shrimp and Pea Shoot dumplings, Peking Duck, BBQ Pork, Shrimp Fried Rice, Stir Fried Chinese Broccoli.  This lifelong New Yorker just had the best Chinese food ever!  Many thanks to our cheerful, accommodating server Lee!
Not bad for the lunch special. Took a while for them to prepare it but worth the wait. Wish they had more options for lunch appetizers because I'm not a fan of the sour soup.
You want delicious Dim Sum and a wife assortment of other delicious food. Stop here to eat if you are in NYC. Wow! Love this place. I would eat here every day if I could.
The food was all really great and the portion sizes were pretty good. The Peking duck is amazing and had a nice presentation in the way it's served.

We got a variety of food and really loved every little bit. From the taste to the presentation, it was delicious! We ordered this after my daughter's surgery and had a nice little meal in bed. The presentation made us smile and the food warmed our tummies.
We LOVED it! We had the edamame dim sum and it was amazing! We also had the eggplant dish and it was awesome as well. We were so happy with this choice while visiting NYC :).
No comment

Everything we ordered was so good! We ordered Dim Sum: Pig Custard Buns (pictured), Shanghai Shrimp Spring Roll, Pork Soup Dumplings, and Steamed Honey BBQ Pork Buns. Everything we ordered was really tasty and will definitely be coming back.

Ordered delivery - $15 for Rice noodle with chives and what showed up was noodles with pork. Since I dont eat pork I called them asking for sending me non-pork version and i can send the pork one back OR a credit. They said they cannot do either and "it's my problem" that i ordered one with pork. How am I supposed to know it includes pork when in fact their website doesnt specify the dish has PORK. YUCK- they just lost me as a customer. Good luck getting scammed by them and paying for overpriced deceptive chinese food

Great little spot to enjoy some really delicious food. Very close to the theater district and service was fast. We had shrimp, pork soup, and edamame dim sum ...so good, especially the pork soup dumplings. Spare ribs were on point. Will def be back.

Enjoyed our meal very much here. Food was excellent, especially the soup dumplings and truffle edamame dumplings. Staff was friendly and wore masks. Very conveniently located. Decor was cute and welcoming.

Went for lunch during the soft opening and the lunch specials were great. I got the pork rice noodle which had veggies, pork, and rice noodles. It was very good and the portion was filling. The location itself has been updated and had a nice ambiance. I would definitely suggest it for the lunch specials as the location is great and accessible to many office areas. I am looking forward to going again for dinner to try the peking duck.
The Peking duck is really good! Also highly recommend the beef stir fry with green peppers. The waiters/waitresses are super helpful and patient. Overall, great experience!
Highly recommend the Peking duck here! The skin is crispy and the meat is fat and tender. Also the pork belly is so delicious! Sweet and tender! Crab xiaolongbao is also a must order!
No comment
No comment
This was a great find in Midtown with lots of dim-sum options and other entrees served in a shareable format. Would revisit.

There's nothing will tell you if you want their peking duck, you'd have to reserve that before you come in.  We made our reservation on yelp and there's nothing telling us that.  When we came to the restaurant, then they told us you have to reserve that when you called in, but how would we know if we reserved thru yelp.
One of the best pecking duck in the city!!! Ppl do need to try this!!! Roast pork and black pepper beef are amazing as well. Highly recommend.
Love the food - especially the crab meat shrimp. Enjoyed the quick and friendly service as well as the chill vibe. Don't miss out if you are in midtown!
Peking duck is perfect. It reminds me of the duck I had in Beijing .  A hidden gem in midtown . We also had string beans with pine nuts and truffle shrimp dumplings .

We had such a good experience at Mr. Sun while visiting New York right before Halloween. We wandered in on a Friday afternoon, looking for dim sum, and we found it!  We loved the soup dumplings and the Peking duck was absolutely to die for--and it was our first time!  Thankfully, our server showed us how to eat everything the right way. Such great food and great service. I'd absolutely recommend!

Everything was so good!! Unique dim sum, beautiful and tasted great. Not your go-to place if you want to be full unless you want to spend lots of money. Overall, a great experience for some "fancy" dim sum.

BEST DIM SUM AND CHINESE FOOD IVE EVER HAD. Wow wow wow! My husband and I are traveling from Los Angeles and have had some great Chinese food/dim sum so we had high expectations, and Mr. Sun surpassed them all. We ordered the duck, spare ribs, beef fried rice and duck dumplings and siu mai.the duck was tender and the ribs were savory and not too sweet. The fried rice was light and fluffy! Everything was amazing! We will definitely be back soon!!!
No comment
This is a fusion cuisine.  Peking duck is very authentic, I love it!  Go try it～

New opening restaurant! The service is good!!! Price is reasonable. The best dish is sour and spicy soup... I think this is the best I have ever had... duck tongue is delicious as well. Xiaolongbao is not my style, but I know it is the traditional type... so I can't comment it... Recommend to try it...

Are you looking for an elevated Chinese cuisine experience with an affordable price tag? You need to check out Mr.Sun. Their dimsums are all housemade everyday at 7AM by their dimsum chefs. Their chefs use to work for a Michelin restaurant. This is how you already know the food will be incredible. We tried their Shrimp Dumplings w. Crab Meat & Truffle Sauce. It was soo good, the shrimp was fresh and you can taste hints of truffle. We also love the colors. The dark black dumpling wrap had the perfect texture too. It was soft yet firm at the same time. The duck dumplings were super flavorful too! We highly recommend getting that. The seafood dumpling with pea shoot was really good too, the vibrant green colors were so appealing. The abalone sui mai were delicious as well. Sui mai is a classic, but you guys gotta elevate the experience by adding the abalone. The pig egg custard buns were my boyfriend's favorite. The bun was so soft and the egg custard was sweet. And they are shaped like piggies!! Cannot get enough of that. The peashoot with chicken soup actually tastes like chicken soup. It was so good. We recommend getting that vegetable dish as well. Peashoot isn't a typical vegetable we find in our local western supermarkets, so whenever I see it on a menu at an Asian restaurant, I know I have to order it We had to get the pecking duck as well. For two people, we ordered half a duck, it was more than enough. The skin was super crispy. It was not fat, the meat was super lean, we did not get any fat. Usually when I order pecking duck else where, the meat is super fatty. I waited 7 years to find the perfect pecking duck in NYC. Best pecking duck ever. Their spare ribs were so flavorful and extremely meating! They were bone lickin good. The star of the show had to be the Beef Tenderloin with Black Truffle Sauce. If you are a truffle lover this is your dish. The beef was extremely tender, honestly we devoured this dish in less than 10 minutes. It was THAT good. We are so glad there is an authentic Chinese restaurant outside of Chinatown. If you are craving Chinese food and in the area of Rockerfeller, walk around the corner and check this spot out! It is absolutely incredible.

Could have been better. Has a lot of influencers advertising the duck. But I think that its average at best, but with a hefty price tag. Unfortunately I won't be back, but it was worth trying to see if its any better than other options in the city.
Great dim sum and reasonable prices. I went on a Sunday morning and it wasn't crowded. Great service!
Surprisingly good outside of Chinatown. Although limited choices, it is much appreciated as it's not overwhelming.

We had the shrimp, soup with crabmeat, and veggie dumplings and each one was DELICIOUS! So much flavor. We also had the piggie buns and the custard was so delicious we scooped it out but the bun dough was dry. We also ordered the chicken lo mein and it was the tastiest lo mein we have ever had!!! Must try.
This is a very good restaurant. Very attentive and kind staff and very clean along with a nice atmosphere. The food was the best part. Delicious dumplings and pork buns   thank you :)
No comment

The food was really bad. I paid $19 plus tax and tip for a carry out order of kung pao chicken. I didn't notice until I was 25 minutes away that they forgot the rice. I should have checked but when I asked they said everything was in the bag. I tried eating the chicken without the rice but the sauce was too rich, and filled with large bits of garlic. Garlic! Who would have ever thought that so much garlic needed to be in something simple like kung pao? It was really gross. I couldn't eat it. Waste of $24.

Stopped by on a weekday for lunch and found out they have a very affordable lunch special. It comes with your choice of either a can of soda or hot and sour soup which has to be the best hot and sour soup ive had before. The ingredients are a bit higher quality than what I'd typically expect from such soup and the flavoring is on point. I picked the mapo tofu which was quite authentic and paired very well with the rice. I've had a lot of mapo tofu and this is definitely above par flavor-wise. I also have tried their roast duck and roast pork lunch special which I had no complaints with and came in reasonable portion sizes. Will probably be back often if I'm craving a fast and affordable authentic chinese meal.

The food was delicious. We ordered the pork soup dumplings and fried rice. Everything was hot and flavorful. Our hostess even was kind enough to give us a brief class/demonstration on using chopsticks when asked. I will definitely be back. Be careful not to miss the location because the signage is minimum due to construction. Really nice atmosphere and great food.
Peking duck is delicious! Great yelp find near the Rockefeller center. Will stop by on next nyc visit

We order Peking duck from many restaurants including hutong, hwa yuan, uluh etc and this is the most ridiculously small portion that I've seen, except maybe at hakkasan which is now closed. The pea shoots also didn't come with rice. The duck was good quality but has to be reheated in the toaster oven, which is sadly normal for all delivery duck. The pancakes were nice and thin but congealed together. Bottom line tasty food but skimpy portions

I ordered a few of the most popular dim sum items on the menu, and I must say they were each underwhelming. Nothing I've had makes me want to return. And when we bring the price into the equation, I have to bring it down another star, because the price more than doubles the price of similar items at other popular dim sum spots, yet, as I mentioned,  the taste was mediocre.
first time trying this place and got food poisoning. i ordered all the popular dishes and the servers were rude.
The food is not very good in general. I ordered tofu with egg yolk, it's too fishy to eat, not really for pescatarian/vegetarian.

Food was bad. We got hot & sour soup which was tasteless. Kung pao tasted like stale peanuts. Duck roast was hard to even chew. People around me were curious why 2 stars and not lower. An extra star is mainly for the good service.

Amazing and delicious Chinese / Dim Sum.  Service was good and fast.  COVID rules and precautions were strictly enforced.  The inside is modest but food outstanding.  Good for largish groups and families, or couples.  Soup dumplings, mapu dofu, eggplant, greens, and other dumplings were all excellent.  Drink selection is modest; only alcohol was bottled Heineken; otherwise there is tea and soda.
Great food and service! Ordered the duck, beef and fried rice. They took extra care of our food restrictions.
Loved their dim sums!! We ordered almost all kinds and the only thing we weren't fan of was duck dim sum. Food came out pretty fast and server was nice!
Really lovely, quick service and food was delicious. We had Peking duck, veggie stir fry and bbq pork buns. All were delicious.
Amazing food would buy again try the truffle dumplings to die for!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Ordered takeout for lunch-- the lamb cumin noodles are delicious! Can't wait to try other menu items
No comment

Loved Mr Sun.  Everyone was so nice and welcoming.  Great selection of dim sum, including some that I'd never had before:  shrimp dumplings with crab meat & truffle sauce, duck dumplings, soup dumplings with crab meat.  Lots of traditional dim sum and entree choices as well.
Solid newish location in mid town for dim sum - sort of a limited selection given its a soft opening, but everything we had was delicious.

We came on Thanksgiving night as we are out of towners looking for non-turkey dinner. The Peking duck was amazing and slb was pretty good too. Need to step up on service, hard to get hold of someone if you need anything. Otherwise a solid Peking duck restaurant.

Wonderful food! Real chopsticks, not throwaway, beautiful gold long-handled fork and spoon. We had crab soup dumplings, crab and shrimp with black truffle, regular shu mai, and duck dim sum. It was all terrific. Even though we're only in NYC for a few days, we'd eat here again. The one thing I'd suggest is that the walls need some decor - it feels pretty bare. But for a soft opening, this is really spectacular.

Yum!!! The staff were very friendly and helpful when ordering. Soup dumplings were good although I've had better elsewhere. The home style fried pork was delicious but pretty spicy. The best dumplings hands down were the crystal shrimp dumplings. I would come back again just for those!

Great location near Rockefeller Center and the Nintendo Store. Simple menu (Which is great) with the appropriate amount of items for Dim Sum and regular dishes. Ordered soup dumplings, chicken fried rice, steamed pork buns, vegetable spring rolls, and tea. All were delicious. Service was great, and made sure we ordered the appropriate amount of food for 3. No one left hungry! Decor was perfect, and very fancy dishes and utensils. Recommend Mr. Sun!
Terrific dim sum. Soup dumplings were great. Abalone siu mai was amazing. Highly recommend.
No comment

Ate here today for the 4th day in a row, still in soft opening. Major upgrade from the other 2 Chinese restaurants on the block. Food is hot, fresh, delicious, generous portion size. The prices reflect that. Staff is very friendly helpful and competent, very refreshing compared to the service at other Chinese restaurants. I've had: the regular har gow, black har gow, jellyfish, sesame balls, tofu with crab, fish in chili sauce, edamame dumpling in truffle sauce (twice), and kung pao chicken.

very decent peking duck and crispy pork belly siu yuk. its kinda pricey but makes sense for the location. they did the best they could with the space but the resturant layout isnt that good and the bathroom is in the basement. Would go back again.

Very authentic and fresh with interesting non standard tastes. We ordered the custard bun, fried pork belly, abalone siu mai, bbq pork, cumin lamb. Everything was delicious, but the standout was the pork belly. You need to order this.
Everything was excellent but the Peking Duck was outstanding, very similar to Beijing.  Our new go to Chinese when we visit NYC!
Food was awesome, they accommodated us when we were there close to business. Definitely recommend.

All the dishes we ordered were really good to excellent.  The Peking duck is a must try.  The truffle seafood dumpling was also amazing, especially if you love truffle like me.  The only problem is that the decor does not match the quality nor the price point.
Delicious. The duck was the best I've ever had. Perfectly cooked and crispy with beautiful presentation. The staff was so friendly and attentive. The dim sum was great
Came in for lunch and the food was delicious and highly authentic with great atmosphere. Got crab soup dumplings and Mapo tofu, both fantastic. Highly recommend!
Soooo delicious! Got the roast duck/roast pig lunch special and it's better than many places in Chinatown. Meat wasn't dry or tough
Excellent dumplings this place really nailed the truffle shrimp ones. I have never had a better dumpling and yes I've been to Joe's Shanghai!!

Everything was so absolutely incredible. The food was impeccable, we loved their soup dumplings and the roasted pork was phenomenal. Definitely going to become a go-to spot for us. The staff was also extremely accommodating, kind, and considerate. Thank you for such a lovely experience!
Delicious dim sum close to Rockefeller Center. Fast and tasty, friendly staff. I left my gloves after lunch  and they kept them for me until I could come pick them up.

Nice open set up, but felt like people were cramped on top of one another. No liquor, but that wasn't a major deal. We didn't know it was BYOB. Food was just okay. There was nothing we loved enough to return although my wife and I agreed that it may be the new opening frenzy, so we decided to get it another try a few weeks or mouths from now to see if anything changed.
I like the Peking Duck most! It has crispy skin and tender meat. The wrapper is very thin, which is perfect.
The Peking Roasted Duck is super authentic! Staff were really friendly and welcoming.
We had an amazing dinner here. The portions were huge (and thats coming from 2 Pacific Islanders) so we shared the dishes we ordered. Will definitely come back and yes, 100% recommend.
The best Pecking Duck in NYC!!! And dim sum is extremely delicious that you shouldn't miss!
The best food we had in our visit to NYC. Amazing dim sum and bao buns. Also we loved the green beans. Would definitely go back.
Food was excellent. We were a party of 6, so was able to order a lot of dishes for share. Peking duck, mapo tofu, steamed fish, dumplings, steamed desert buns, pork belly etc. A nice meal.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: LOVE going here after a day of work. Food is authentic like my grandpa made. That's how you know it's good! Haha.
Great service. Food was really good. Great selection and flavor in the food. We did some dim sum as well as ordered off the entree menu. I would recommend this place for sure.
10/10 service!! Kiki was so attentive, so sweet, so quick, so professional. Food was fantastic, ingredients were fresh, everything was hot on arrival. A little expensive, but would come again!!

Super delicious food. The pig custard buns are adorable, soft, and sweet. The pork soup dumpling skin is a bit thick for my liking but overall the dumpling is still very tasty, with lots of soup inside. Cozy spot to eat and staff is very pleasant too.
A hidden gem amongst the tourist trap grossness of times square food. Delicious and very reasonably priced. Came here twice during our 3 days in NYC!
Just ordered the kung pao chicken, tastes amazing. Spicy, peanuts, garlic, chicken all you need

This place is AMAZING. It is new so they don't have their beer and wine license yet but regardless we had an excellent meal. The peaking duck was to die for! The crab soup dumplings were so good we ordered a second round for the table. Very attentive staff eager to help and show you the proper way to eat dim sum if you are new to it. I would recommend for tourists and locals alike!
Tried the vegetable dumplings, duck dumplings, and steamed honey bbq pork buns. All really bland. Would not recommend.
Everything we had was delicious. From the roasted pork to the dim sum. Very centrally located and great service. Worth a try!
Awful service! Waited forever to get our food. And waiters don't know what we ordered. Two tables came after us got their food first. Disappointed
Extremely authentic Chinese cooking. The salt pepper fish is my personal favorite, but everything else is amazing as well. Love it! Lunch special is a great deal.
We had Peking duck, dim sum and also the stir fried veggies. Everything is fresh and tasty!

I found the place walking around looking for an eatery. I was very impressed by the quality of the food.  We had the pork rib appetizer, low mein noodles and dumplings. Very good in quality and taste.

Food was good! Especially the karage fries and yakiniku!! We got 2 orders once the first was finished. A group of 9 surprising the birthday boy in the corner of the restaurant made it a good place to hide. As the tables were bar designed with high tops and slim space for free leg/arm room, we made the birthday boy limbo to his middle table seating arrangement. Great atmosphere with drinks / entree and apps. The japanese spaghetti about $22 was delicious, just wish it was a tad bit more creamier/saucier( add a protein, it's  only noodles). Chicken katsu with rice and curry was thick and filling. Ramen bowls looked great and not dense with oil. By the end of our meal, surprisingly they gave us matcha alcoholic shots, that's not on the menu. Not bad. Instead of the normal hot burn down your throat, it was brain freeze cold  lol
No comment
No comment

Came here for lunch and everything was so good! The katsu, fries, and the RAMEN!!!! It was surprisingly good. Also tried this melon beer that tasted like melona. They also make alcoholic slushies. At night the place gets pretty fun, will come back!
No comment

Came to this place to try. The appetizers were really good. The calamari a little different from most places. The batter was already seasoned and squeeze some lemons on it and you don't need marinara sauce. The takoyaki had the right amount of sauce on it. Some places usually drenched. The skewers were done well. But the sauce was too sweet. The chicken wings fried very well. But too much sauce overpowered the chicken. The don was okay. And the ramen unique flavor to it. Not a bad place to try. But I did not like the height of the food was at the appetizer and then went down from the entree. But my ramen unfortunately was too buttery and oily gave me a stomachache and had diarrhea. Flavors good. But maybe too buttery for the stomach. I would come back for the apps and maybe a different ramen that's not buttery or oily.
No comment

This is a great, low-key spot for Izakaya food and drinks. They have so many drinks, and even a bottled sake that comes in a cute keepsake glass with a doggo on it! My friends and I walked in without a reservation on a Friday night and were still able to get a table with no trouble. I like that the vibe is not pretentious at all, and there's no need to dress up to dine here. They have the usual Izakaya fare but we only ordered karage to share. The karage comes with a big portion. The chunks of chicken are meaty but tender and well battered. I also ordered the black garlic ramen, which was on par with what you would find at a ramen shop. Thick, smooth noodles, flavorful broth and the usual char sieu and soft boiled egg yolk made this an excellent bowl of ramen. My only complaint was that they only have one piece of char siew and half a  soft boiled egg while most places give 2 of each.
No comment

No comment
No comment

I returned yesterday to give this place a 2nd chance!! I'm happy to say that I was very very satisfied with the gyudon bowl I ordered. The fatty sliced beef and runny poached egg atop a bowl of steamy, saucy rice was such a dream in my mouth! The gyudon definitely out shines the ramen bowls here. I also ordered the chicken karrage as take-out for my boyfriend and he was a fan! This place will now be my go-to in the LES for japanese food! Can't wait to order that beef bowl again...and again...and again...
No comment
No comment

Absolute gem of a place.   We were lucky that one of the neighborhood locals recommended this place, or we may have missed the excellent experience.  The food is excellent.  Every from the edamame with dressing, to the meat skewers and the spicy ramen - everything was delicious. We were there at lunch time and the service was really fast. Its a lovely chill ambience and we will definitely be back!!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: The meat in the ramen always feels a bit chewey/low grade. They have a nice beer selection from Japan and their chicken skewers are fantastic.

Food's amazing, especially their croquette and skewered pork belly 100% would recommend!

Definitely a gem. LARGE variety of international beers, sake, and wine. Affordable and delicious dishes that are well portioned and leave you wanting more. Staff is friendly and always able to recommend great selections. Great place for a quick late night bite!
No comment
No comment

Casual, a little funky, great choices for ramen, don, small plates. Busy Friday night but nicely handled a last minute reservation change. Everything we had was fantastic! Definitely a place we'll take friends

We live in the Lower East Side but somehow missed this place until now.  Not many lunch places open these days in LES, so we headed over to try it.  Boy, what a find!  To start with, they opened the outdoor seating just for us, and it has open/close windows.  The food was delicious, and we enjoyed what the owner said was the largest selection of Japanese beers in the US.  We started with the potato croquettes, which were delicious.   This was followed by (for me) the Yakiniku (absolutely awesome) and the house fries with cheese.  My (vegetarian) wife had the spicy vegetarian ramen, which she loved.  The service was awesome, the owner a super interesting guy to speak with.  We definitely will be back, again and again.

Really strong and underrated restaurant! Came here on a weekday evening and it was almost empty. Main con was that everything was still being served in disposable containers, but otherwise food was great. The shishito peppers were fresh and had lovely flavor when grilled and paired with a squeeze of lemon. Ordered a gyudon and it was super tasty--lots of flavor and they didn't skimp on the amount of beef they gave you. Just exactly what you want from gyudon, comforting and filling. Service was decent but mostly left us alone. I would come back!
No comment

Came here for an AMAZING dinner last night. 10/10 all around. The environment is very casual and they have both indoor and outdoor seating options. The staff was super helpful in providing recommendations for our drinks, appetizers and entrees. I wanted to try a new Japanese beer but had no idea what I wanted - the waiter brought a few options to the table and talked me through each of them. Everything was amazing!! We didn't get a photo of the chicken wings appetizer but it was absolutely delicious - sweet, juicy, and crispy The pork buns were soft and the meat was extremely tender. All 3 of us got the Kushi Yaki Don (3 skewers over rice) and the meat was cooked to perfection. The rice was also very tasty and had a nice sauce on it. I will definitely be back for more!!
The food was outstanding abd worth a return visit. The outdoor shack is pretty run down and results in 4 rather than 5 point rating

No comment

Giving 2.5 stars not just 2: We ordered the chicken cutlet bao buns and vegetable bao buns. I assumed chicken cutlet meant breast, but it was actually a slice of fat. I think that was my fault for not asking. The vegetable bao buns had two pieces of zucchini each. I think I expected something a bit different in terms of vegetables. We also ordered the oroshi karage, and it wasn't that crispy but otherwise good. The beef bento was just okay but the salad was very soggy so I skipped it. Service is really great though! I will give it another try and order something different

No comment

This restaurant was a hidden gem! We had dinner in China Town and were looking for a place where we can have a light food and a drink and then we found this place on Resy. Food was excellent and the sake & japanese craft beer selections that they've had were absolutely amazing. I'm planning to go back to this place tonight as well!

This is my first and only Yelp review: This is my favorite bar in nyc hands down. We get a free drink every time from the best bartenders. Please ask for the matcha beer- they hand make it in front of you! The food is also incredible. I can't say enough good things about this bar- just go!
Very casual (all disposal cutlery/plates) but tasty. Everything was delicious and service was fast.

Nothing to fill the gut and warm the heart like a whole lot of beer and skewer after skewer of grilled goodness. Chicken thigh and zucchini skewers are truly top notch.
No comment
This restaurant is a great asset to the neighborhood, offers great service and as a bonus, has the best dog treats in the city, according to the happy customer on the photo.
No comment

We sat inside for dinner. Great Japanese beer list. Many kinds to choose from and some drafts as well. Food was mediocre. Not that tasty - got premade food feeling. Service was okey. One thing I didn't fully enjoyed was their plates. All food and drinks come in disposable containers. Paper plates for sharing plates. It's still COVID time but I didn't vibe with that for dine-in experience. I'd come back here for a beer or two perhaps

Didn't expect it but, Izakaya Juraku was truly amazing. The atmosphere of this place is great and so inviting! I am very happy that we got Lotus Chips, this was one of their best dishes, extremely flavorful and delicious. The servers are pretty courteous and polite. Izakaya Juraku - Very impressive.
No comment

We ordered a ton of small plates - raw octopus, happy hour tofu, shishito peppers, beef and chicken skewers, avocado salad, braised pork belly; and for drinks, we had sake from Tokyo. Everything was extremely yummy! The service was a bit weak, but the food and the atmosphere from the Japanese decorations outweigh. Would def go back again
No comment

Really enjoyed our visit today. Nice outdoor tent and booth tables. Excellent covid precautions. Tapas-like portions, all very reasonably priced and delicious! We had the takowasa, takoyaki, pork belly skewers, agedashi tofu (broth a little sweet), karate chicken with daikon, and yellowtail don (just a tad too salty). Well done to the owner. Thank you!
Incredible Izakaya experience! Great service and quality ingredients made simply and made well. Shout out to Kiyo - super nice guy. Would highly recommend the beef and chicken skewers!
No comment

My boyfriend and I were exploring the area and stumbled upon this place. The food is great and quick, customer service is on point and prices are reasonable!!! I would post a picture of the food but it was so good, it's all gone

Ambiance was awesome! Sat in the alcove area which I liked being that I am short I like to be less close to the ground! Food is amazing here! Small bites if you want to enjoy good company and their selection of cocktails and drinks but they also offer heavier food items like their boozy ramen! Staff is very friendly here shows good hospitality enough for you to want to return or become a regular if you're a local!

Food could be a little better but the drink selection is amazing. They offer outdoor seating.

Just had dinner here! It was delicious! We had seaweed salad, octopus balls, miso ramen and udon noodles. Everything was fresh and flavorful! The ramen broth is sooooo good! Definitely coming back soon!
Food and drinks are great. Will definitely go back to try other beers. Good to go during happy hour, some appetizers are discounted.

Tried this Japanese spot with a friend tonight for dinner. They have a daily HH until 8 pm so we indulged in a couple rounds of cocktails! The dishes are small plates and despite Izakaya being in their name, the menu is much more expansive than just grilled skewers. My faves were black truffle lotus root, agadeshi rofu, shishito peppers, and some pork belly in a tasty broth dish...super tender and flavorful. Would definitely return.

Matcha Hops! My first time trying this today. It's so great. I love this place. The anbai miso bacon is sooo yummy! So many craft beers and amazing Sake.Thumbs all the way up. A great chill place to bring friends and hang.
