first off, I'm not exactly sure of the different names this place goes by, but I found this place under Grubhub under the name of Saru Japanese Cuisine. it wasn't until I called them directly that the caller ID said Izakaya Juraku so I'm mentioning it here so it gets the proper attention. as for my review, the overall price for our meal was good, but the food and service were tasty and REMARKABLE! ordered the vegetable korokke, Japanese chicken wings, 2 katsu don and 2 miso soups. the korokke was still crispy, as were the chicken wings - both rich with flavor. the katsu don was a good sized portion and tasty as well. everything was delivered promptly, however one of the miso soup containers had spilled soaking up everything at the bottom. after contacting the restaurant they promptly replaced the miso soup... would definitely order again!
No comment

Awesome sake and yum food! Nice environment for chatting, hangout and selfie. Nitro matcha definitely should be ordered, very special cold tea, the most umami and delicates feeling I never had before. Sashimi don was amazing, fresh and healthy

Oh man, I really wanted to like this place and couldn't figure out how my fellow Asians had let me down so badly. But let me down they did. The service here is so lovely but can't make up for lackluster food. A couple of the items (karaage, haru maki) were good but clearly the reason to come here is the beer, which I don't drink.
No comment

Came here on a weeknight and it wasn't that packed. I was craving some ramen and this spot was in the area so I decided to check it out. I ordered the Tonkotsu ramen and it was okay. The noodles were very soft and had no chew to them at all. Not sure if they just overcooked it or what. The broth wasn't as rich as I'm used to for higher priced ramens as well. The one redeeming factor was the pork. It was soft and almost melted in your mouth. They do give u a free appetizer if you check in on yelp so that's a plus.

Love their wine list! Lots of Japanese alcohol drinks! The food is mediocre, but their happy hours is good till 8pm. Their pork bun and scallop sashimi were bad in my opinion, so save your money on those two dishes. The ramen broth was really good, but their eggs weren't cooked right. Other ramen places did a much better authentic Japanese ramen style job.
Great atmosphere, vibes, and music. My family and I really enjoyed and everything was delicious. The service was excellent! Definitely will go back again.
Cold tomato ramen was super delicious! Also tried the lotus chips, niku jaga, and the eggplant which were all tasty, though I liked the eggplant best. Nice place to hang out!
Lucky this place is open! Had the buta no kakuni (braised pork belly), so yummy. Friendly neighborhood restaurant serving delicious dishes, will definitely be back.
Always a super comfy spot to visit. And the new black garlic ramen is SOOOO good. Especially when paired with a good bottle of beer.
No comment

The high number of stars is deceiving. The broth of the tonkatsu ramen had no flavor although we added the spicy powder. The katsudon was really soft and the chicken didn't have a crunchy outside. Also the rice was proportionally higher than the meat. Nice staff but not worth it.
No comment
Hosted a party of 15, hosts were super accommodating and very nice. The food was great and everyone loved the time there. Will definitely come again - especially for happy hour.
Small cozy place to have ramen and don. The food price is very reasonable. They have plenty of choices of beer and sake too. Family friendly and a very nice crew in the store.
This spicy ramen is fitting the spot. It's got a nice heat, not messing around. The egg was also exactly on point. Nice vibe, good drink selection. I'm happy.

I came here and only ordered off of the happy hour menu and the food is delicious. I pretty much ordered everything that was on the happy hour menu but the garlic sauteed edamame was one of my favorite snacks, but you should try everything on the happy hour menu. The cocktails are on point. I got a well detail description of how each cocktail was made so the bartender knew what he was talking about. The cocktails taste so good that I tried everything on the happy hour menu as well and my favorite was the one that had yuza in it. They have a large selection of Japanese beer and I was surprise about the beer selection on the happy hour as well. Although it is is a very small spot, it really had a personal touch to it. It was a very cozy spot and was a quite spot. The service was great to and they had clean bathrooms.

Wanted to eat here every day while we were in town from SF for a long weekend. Every place we went, from here to eat, was good, very good, but Izakaya Juraku was the ultimate! After traveling several times to Japan, I know quality Izakaya. We had several shared plates (the short-rib dish is to die for) and udon. The lighting is dark and cozy and the music was relaxing. High quality Izakaya style food and excellent friendly service. We met Kiyomizu (took his card, as I doubt I could spell on my own!) and he told us the story of the restaurant. I'm sad we didn't go back, but I urge you to try it out and go every day if you live in NYC LES area!
One of my fave happy hours in the city for beer/sake and light bites. Manager is super knowledgeable and helpful. Food is tasty and spacious good ambiance for the LES.
The staff members are nice, and drink selections are great.  The space can easily fit a large group- celebrations can be hosted here without trouble (restrooms were very nice as well )
Fantastic beer selection both on tap & can. Delicious food, great happy hour deals & friendly + knowledgeable staff. Definitely coming back.

Delicious food with great vibes. The manager was super attentive and made our dinner much more enjoyable. The staff knew what they were serving to guests and truly understood their menu.  Their ramen is delicious, even after sitting there for almost an hour ( because we were too busy eating everything else we ordered).  Def worth the try.

They have a big selection if beer and sake.  The Saison was my best choice.   I am an fan of Tapas and they place offers a good Happy Hour menu till 8pm.   The Lotus Chip is a must, thin and crispy.  If you are down for more meat, theres the Beef Bulgolgi for meat lovers, chicken wings, curly fries.  I will admit, a bit salty on the Beef but because I love Tapas and works well with Beer.
absolutely LOVE this place! The food is so great (esp the garlic edamame), and the beer selection is also awesome.

Crazy good  and everything I had was absolutely bursting with flavor. The clear clam soup is the bomb! It looks like such a basic dish, but my tongue is on a thrill ride! The cheekbone Of yellowtail was fantastic. Great atmosphere, very friendly and helpful wait staff.
Yummy food and great beer selection. Service is always fast and friendly, and the seating is comfy. I'd suggest the karaage, shishito peppers, and the curry if you want something more filling.

Great, low-key spot.  We arrived closer to closing so it was quite empty.  The bartender humored us with a ton of detail about the beers we chose.  Super friendly service and amazing prices, and the best selection of Japanese beer I've seen outside of Japan.  Would definitely recommend and go back.  We didn't have any food, but am curious to try it.
Great beers, delicious food, and the best curry pork tonkatsu I've ever had! Great for date night, catching up with friends, etc. Casual but fun. 10/10 will be back.
Variety of Japanese beers, the bartender explained the difference and walk us through the selection. Definitely coming back.
This is a great daily HH spot and you can truly enjoy a variety of different types of beer and sake. I recommend this spot for drinks and some bar food.

This place is a gem! The food is great (I had Shoyu Ramen), but the drinks were the highlight for me. Had a great time sampling Japanese craft beers and some sake and chatting with the super-knowledgable manager who was tending the bar. Highest recommendation for the L.E.S.
No comment

Really great casual meal before a show in the neighborhood.  Our server was super nice and knowledgeable, turns out he invented the miso-apple-caramel drink which was terrific.  Recommend the chicken kara-age, as well as the fried Japanese eggplant.  Great beer selection as well!  Highly recommended, we will be back for sure.

Wowza! I've been to my fair share of izakaya's in Tokyo and the food here was FANTASTIC. Got that NY flair while the food stuck true to Japanese Izakaya. Highly recommend the yakiniku. By far the best thing on the menu. Drink selection is phenomenal, would recommend in a heartbeat!
This place is AWESOME! The ramen is always fresh, and tasty. The broth always has lots of pork flavors, they have great drinks and they are very casual.

I had no idea about this place but was blown away!! Great service (the staff is incredibly nice) and awesome Japanese food. Loved the tofu, the karage, the don and the curry. Highly recommend. Will definitely come back!
Incredible selection of very hard to find Japanese beers at incredible price points.
Great food , good service, and cheap.  Cant ask for more .  Highly recommend this place.   Shoyu ramen is great.

Had such high hopes and in actuality not all that bad. The service was a bit less than attentive but were warm and welcoming tableside. Still in the 'opening up' phase so looking forward to them ironing out the kinks. Has so much potential. Looking forward to returning and giving it another shot.
Great food and service. We had steamed butter clams, fried chicken and beef bowl with 2 Japanese craft beers. The atmosphere was very charming.
Fantastic food and great drinks menu. A little under-the-radar gem.

This place is great.  A terrific find. I will come back. I was looking for a Japanese place that specializes in classic grill and dumpling items. They do that here, and it was very good, but to my great surprise and delight, they also have the most extensive drinks program of any Japanese restaurant in the country. No exaggeration. Huge selection of Japanese craft beers, including awesome rare Japanese beer on tap. For instance, they offer a Hitochino yuzu lager that was incredibly delicious. I liked it so much that I tried the other Hitochino on draft, which was a sour, and it was just as good! Subtle, refined, delicious, not ridiculous overhopped and in-your-face like American craft beers. Izakaya Juraku also has superb sake selection, again at very reasonable prices.  I had a lot of fun talking to the manager who is a super chill dude with a lot of experience in the NY restaurant scene. He and the cook started the restaurant with the goal of providing something you can't find elsewhere in NYC: a relaxed easygoing Japanese place that you can relax in and where you can stay late and hang out for drinks.

Probably the best restaurant I've eating at in the 5 years I've lived in NYC. Ceviche was perfect, great service, beautiful ambience. Perfect date spot, Manhattan and drinks were on point! 100/100 in my opinion
Steak Tartare and Drinks were good. Owner was receptive of our feedback about the items that we did not enjoy :)

Artesano is truly amazing offering delicious Peruvian food in beautiful and artistic display on stone plates. The cocktails are also creative and tasted amazing  The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, and the interior design of the restaurant is simply stunning. I highly recommend anyone looking for a unique and flavorful dining experience to try Artesano!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Overall, this restaurant has a lot of potential and I am optimistic that it is working itself up to being great. The restaurant interior is really beautifully decorated, and you really do feel transported coming off the street. The service is really nice too. The menu is really imaginative and thoughtful as well. While everything was plated beautifully, I think when it came to execution though there were little things that were off. In particular, the gnocchi felt like they had gone past pillowy into too-soft territory, the short rib was a little dry, and the texture of the overly hard chulpi mixed with soggy calamari wasn't particularly pleasant. The tiradito nikkei was phenomenal though, and I really liked the reimagined chilcano and Peruvian gems dessert. I'm curious to come back once the menu has rotated and see what this place is like with more time under its belt.

Delicious! All the flavors you expect but with a twist in a gorgeous presentation. The service was top notch too. Thrilled to have this new addition in our neighborhood
No comment

Had a great meal at Artesano. The flavors were so unique and different from course to course - we did the tasting menu. Staff was great, presentation of food was great and the manager Roman came over a couple of times to chat, hooked us up with an extra birthday dessert course. Highly recommend!

My husband and I were eager to try Artesano from before it opened given we live around the corner and were following it's progress. We were not disappointed! We were pleased to find the service, cocktails, and food to be as good as the beautiful ambiance. We sat at the bar and enjoyed watching the bartenders make the pisco sours! I had the classic ceviche and my husband had the short rib. We recommend both. We look forward to trying the tasting menu next time. It is such a treat to have this gem in the neighborhood and like our neighbors who we ran into there, we'll be back often!

No comment

As a Peruvian live to find Peruvian spots. ARTESANO NY is an amazing place to go. Cocktails are A1, I try the chicha sour, passion fruit sour and classic pisco sour, don't ask me which one is the best. Love all of them. Chef a great host. His aji de gallina croquettes delicious and the tuna w/quinoa spectacular!!!. Service nice and attentive. Can't wait to go back again
Absolutely wonderful. We went on a Friday night, and were delighted by the food and service. Great experience, and would highly recommend!

So unique! The food and service were absolutely amazing. My husband and I had a wonderful time here and can't wait to come back. It was cool trying tons of different food and ingredients we had never heard of.

When you sit at the bar and risk not getting a reservation for a table you get what we got. Excellent service, well informed bartenders that were precise and showed us how to enjoy the drinks and also the variety of Peruvian fusion dishes. We custom made about six dishes very similar to the tasting menu. Try the tuna tiradito style and the duck. The chicha morada dessert had me using my fingers to get the picarones sauce off the plate. Granted I had six drinks and a courtesy mezcal shot but it was worth it. Food should get a 4star review but overall the drinks were simple but elegantly presented and the pairings were spot on like my tequila drink. I can't wait to go back to the city and sit at the bar again.
We went to the tasting menu on Saturday night and it was spectacular. Highly ecommend the Andino beef and ceviche!
Hands down the best new restaurant in Tribeca. The ambiance, food and presentation was amazing. Drinks were also spectacular - I'd highly recommend trying the Classic Pisco Sour!

The attention to detail on the food and drinks are amazing. Each dish has its own special story. This is my first time feeling like a king at a restaurant. I will be bringing my friends and family to share a unique experience.

We visited the night of Halloween, although the food was good the service unfortunately was not. There was lack of communication between the server or whoever was attending our table. We presided to let the manager know and he was not very pleasant at all. The drinks were not good after waiting an hour for them on a not busy night
Another gem in NYC .Food ,taste , presentation were perfect. Place to visit again and again !

Really excellent food. Buzzy, neighborhood restaurant with serious cocktails and a small but incredibly well-executed menu. The room is pretty and a good backdrop for the food. Every single thing I ate was absolutely delicious. I'm looking forward to an expanded menu with a few more choices.

Amazing pasta place in Uptown. A lot of personnel to serve guests, food was ready super quick and it was delicious. The ambience was super nice, a very enjoyable dinner. I don't put 5stars since I think it's a bit overpriced

First time at Piccola! I went on a late Sunday afternoon. It was busy, so I got a seat at the bar! My fiancé and I enjoyed the atmosphere! The menu had many choices and all of it sounded delicious! He got the cacio e pepe and I got mushroom pasta!! It was so good! The cacio e pepe was served from the cheese wheel! We got arancini for an appetizer which was tasty! We loved our waitress Maddalena! She said she was from Florence and we told her we were going this summer!! She recommended some spots which was great! I would definitely come back!

We stumbled in to Piccola's after walking Central Park on Spring Break. We were met with very friendly staff and were accommodated quickly. We really enjoyed our meals that were excellent and nice portions for lunch. The front window table was just perfect! I highly recommend this restaurant and would love to go back for dinner!! It is a small place . It was not spacious. Food was ok nothing was special. There is not enough space to move

Reallyyy good pasta, but definitely on the pricier side. The portion was extremely filling though, and I got to take some home. Not too crowded and I was able to talk to my friend for a while there. They do have a good selection of wines as well

We went here and loved it. We sat outside and we really enjoyed the food. Make sure you have a reservation  - this is very important! Philip Guardione brings out the flavors of the Mediterranean - the flavors are from Sicility. You can choose from New York or Ibiza! How fabulous. Our meal came with bread - which was crispy on the edges and soft in the middle. We ordered some things to share - Spaghetti with pecorino cheese and black pepper. Our paccheri with lobster, scampi, and langoustine was excellent and the Ravioli Ossobucco was a hidden gem with an incredible balance of flavors and textures. We also tried the veal chop milanese which was excellent but not for the faint of heart - it can easily feed 2-3! Caesar salad - lettuce, crostini bread, shaved parmigiana cheese and caesar dressing. All so yummy. We ordered the tiramisu and they make it right there! The coffee was delicious as well. Cozy atmosphere for sure! Our servers were great and we will definitely be back. I loved this place!

Came here for lunch with a friend with a reservation, which I recommend because it was quite busy! I ordered the green tagliatelle, the pasta was very smooth and soft, but it was too salty of me. We also ordered an Italian ceviche, which was ok but nothing special.
No comment

My mom and I came here for Thanksgiving and we didn't realize how packed the place would be! The manager, Erica, was so nice and accommodating towards us. She really kept her cool even though it was apparent that the restaurant was overwhelmed by lots of people and lots of food orders. Italian food is my favorite! I've eaten at a lot of Italian restaurants all throughout the U.S. and even in South America. However, this was by far the BEST LASAGNA I have ever eaten in my life! We even got a couple of free cannolis at the end of dinner. We'll definitely be back!

The pasta was better than I expected it, and what I wish every Italian spot could be. Normally tomato based sauces are a miss for me because they can taste bland, but the paccheri tre crostacei was so good, savoury and filling. Def got my moneys worth
10/10 best Italian in nyc. We shared 4 pastas and all were fantastic. Great service the wild boar Ravi was to die for. I will be back

This is to die for! They serve you fresh and i loved their pesto here! Accommodating staff as well

Got the Pesto Gnocchi and it was really really good and the sauce was super creamy. The portion is definitely enough for one person; I even had some leftover and the little edible flower petals on top were so aromatic and a delicious surprise addition! Something that confused us, however, was that the lunch special is ONLY the pastas with the asterisks next to them so be careful with that because all the pastas are grouped together and we got mixed up! Even though we said lunch special gnocchi when ordering, the waiter didn't correctly inform us that the gnocchi wasn't part of the lunch special and then we were charged the regular full price. So, just keep in mind to read the menu properly if you order the lunch special! Other than that, great pasta!
No comment

Was here recently for lunch on Saturday. Place was packed and as you walk in immediately felt a nice Italian escape vibe. The menu offers so many unique dishes and everything we ordered was fantastic.  The house special branzino was amazing and could be the best I have ever had. The Cacio e pepe pasta was also amazing. Cacio e pepe means "cheese and pepper". The place serves the pasta table side directly from a hollowed out cheese wheel! Very cool presentation. The desserts did not disappoint either. Everything was good. The tiramisu is prepared table side and was incredible. The homemade ice cream  and cannolis were also excellent. Overall the restaurant could be one of the best Italian restaurants in the city.
No comment
No comment

I'm not sure I've ever had better Italian food in the USA. We had the octopus for the starters - which alone, was the best octopus we have ever had - it tasted so fresh and was perfectly cooked. I forget the name of my main course but uploaded a photo -  the pasta freshly made in house tasted Fantastic in the sauce (lobster). Then finally, dessert. Now passion fruit sorbet may not sound sexy. But oh my word. I could have eaten a gallon of it. We will be back now we have found a place to move to very close to this place! This little gem has made me excited to move to the neighborhood.

Just came back from Italy and haven't been able to grasp a taste of it coming back to the states. Piccola did a great job accommodating my acquired pasta standards! Full of rich flavors, the complimentary bread was so fresh and fluffy with the sides (hummus, sun dried tomato sauce, vegetable sauce) which complimented the fresh bread so well! The only reason why I would give a 4 star is because of the cheese focaccia bread being overpoweringly salty from the overwhelming cheese inbedded between the layers. However, the focaccia breading itself was very fresh and thin crusted. Great Sicilian restaurant and would definitely come back again!

Friendly, attentive service. We felt like we were eating at the restaurant of old friends. The food is authentic, simple but top notch fresh ingredients, just like in Italy. Don't show up without a reservation. The hype is real.

Great restaurant I googled a few places to eat and make a reservation before my trip. This was one more of a neighborhood vibe. The service was 6 stars I was blown away. I started with a Cesar salad I had to get more dressing it was lacking. Did my entree I ordered spaghetti Caico y Pepe. The noodles were fresh and homemade. The problem was it was made 2 orders for the tables. It was warm by the time it was served. I like my food served very hot. Besides that the good quality was excellent.

I've never been more humiliated! We were celebrating my friends promotion and we were asked to leave the restaurant due to the "limited time" we had reserved the table for. They argued that it is advised on Open Table about it, when is not (screenshot attached). We consumed wine, appetizers, main courses, etc... The staff was making clear they wanted us to leave so they could accommodate other guests. I've never felt more uncomfortable in a restaurant in New York City before. Food is good, but watch out! They don't like customers here. They won't make you feel welcomed. Go to Carbone or Cipriani for a GOOD time!
No comment

I really don't want to leave this review because I'm scared too many people will find out about this hidden gem and it will be impossible to get in. For 2 years in a row now this has always been my favorite restaurant to go to whenever I'm in New York. Erica runs a tight ship and not a single thing or person gets by her, she is a magnetic fireball who has the very highest standards in in shows in the food, the service, and the vibe of the restaurant. As if the dinner wasn't already good enough, they offer table side fresh tiramisu and also make the best Nutella Panna Cotta I've ever had in my life.

This is an authentic spot and you know it the minute you walk in because everyone is speaking italian! The menu is straight forward with fresh pasta's and some italian classics. We started with the Roman style artichokes and sicilian rice balls. The rice balls were top notch filled with meal and had good flavor. Rice balls can be bland but not here. Artichokes were cooked perfectly. The cavatelli with lamb ragu was good but it needed some acid to it. Very one tone flavor but the fresh pasta was cooked nicely. The cacio e pepe was not my favorite since the sauce was very thick and gummed up the dish. The sea bass was exceptional and I would reorder that. There were some hits and some misses but overall we enjoyed our experience. I would come back!

Let's just say everybody who works here is from Italy and they all know how to make you feel welcome while enjoying a fabulous, authentic, Italian meal.  The meatball appetizer with mushrooms and black truffles is uniquely scrumptious and quite filling.  The Wild Boar  Ragu with spinach tagliatelle is creamy, savory and one of a kind.  Every single dish is prepared according to traditional recipes and served by people who care about your dining experience.  Great Italian wines and beer make this much more than an every day experience.  Just go.

Walked in just randomly while was in the city. What a gem! Great food, even better dessert. The inside was booked, they offered to seat outside. Was worried that it was going to be cold, but no , it was super warm! What a nice treat for myself!

Visited a friend after work and stopped by this place for drinks and light fare. Such an upbeat and vibrant place. Everyone was so nice and welcoming. We sat at the bar and the bartender was really nice and made us some great drinks. Also the food was bomb. I'll definitely be back!

I stopped in for a quick lunch and was blown away. The pasta was perfectly al dente, the scampi was fresh, and  the wine, recommended by the waiter, helped to round out the entire meal with a perfect balance of light and crisp tones, reminiscent of  summer. In the middle of this cold January in NYC, I was transported back to Italy, relishing the joy of living in the moment. A saluti!

This was easily the best Italian restaurant I have ever been to! Don't be worried if the sizes look small. The flavor is so rich the worker said hardly anyone finishes their whole dish. Such good service and amazing quality food!

I don't know what to say that is not redundant to all other reviews here. Food was amazing, our server was attentive and experience was superb. We went in late, after a show, without a reservation, so we totally lucked out and were able to get a table. Would love to return and recommend you do the same!

Came here for dinner without a reservation on Friday evening, it was a short wait before we were seated. We ordered scallops cerviche, burrata, tagliatelle, tiramisu, and their panna cotta. Every was DELICIOUS. The cerviche was so creamy, the burrata was super light, the pasta was flavorful, and the dessert was perfect! I felt like you can go no wrong eating here, don't miss out on dinner ;)

Visiting from out of state.  We just went to Rome and fell in love with ragú con cinghiale.   The restaurant had this and more, and theirs is delicious!  Good service and they were busy even at 3:30pm.  Will return.

Had a nice dinner here on a Thursday evening.  Place was busy at 8pm so I strongly recommend reservations.  We found the appetizer of the grilled octopus appetizer to be outstanding.  For entree, I got the Penne pomodoro and found it to be delicious.  Good sized portion too, not overwhelming.  The star of the show was our waitress, Cynthia, who was friendly, allowed us to dine at a relaxed pace, and a great ambassador for the restaurant.

I dined here for a girls night out and it did not disappoint! We sat outside for dinner and the outdoor dining was properly heated for a cold winter night. We were greeted with a basket of fresh bread which we happily devoured. My friends and I ordered a round of drinks, consisting of wine and a margarita on my end. For appetizers we ordered the bruschetta- the lobster guacamole was my favorite! The burrata was also super fresh and creamy. For entrees the cacio e Pepe did not disappoint and my friend loved her maccheroni alla Norma. Overall the meal was amazing and I would definitely come back!

The staff and service was impeccable! I ordered the penne alla vodka (I know, basic) and it was so delicious. I also tried my boyfriend's linguine and it was also so fresh and yummy. Will be returning!

Had a very lovely dining experience here!. Food was delicious, fresh, and reasonably priced for good portions. Aperol Spritz was made very well and tasted better than the ones I had in Italy. The cacio e pepe and tiramisu is made table side so it's a unique experience. Restaurant is well decorated and cozy. Reservations are a must. Oh and the staff is absolutely lovely and patient with any and all questions you have. Service was impeccable and made us feel at home . Could not find a single flaw with this place. Will definitely be coming back again!

Wonderful dining experience. Seated by Erika (sp) who had the most amazing, vibrant personality.

Wow this place is so good! Came with a party of 6 and had great service. The food was so good! I ordered the lasagna and I loved it. I had never tried lasagna that good! The ambiance is very calm inside. I would definitely recommend!

The spaghetti itself was also very thick and al dente, even after being cooked tableside. The table side tiramisu was also fun to watch but again, was heavy on the mascarpone and not enough cookie/coffee flavor. The remaining dishes were delicious! Good win list as well.

I love this place! The food is absolutely incredible. Even bread is great. Pasta is amazing. You can't miss tiramisu here! It's made on the spot and it's so interesting to watch it being made. Service is excellent and every staff member is super nice and friendly. It's my favorite Italian restaurant in the city!

Called ahead to make sure could dine in. Got there 15 minutes later and told can't for an hour and they had attitude.  Stay away from this place.  There's a lot of good restaurants in New York hope they close.

I'm happy to have found this excellent UES Sicilian restaurant.   I can't say enough about how nice and accommodating the staff are.  We are still eating outdoors.  We had a reservation but outdoor seating wasn't guaranteed. The staff moved some people and things and produced an outdoor table for 4 out of thin air.  Our hostess and waitstaff were lovely.  I started off with an excellent negroni.  We shared an order of mind blowing arancini and some excellent carciofi alla Romana.  We all had pastas.  Two of us had the pappardelle with mushrooms- which they liked.  One daughter and I had the pacchero with shellfish that was amazing.  The sauce had this deep umami undertone that was really unique. There was a generous portion of shrimp, a langoustine and a piece of lobster- really good.  The cappucino was on point. We were comped 4 small cannoli that were excellent.   It was a great dining experience with staff and food above and beyond expectations.  We will be adding this into our restaurant rotation.
100% would eat here again! Staff was so friendly and knowledgeable and all of the food was superb...very authentic to its cuisine & culture!

Flavio-the bartender is an asset for this amazing restaurant! Great service,amazing food and lovely ambiance even for late lunch. Their homemade pasta is outstanding:)

We decided to go here after seeing numerous videos online of the offerings of Piccola Cucina. Everything we had was delicious. Additionally, the cacio e pepe is brought out in a cheese wheel, and the tiramisu is assembled at table side, which is fun. It is clear that everything served is fresh and made in-house, and this is reflected in the overall quality of the meal. The service was also excellent, and the pacing of the meal was perfect.

Wow this place is so cool! Delicious food in generous portions and warm patient service. It was very fun and it's a cozy place. Very clean and organized and they work very hard. I've wanted to go here for awhile and will go back. My friend ordered a glass of wine and asked for it twice but it never came was the only negative. The hostesses are really sweet and accommodating and the bathroom is clean too. They are following regulations too. Grazie !

Today we had a family dinner really its was a great night place with customers you need to make booking in advance. Our experience great food very delicious and tasty also service , staff professional and supportive also cooperative .i rate this plance one of the best   restaurant in town.

One of the best meals I have had in Manhattan. As an Italian with parents who make extremely good food, I don't tend to actually enjoy a lot of Italian restaurants that people rave about. They are very generic and are really not what I consider to be good Italian food. Piccola Cucina definitely does it right. They food is authentic and tastes amazing. The tiramisu is excellent and prepared fresh at your table. I will be returning here often as a go to place for sure, and will bring others here. Piccola Cucina is also actually Sicilian, and there aren't many authentic Sicilian restaurants, which I really can recommend all of their food choices as a Sicilian! I'm getting hungry just recommending this place! Can't wait to come back soon.

We had such a delightful experience enjoying lunch at Piccola Cucina. The staff was friendly and attentive. It felt like home away from home. This is an authentic Italian treat. Each dish we had was absolutely divine. The Freshness of the ingredients can be tasted. We enjoyed the lasagna, the fusilloni, the spaghetti and meatballs, the cannoli and the tiramisu. All were absolutely amazing.

If you're thinking of going here GO! Hands down the BEST Italian food in NYC. I have traveled to SF , LA , LV and this is the best Italian food I've had. The costumer service is GREAT! It's a must try if you're in NYC. Everything about this place was great the atmosphere, drinks, food, service, and costumers. I would 100% go back. If you're far away from here it's worth the travel.

In a city full of the best Italian restaurants this nation has to offer, Piccola Cucina is a stand out. An Italian restaurant for Italians - the decor, service, food and wine all come together like a beautiful song you'd hear in a piazza. Truly a wonderful escape and can't recommend enough

Piccola Cucina was excellent! The food was delicious and fresh. We had the Greek salad, grilled calamari, the special of crab salad bao buns, cacio Pepe, and the the tiramisu prepared table side! The only reason I am not leaving 5 stars was because the cacio Pepe was just too al dente, because the noodle is thick, it was a bit hard. Service was prompt and the staff was very friendly and attentive.
Great ambiance, very family like, Erika is for sure trying to take care of everyone. Portion of food is good, lobster linguine is very tasty.

It was my boyfriend and I's first and last attempt going here. Didn't even get a chance to eat because the wait staff was enough to make my boyfriend and I leave. I had a reservation for 9:30pm, we got there around 9. We were told by the male and woman hostess at the front that it would be another 15-20 min wait which would have been fine since we got there early. Some time passes by and around 915/920 2 couples that came after us were seated before us and we weren't acknowledged at all. Funnily enough, looking back on several other reviews for this place - people have had the same issue. Bad hospitality all around. We ended up going to La Pecora Bianca in midtown which has incredible food, non pretentious staff, and great service. Take your service elsewhere

The food is amazing and service is top notch!! As a Yelper, I looked up the pics of the food before hand and thanks God I did because I wanted the Lobster linguini which was not on the menu. It was really good! The wait staff came frequently to check how we were doing and cleaned the table in between. They really go above and beyond to ensure you have a good time!

Incredible location and service of this chain located right by the 6 close to Central Park. Definitely recommend making reservations as it was crowded even with the rest of nyc being pretty quiet due to COVID. The menu is pretty diverse with excellent vegetarian options as well. The service is excellent with everyone super friendly! I ordered the cacio e Pepe which they mix in a cheese wheel in front of you and one of the foccacias which was also delicious. Prices are very reasonable for nyc and the upscale feel. Definitely recommend getting the tiramisu for dessert- they make it table side and the cream is delicious. While it's not very traditional it makes for a fun experience.

This was my first time dining here and we had a great experience. There is an expansive outdoor dining area in front of the restaurant. We started with the Burrata and it is one of the best I've had in the city. Highly recommend. For our mains we ordered the Green Tagliatelle and the Cacio E Pepe. Both of our meals were delicious. Cacio e Pepe is hands down one of my favorite dishes and this restaurant does an excellent job. Overall great service, food, and atmosphere. I would dine here again and highly recommend checking out this restaurant!

Wow!!! I am so impressed with this cute (and popular) Italian spot! The food was so fresh and delicious, I usually have leftovers but I actually finished my food this time. The staff are SO nice, they work so hard and were so kind and friendly the entire time. Some of the nicest restaurant staff I've ever seen actually. I looooved the pappardelle with fungi and the ragu with spinach noodles - so so good!! I know their tiramisu is really popular, but I would actually skip it and go for the green apple panna cotta instead. Portions are decently sized for the price but so delicious!! I will definitely be back!!! :-)

We had the best lunch here today - delicious food, excellent service, not fussy. Just what we were looking for on a Sunday afternoon. The carpaccio trio and penne pomodoro were delicious! Very generous portions and fair prices. We look forward to coming back!
Fully packed in a Monday and waited 20 minutes for a table!! Good service great food!!

I feel like there is mixed reviews about this place, but I really wanted to like it. We started out with the trio carpaccio (salmon, tuna, yellowtail) which was ok. I think what turned me off from the dish was that there was a frozen filleted fish underneath the pieces of fish. We also got the Greek salad and it was very good and fresh, but I wish there were chunks of cucumber in the salad rather than just slivers of cucumber. I got the paparadelle with porcini mushrooms, which was ok. The sauce was more creamy rather than a mushroom flavor and the pasta was a little too al dente. My husband got the cavatelli with a lamb ragu and we also didn't love this. The pasta was too al dente. We also tried my brother in laws green tagliatelle with wild boar ragu and this was the best dish. I highly recommend this dish and definitely get this if you come here.
From Primi to Gelato, I enjoyed everything at lunch. I will definitely visit again and try out every single menu.
No comment
Excellent Italian cuisine with a good wine list to boot. The branzino was top notch. Fresh and flavorful. Ossi buco ravioli also excellent. Reasonably priced. Good service.

I don't usually go out to a restaurant for pasta, but Piccola Cucina is IT. Came on a Friday night (6:30pm) with a friend without a reservation and was able to be seated outside as long as we finished within an hour. I was really impressed by the outdoor dining area; it was really cozy with heated lamps (did not feel cold even in high 40 temps), lots of cushion, and even European style fake windows. As for food, I ordered the green Tagliatelle with wildboar ragu and truffle, and my friend ordered the Paccheri with seafood. To start us off, we were given fresh bread with 3 spreads (tomato, hummus, and carrot). The bread was heavenly: crispy and soft. I enjoyed all the dips, especially the tomato one. I loved my dish -- it was so tasty, and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente. Plus, the portions are generous. Servers were constantly checking on us and were really hospitable and knowledgeable. I would definitely come again!

Great food and service. We had to wait a few minutes for our table and they gave us complimentary glass of wine and an absolutely delicious cannoli at the end of dinner. I felt like I was in Italy. Highly recommend.

I really wanted to love this Piccola Cucina Uptown. We have had several celebrations at their tiny location downtown and wanted to have a great experience with more comfortable settings. We ordered the Burrata con Pomodorini, ( it came with arugula instead of basil as listed on the menu and was great!) good balance, Insalada Piccola, ( was quite dry and lacked the punch of a salad) Porcini Mushroom pasta, (Very Salty) Wild Boar Ragu ( Excellent and perfect balance of sauce to pasta), Spaghetti al nero (Too Salty and uneven heavy sauce, the pasta was drowned out), Grilled Sardines ( slight funky extra large sardines over shredded cabage and citrus fruit) and the star of the meal was Tiramisu assembled at table side! The service was great! I invited guests who have eaten in fine dining a nd great street dining all over the world. I really wanted to impress them with Piccola Cucina. Only 1 hit pasta (Wild BoarRagu) and 1 Antipasti ( Burrata) and the tiramisu . We had an assortment of coffees, espresso, cappuccino, American coffee and all were good with the tiramisu. Why too much salt in the pastas? I see other reviewers have the same experience. One other challenge was the noise level. It was difficult to have conversation. There is a hostess who greets all the tables loudly and it seemed when she was greeting the tables with warmth and friendliness it lifts the volume. It was nice to see families, groups of adults, couples, and great loyal following. I really wish everyone at Piccola success. The staff was great!! Service wonderful. I would like to try more dishes on another day and see if I have the same experience.

Unfortunately I typically don't venture into Italian places as I'm gluten intolerant but I took my friend here to celebrate his belated birthday and I didn't regret it a bit. The best part is that I didn't have any bloating or discomfort after which is a sign of that the restaurant uses high quality flour. I had similar experiences while traveling through Tuscany in 2018. I ordered the calamari appetizer and Pappardelle ai funghi porcini for main. Everything was delicious. Flavorful and fresh. My friend loved his meal as well and at the end we shared dessert...tiramisu. Omg, when I say this was the best dessert I've ever had in 42 years on this planet I'm not exaggerating. I've had tiramisu in Florence, Rome and Sienna and this was beyond scrumptious. Don't hesitate to eat here. You'll love it!
No comment

Seems pretty authentic and good. Although I wish they have more vegan options. I know, its the cheese that makes all sauces so much more wonderful but would love to have that option. Other than that, it seems to be a great place with friends or romantic dinner.

I heard more Italian spoken by guests here then I heard in some restaurants in Italy. We went on a Friday night at 9:30 and it was still very busy with an energetic staff. There was a mix of couples, young groups, and families. I had the tagliatelle with wild boar ragu, very hearty and filling. My vegetarian wife enjoyed the Cacio de Pepe. We finished the evening with made at the table tiramisu. Piccola Cucina Uptown was our favorite meal and dining experience of our 4 night NYC visit, and possibly of all our previous trips.
Very delicious food here. Staffs are all super nice and friendly as well. I will be revisiting to try out other pastas that I didn't get to try. Make sure you make reservation in advance.

Came for the table-side tiramisu and ended up also ordering the lemon cheesecake. Both - delicious and hit my sweet tooth craving. They had a cheese wheel for select pastas. Will defs come again to try some of their pastas and apps.

Delish!! But make a reservation before you go. Nice and warm outdoor area too. Highly recommend!

Beautiful Restaurant, great menu and fantastic service. We had everything we needed at all times. We had the lasagna and the seafood pasta and it was mouthwatering. Great wine selection too. Seriously a great find.

Pappardelle Ai Funghi Porcini tastes like healthy food. Calamari is okay. My favorite was free breads and the sauces

Excellent fritto misto (fried seafood): enough to share for $23. So-so grilled veggies for $11: not enough eggplants and other veggies cut too thick. Good Pinot Grigio for $20/glass (41 points on Vivino). Authentic, Italian speaking serving staff and owners

Loved this Italian restaurant. Such a great place to get pasta for dinner. Got a reservation on a weekday night pretty easily but the place was packed. They checked our vaccination cards and got us into a table. They started us off with some bread and a side of these three toppings (some kind of hummus?, carrots, and this tomato-ey spicy sauce)! So gooood. Honestly kinda started getting full off the bread itself. I ordered the tagliatelle in wildboar ragu with truffle. SO delicious. The truffle flavors definitely came through in every bite but there was also a large piece of truffle on top. The meat was scruuumptiously cooked and the tagliatelle was perfectly al dente. Husband got fusilli with scampi and burrata. It actually came with a lot of seafood in it!! The fusilli was delicious and the sauce was soooo good with the burrata mixed it. For dessert, we got the tiramisu which is made tableside which was prettty cool! Overall the cream was amazing but the server didn't dip one of the the lady fingers in the espresso long enough so it turned out a bit crunchy. Other than that, would defs recommend and would love to go back to try the other items!

The servers and host were super accommodating. It would have saved us a lot of waiting time if we thought to make a reservation ahead of time, but the host was able to easily squeeze us in outside. Portion sizes make it easy for the table to share everything. Super yum!

Stop doing whatever you are or were thinking about doing for dinner. This is one of the most authentic coastal Mediterranean cuisines I've ever had. A great mix of southern Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish influences. Fantastico!

Throwing my hat in the ring to echo the sentiments of my fellow Yelpers!  This place is extraordinary!  I met my good friend here for dinner and we had a wonderful time.  The busboys and waiters were very nice and accommodating and the hostess was one of the sweetest people I've ever met.   To say we enjoyed our food would be an understatement.  We loved and happily devoured everything on our plates.  We started with the carpaccio which was great, refreshing and light.  For our entrees, my friend had the Cacio e Pepe, which was spaghetti with butter, lemon, black pepper and cheese.  I had the Pappardelle Funghi Porcini, which was wide noodled pasta with porcini mushrooms.  My friend thoroughly enjoyed her dish and said it was simple, light and delicious.  My pappardelle was an outstanding and hearty dish.  We finished by sharing tiramisu, which was the perfect ending to our wonderful meal.  Oh and they make the tiramisu table side.  Loved it!  Would I return?  What do you think?
Amazing service and great food! Would definitely come back again, I came here around 3 pm on a Tuesday.

Such a quaint spot that made me feel like I was transported to Italy. Food was extremely fresh, everything delicious. Finished the night with such a delicious Italian lemon cheesecake and espresso. Staff was very friendly and to the point in their communication.
No comment

I've been here a few times now and it never disappoints. The lasagna is rich and portioned so, the lamb ragu is hearty, and the desserts are good. I believe the tiramisu is a little more for show than for taste, but none the less was a satisfying way to end a meal. I prefer to end it with a single scoop of gelato and I steal one of my fiancés cannolis that she always orders. The cacio e pepe is also fun table side!

Delicious and authentic Italian food with attentive and great service. Offers indoors and outdoor dining options. Come hungry and try their wide variety of pastas. Just a note that the wine by the glass list is limited and highly marked up.

Love this place! They did such a great job with outdoor dining, very warm in the corner and so whimsically decorated. Staff is very friendly, the bread and dips are great, I always get the ossobuco ravioli, highly recommend. The tiramisu they make in front of u and also is great, the burrata is amazing and their montepulciano is the best!
