Such a great spot for fresh pasta and warm service! My friend and I have been wanting to try this place, they didn't disappoint. She got the cacio e pepe (served in a cheese wheel) and I got the fusilli with buratta, langoustine & arugula. All was superb. Both host and bartender were equally fantastic, the place has great ambiance (although a little tight). We will be back for sure.

Delicious dishes and good service for moderate prices. Came here for lunch and had a reservation so got right in. They have a nice outdoor seating set up and a menu so everyone can find something they like (dishes from basic to advanced). I'll be back!

Love this place. Comforting, delicious, high quality food in a beautifully decorated venue that is also fairly baby friendly (ie tolerates noise, doesn't feel rushed, provides high chairs, but no changing table in the bathroom). There were 2 other babies there when we went today on a Saturday for lunch. Made reservations an hour ahead of time. Restaurant was half full. Love the bread with the 3 dips - sundried tomato, puréed chickpeas, and a carrot dip. Ordered 2 appetizers, 2 pastas, and a tiramisu which was the perfect amount for 3 adults in terms of variety, but of course we had tons of pasta leftover. Ordered the meatballs and the octopus for appetizers - both excellent. The best part of the meatball dish were the incredibly tender mushrooms. Ordered the tagliatelle and pacchero with seafood. Both wonderful. Lastly, the tiramisu was fantastic. They make it in front of you, and the lady fingers are really drenched in coffee and rum, but since it's freshly made, it works, and I actually love the extra coffee and rum!

I went here with my boyfriend last week and we had an amazing time! Our waitress was great as well as the ambiance and of course the food. We started with the burrata appetizer and it was seriously the best and freshest burrata I've ever had and I am quite the expert. For our mains we got the Cacio e Pepe which is an absolute must at this restaurant it is prepared table side and it was sensational. I did knock off one star because I did not enjoy the seafood pasta at all the seafood was average and the pasta served with it was not warm and the sauce was wayyyyy too fishy the flavors were not balanced and there should have been more herby seasoning and citrus in the dish so that this wouldn't happen. I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant for the cacio e Pepe and the burrata though!!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: delicious! amazing lunch special where most pastas are $15.95 during weekdays. The portion was enough for 2-3 meals
No comment
Great crowd and vibes back like old NYC. The food was great. The branzino was my favorite and pannacotta was INCREDIBLE. Would go back just for dessert.
Ordered a bottle of  Pinot Grigio & their bruschetta appetizer. Will definitely come back!

Why isn't this place famous yet? Part of me wants to keep it a secret but then again, that'd be socially criminal. I don't normally do reviews but for this place I'll be doing tags on Instagram and tweeting it till it gets notice. How fun and authentic is it when you go to an Italian restaurant and the employees are Italian- the best. The warmest charm and welcoming people. I felt comfortable right away, and uplifted by their upbeat energy. So right away I was pleased but I had no idea I was about to fall in love. If you eat American Italian food- no more. You eat here and you can't go back to generic. I don't need to go to Italy now, I have this place. The food is rich in fresh flavor, I couldn't stop eating even though I was full. My mother and I ordered multiple dishes and we couldn't find a flaw. Do you know how rare that is? Couldn't rate anything lower than a 10/10. I'm actually bothered by how perfect everything was, because now I can't go anywhere else. Im from San Francisco on a work trip so I'm heartbroken over the fact that I have to return back to California. I know I have a 'little Italy' town to enjoy some good Italian food back at home but that's just it- "good" not mouth watering like Piccola Cucina. Now if someone eats here and isn't pleased, it's because they eat crap-no bs- they can't appreciate real fresh and clean food. I promise this. If you regularly eat real healthy food- you'll be impressed. If you're still reading this review- just call and book your reservation already. You're welcome and enjoy!

Really tasty pasta got the taglietelle verde pasta for lunch and it came with bread and cannolis. It was a generous portion and really yummy. Would recommend this place ! Super cozy inside and kind staff.
No comment
This was an amazing place. Decor was perfectly sweet. Italian food as fresh as can be and everyone was so very nice!!! We will be back!
No comment

This Sicilian Italian restaurant was rated one of the top 10 in NYC and I can see why. We were visit green from LA & I wanted to take my husband somewhere nice for his birthday. We started with a couple appetizers, Duetto di Bruschetta, Polpette di Carne, and Tartare di tonno, they brought us bread and oil, everything is so fresh! My husband ordered the rib eye steak and it was cooked perfectly, I had the Pacchero with shrimp and lobster which was delicious. I can't remember what my daughter ordered but she said it was the best Italian food she's ever had. It is the closest thing to the restaurants in Italy that I've found in the states. Half of the patrons there that night were speaking in Italian and the manager (probably the owner) was absolutely wonderful, personable, warm and friendly. There was an opera singer from Naples, Mossimo, who surprised us lucky restaurant goers with a couple of beautiful songs in Italian. They surprised him with a birthday serenade and we ordered lemon cheesecake, Tiramisu, and cannoli for dessert. The Tiramisu here is a must! They make it right in front of you. Next time I'm New York this is a must.
No comment

Had the pasta as takeout for dinner a couple of weeks ago. The pasta here was delicious. The food came piping hot despite the distance which we really appreciated. We got the cacio e pepe and the ravioli. Both were phenomenal dishes. The dishes were seasoned perfectly and pasta cooked el dente. The sauce for each dish was a perfect ratio to the pasta and we enjoyed every bite.
Great family restaurant, amazing pasta and  tiramisu. Cacio pepe, tagliatelle with porcini. Thank you guys!

I liked this joint. Very cozy, warm and great intro. They make ravioli and pasta at a station by the window, which i loved. I miss going out and dinning so this was definitely a nice little treat. Food was great. Vibe was great. Service was great! Manager gave us cannolis on the house which was a super cute treat! Will def b

Let me start by saying the wine is amazing and the little outdoor area is so cute. The service is great as well and all you have to do is tell them what kind of wine you like and they find the perfect wine for you. My favorite dish was the Cacio E Pepe, very cheesy, just how I like it. But let me tell you the bread was awesome , my kids couldn't stop eating it! Anyways 5/5, totally recommend.
Delicious food with good presentation, one of our favorite pasta and Italian food in NY.

Amazing Taste of Sicily meal!! So much food! Packaged very well for delivery thru DoorDash. My favorites were the eggplant Parmigian and arancino! Excellent option for eating in your hotel/ airbnb during the pandemic.
The food it's good. It's a little bit different compare to the restaurant at soho. The lobster pasta is ok.dessert is just so so. I feel the soho one is better.

Costly but delicious lunch at Piccola Cucina. The location has done a great job with their outdoor space by making it COVID-safe but still glamorous. In terms of food, similar to their other locations downtown, it does not disappoint. We started by ordering Arancini catanesi (2 for $12.95), Mozzarella in Carrozza ($11.95), Fritto misto ($18.95) and the Fugassa con prosciutto crudo di Parma ($21.95). Even though extremely expensive, the above appetizers were delicious. The arancini were filled with meat sauce and peas, the mozzarella in carrozza and the fritto misto were perfectly fried and tasty. Finally, the fugassa is a fairly large portion, very cheese and a nice treat. For main course we each ordered a pasta. 3 of us ordering the Spaghetti ai ricci di mare/sea urchin ($26.95) and one of ordering the Bucatini cacio e Pepe ($19.95). Both types of pasta were absolutely delicious. The cacio e pepe was super cheesy and the presentation was great since the pasta was mixed in an actual large cacio cheese wheel that was brought close to our table on a cart. The sea urchin pasta was also very fresh and you could taste the sea. Finally, even though extremely full at this point, we ordered 1 Cannolo Siciliano each, which was the perfect way to end our lunch. I will return to one of their locations for sure
No comment
No comment

Stumbled upon this spot by accident but I've been meaning to come here for years! What a place!! I had no reservation and was seated right away. The staff was very attentive. Even though I had a server part of the staff made sure I was being looked after. I saw different groups and they knew how to care for everyone. Birthday celebrations, hangouts, dates, quick bite etc. Can't say enough how great the service was. The waitress knew what to recommend and the food came out so fast! I ordered Tagliatelle Verdi Chinghiale not really knowing what to expect and it was great! Could've been because I was hungry . Definitely the place to come for different pasta options if you want to impress people with choosing such a cool place with great service or are in a rush and want to grab a quick bite.
No comment
Updating this reservation because the owner politely reached out 24 days after the fact....
Honestly the best Italian I've ever had! The lunch menu is 1/2 price which was also nice. I had the burratta salad & the seafood pasta  The staff were very friendly too.

Ordered takeout for me and my coworkers when we had to work late. One item was missing but they remedied the situation quickly and gave us free cannolis when we realized the mistake. I had the Lamb Ragu and it was impeccable- the artichoke is a lovely addition. The prosciutto portion we received was very generous and the rice balls were amazing. I will definitely order takeout from here again!
No comment

This spot was so cute and cozy. I went with my family and they all ready enjoyed it. There was a live singer who came in which was really cute. I got the salmon which was so delicious and flavorful. We also got some fried calamari and zucchini which was amazing. I would definitely go again!

Excellent all around! Dining during COVID has been a real bummer... but the ambiance, wait staff, presentation and food were all impeccable. My waiter kindly sat me (more than six feet away) in a corner of the outdoor seating area and offered me my own space heater which was very warm. He took the time to explain to me there was a lunch special I should take advantage of, and recommended plates for my next visit. The food was incredible. Ask for bread when you arrive: the roasted tomatoes in olive oil dip that they give is *chefs kiss*

Pretty much the closest thing to Italy as far as quality of food and ambiance. One of the best swordfish entrees I've ever had and the pasta a la norma was as good as it gets. Along with terrific service, this place it hitting on all cylinders. Can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.

Fabulous dinner.  Started off w/ 2 crudos, yellowtail & tuna.  So fresh, would have been happy to order again as entrees.  Had the squid ink pasta, nice chew to the cavatelli, again, so fresh.  Fantastic outdoor ambiance on this rainy day.  Superb service & reasonable prices.  Can't wait to go back!

Truly a great find! A warm and inviting restaurant where the staff treat you like family. While the food is certainly delicious and satisfying, it's not the most amazing Italian in the city but it is absolutely bang for your buck. The ambiance/warmth makes up for it and is an inexpensive and authentic meal for those looking for a bite on Park Ave.
I love this place. The food is amazing and the staff are very friendly. I suggest you to make a reservation here ahead of time because they are always busy.

Absolutely amazing and delicious food, so it would be hard to give anything less than a four star rating. Very small restaurant, so you're likely going to be sitting very close to your fellow dinners. Service was okay. We had an 8:30 PM reservation and arrived at 8:25 PM. We were not seated until 8:45 or so... The hostesses were very friendly and kind, however. Very popular place.

The hostess is straight from Italy and completely transports you there as she seats you at your table. They have adorable outdoor covered dining but it was raining so we opted for inside. We started with the burrata which came with arugula tomato and prosciutto. We were served bread as well with three different spreads to choose from. The cheese was fresh and delicious. I decided to go for the shrimp and lobster pasta and a pink sauce which was pretty good, I wish it was vodka sauce though. My friend got The pasta with porcini mushrooms. The food alone was quite hard to finish after eating the burrata so we took it home. The restaurant is famous for their tableside tiramisu. The worker named Jacobo really walked us through all the steps as he made it. I was nervous for the cookies to be too hard or the tiramisu to be warm, but it was nothing of the sort. We ate it pretty quickly, there's always room for dessert . I would come back just for the staff honestly. They made us feel so welcomed and were a pleasure to be around.
No comment

Wonderful restaurant! Amazing food, great staff! The manager, Nadine, approached each table as if they were family coming to her dinner table. This was my first visit and I can't wait to come back. Great place for date night, walk-in and business meal!

This is the best Italian and Sicilian restaurant I've tried in USA. I'm from Sicily and every dish they have at this restaurant tastes just like home. It's beyond authentic. I've been looking for authentic Arancinis everywhere and they always failed me, but in Piccola Cucina the Arancinis tastes just like the ones in Sicilia I'm shocked. And the pasta it's also another level of good. This has always been my favorite restaurant and I will always recommend it to my friends when they visit NYC.
Awesome food and great staff! Every dish is fantastic and the owner, manager, and waitress are all so friendly. Will be back for sure.

This spot is very good. Had a good amount of dishes here and they were all very good and perfectly cooked. I went during Covid and sat outside. The waiters were very helpful and nice. I very recommend trying it if you are in NYC.
No comment
squid ink pasta with calamari and caponata: absolutely delicious, in house and leftover the next day
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Wonderful experience from the food, ambience, and speed. The hostess had such a warm charisma and made the night spectacular.

The food here is awesome. Hands down some of the best Italian food ever. The porcini pappardelle was delicious with great tasting porcini. The Pacchero Ai Tre Crostacei was a flavor bomb in your mouth of fresh seafood. Definitely made my night!
No comment
What a beautiful spot, especially during COVID. Exceptional outdoor dining experience. The cheese bowl pasta dish was such a fun experience. Excellent service and atmosphere!

Terrible! Although the food is OK, the customer service is just terrible. The manager was awfully rude and unhelpful. I tried making a reservation for the Soho location, but the website automatically makes your reservation for the Uptown location. As if you couldn't get better Italian food in New York City... please...

This restaurant was supposed to open 3/9/2020 and was open for a week before shutting down for the pandemic. It recently reopened and is a true gem for the Upper East Side. We came here for my wife's birthday. The food was amazing - just like the SoHo branches. But the service was very memorable- Roxana was so helpful in getting out outdoor table set up properly to avoid too much direct sunlight on our party. She helped surprise my wife for the birthday. The service was very memorable. We had the Maccheroni al Ferretto Alla Norma, Pappardelle Funghi Porcini E Tartufo and Tagliatelle Verde Con Ragu-- all exquisite and yummy.  We would definitely highly recommend to all our friends. Even the bathroom was done right!!!

Got delivery from here after a long day of work. It was delicious!! ordered the cacio e pepe & it was almost as good as i had in Italy. it was delivered with complimentary warm bread and THE BEST baby cannolis i've ever had???? *chefs kiss*
No comment

We had the best experience today. We arrived around 2pm and right away we're greeted by the nicest hostess! She seated us quickly. The food was amazing. Probably the best I've had since Italy. Fresh pasta, amazing salads. Loved this!!
The lasagna tastes so good. Honestly will just be back for it. All the food is amazing and seevice is superb. Unfortunately it is a bit hot to have meal outdoor but overall a solid restaurant.

This place was amazing. Their pasta is delectable and I even got to practice my Italian. We ordered from them for pickup and they were super busy when we got there, but the food was ready before Yelp said it would be and it was great

Quite simply the best Italian experience I have ever had in my life. Chef Philip Guardione, the culinary wizard of Mt Elba, wove a tapestry of flavors and textures that I will never forget. We had the bruschetta layered with fresh Maine lobster and guacemole and four exquisite housemate pastas. Ravioli ossobucco, cavatelli nero with squid ink, cacio pepe made tableside, and tagliatelle. All were complex and positively perfect. For dessert, the best cannons this reviewer has tasted with perfect doppio and a mark nonino

I have been to Piccola a few times in person but this evening I decided to order through Uber Eats. I wasn't feeling well and could only have a modified pasta which I specified in the comments when ordering. Within a few minutes of placing my order, a wonderful woman from the restaurant called and asked me to explain exactly what I can eat and how she would help modify it. She was so caring and helpful. The order was received in no time at all - all packaged well, delicious and well .. perfect. Sometimes we don't say thank you enough not just for great food but amazing customer service. I highly recommend this restaurant - Buon appetito :)

We had an amazing birthday lunch in the outside seating area and were impressed. The food, the service...it was all incredible. You feel transported to Italy with every dish. A special thanks to Erika who helped make this special occasion memorable.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: CHÉVERE!! I entered a hungry Venezuelan boy and left with tears in my eyes. That meal was genuinely one of five moments this entire year I have felt happy. I am so grateful towards the chefs and the wonderful servers, specifically Maria who was such a warm and beautiful soul on this cold, cold day. We ordered three different dishes and shared them amongst us- I had an extremely difficult time deciding my favorite. Also, the bread and accompanying sauce was great. I can't wait to come back and enjoy the beautiful heated outdoor seating again. This is more than a restaurant in my eyes- it's a haven.

Great find!  I was looking for a Italian sit down lunch in neighborhood to take guests (2 from Italy). We had a very nice lunch and all were pleased.  There is also a lunch special of select items at $15 at lunch time. We had two pastas (boar ragú and allá norma), grilled calamari, tuna tartar. Everything was great and well done.  There are a few items in the menu that are not very Italian (for example. Addition of guacamole with grilled calamari and tuna tartar). I think the menu items would be better staying fully Italian, but the food was well done regardless. The bread was very good with olive oil and a crunch crust that was served with the meal (along with a sun dried tomato spread). Prices are medium to higher medium.  The desserts were a bit pricey at $12 each so we passed. Had espressos. The staff was all very friendly and professional. Many from Italy, which was nice for my guests to talk to waitstaff in Italian.  I will definitely return. It had a very steady flow of people and seems like a popular choice. They do also have outside dining for some tables in a street shed. Highly recommend.
Fantastic food but felt a little ignored by the staff. Most people were speaking Italian. Since I can't maybe that's why :/
Fantastic place . Very cozy . Grate atmosphere very good service people are so friendly . Lately one of my favorite place in uptown

This location just opened and I know they have a couple locations downtown but this one was phenomenal! Service was amazing ( our server always made sure our glasses were full!!) both of our dishes were delicious, I got the tagliatelle with boar ragù and truffle and my boyfriend got the seafood pasta and they were both super fresh and good. Very well priced for the amount of food you get :)

The dining experience was subpar at best. The food was cold when it came out and it came out late. I ordered the pacherro with seafood and everything was cold. The seafood was cold, pasta was uncooked and the sauce was mildly hot as best. Would never go again.

I had tried and enjoyed the downtown locations, so I was happy to find out that they have an Uptown restaurant too. The pasta and all ingredients tasted so fresh, very delicious! The sizes of the dishes were also good. The place was packed for dinner, but the service was still great, we had a very nice experience and will definitely keep coming back!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

The food really deserves 3 Michelin stars! Fresh, tasty, well balanced, every bite is a trip to Italy! And the presentation of the dishes tells you that in the kitchen works a very talented and knowledgeable team. Also the service is fast, polite, kind, warm and not pushy. If you want an authentic Italian restaurant with casual, chic and not pretentious vibe this is your place.
No comment

Delicious food, warm and inviting atmosphere, and lovely excellent service! My friend and I came here on a Friday evening for a 5:30 reservation. We were asked to be seated inside since it was fairly cold out and once we stepped inside, immediately the workers were greeting and welcoming us in. We got the meatballs with truffle and mushrooms for starters. The meatballs were soft and paired well with the mushroom sauce and truffle pieces. For the main course we got the Cacio E Pepe and Pacchero Ai Tre Crostacei. Both were absolutely delicious. The pasta was made piping hot, fresh, and cooked just a little after Al dente. The manager herself came up to every table to make sure everyone was enjoying themselves. Unfortunately they didn't have the tiramisu that day so we ordered a pannacota instead for dessert which was still a lovely way to end the dinner. I highly recommend trying this place out if you're around the area.

Can not recommend this place enough! The staff was so friendly and catered to our every need, our water glasses never went empty. We had a hard time deciding what to choose because everything sounded so delicious. I got the lasagna and my husband got the Pomodoro both were so yummy! Will definitely return.
No comment

MY FAVORITE PASTA restaurant! Top 5! I've tried all around the US! I usually get the first pasta on their menu it has no meat and has eggplant. I would pick this over Il pastaio From Beverly Hills California!
No comment

Went there for Mother's Day with kids. We ordered the lobster and seafood pasta, Cacío e Pepe and spaghetti with sea urchins. Each dish was mind blowing! Wife was blown away and wants to go back there soon. Bonus: nice decor of the enclosed seating area outside.

Great delivery- on time, good quality. Meatballs with mushrooms and truffles was delicious. Delivery person was also really really nice. Would definitely order again and would go to dine in person too.
My girlfriends and I went for our monthly dinner club and we feasted! Highly recommend!! The Involtini di pesce spada  was my favorite thing! Everything was amazing...Just wear loose clothes!!
Absolutely love love love their food!! Especially their pasta  they also make the tiramisu in front of you! The tiramisu was a bit soggy but everything else was great. Good staff too!
Avoid this place because you'll make a reservation and they won't care at all. The place is full of themselves and the staff is even worse. Just go to Lavo for the money.
Consistently amazing food, really nice outdoor seating and the best service ever. Continue the good work.
Love love this place. Pasta, hospitality and outdoor heated setup amazing. Actually forgot about covid for a night. Great for a special occasion or eve day treat. X

Love everything about this place. They have an excellent outdoor setup through Covid (including heat lamps), the service is on point, and the food is top notch. For dinner, the cacio e pepe is served table-side, as is the tiramisu, both are great. Might have been the best tiramisu I've have (Italy included)!
One of the first restaurants I went to after Covid and it was an amazing experience. They did a great job with the outdoor seating.

The food we ordered was all great. Pacchero Ai tre Crostacei, Fritto Misto, Cacio E Pepe and grilled veggies. My husband and I are definitely going back for next cravings for Italian food. The servers are all kind and polite. Grazie!!
This spot is amazing. Their food is so good, especially the Cacio e Pepe that's served in a cheese bowl. Love the waiters, give a Italian feel. And their chocolate lava cake is AHH-mazing.

I'm giving two stars because some of the workers were nice. My friend and I got two different pasta dishes and both of the noodles were not cooked properly, they had crunch to them. The appetizer also was disappointing-no seasoning. We got a drink and it costed more than our entree and appetizer.

the more i go to this place the less i want to come back... the workers became meaner and meaner over time and the food isn't anything AMAZING. just go to a place in soho or little italy instead of paying so much money on their mediocre pasta.
Nice outdoor space for lunch.  Good deals on lunch menu.  Greek salad and lasagna were excellent.
Delicious, fresh, and authentic Sicilian food, great wine, and impeccable hospitality. Can't recommend this place highly enough!

This restaurant deserves 5 stars easily. Not only is the food incredibly tasty, but the service is exceptional. The waitstaff is extremely friendly and authentic, and everyone treats you like they would their own family. We got the arancini and sea urchin ceviche for appetizers, and we got the current specials (lobster linguini and mussels spaghetti) for entrees- both were amazing!!!! Thank you Piccola Cucina for the incredible experience- I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and I will definitely be visiting again in the near future.

You must order the tagliatelle ragu and the tiramisu. Everyone that helped me was great and the food and wine are great huge portion delicious and fresh. A rare find in NYC with many overrated overpriced places. I would recommend maybe even charge a few dollars more for things and hire a couple more servers because I had to wait like 15+ minutes to order anything. Go when you have time it's worth it

Its been a while since I had such a good italian experience. This place is a gem, got there by mistake, we were two, ordered 4 appetizers and it was more than enough, wine was great too. I am gluten and sugar free and had lots of choices. Highly recommend, we will be back.
Beyond amazing! The food is excellent, like the one you would find in Italy and the service is top. Highly recommend it and will be returning again soon! Grazie mille

I am so upset to leave this review because I am a fan of the Soho location. We had a 2:15 reservation and I understand sometimes it can be a bit of a wait. A new manager would say - 5 min more. By 2:30 another 10 min... until finally I said we were leaving- the second we were leaving they magically had a table. RUDE, Not organized, and left such a bad taste - will NOT come back here.
The food was amazing, best Italian food I have had in America! Servers are very nice as well! Would recommend the lasagna

It's nice to be able to eat out again so I would have liked to give them a break. But honestly everywhere else has gone above and beyond with service and food and here they did not. Getting acknowledged took a very long time. Ordering drinks took a very long time. When we arrived there was only 4 other ppl seated. We received our pasta before our drinks. The pasta was barely warm. Cacio Pepe was chunky and crumbly in seconds. We had to ask another server for our drinks. There was maybe 5 or 6 staff and barely anyone there. I'm thinking wow inside must be really busy because we haven't seen our waitress at all. I went inside to use the bathroom and saw her just hanging out behind the bar and the inside had no people at all!! Wtf?? Paying $300 for this meal and awful service-ridiculous. Will never go back. On top of that this was not even good quality or authentic Italian.

I have been taking note of all the outdoor dining structures I've seen across the city, and I have to say that this restaurant has one of the most beautiful ones. Service was wonderful, the staff was very pleasant and the food was absolutely incredible. My bf and I each had a greta martini and both loved it. He said the lasagna he had was the best ever, and I loved my pasta with tomato sauce, eggplant and ricotta. They also put out bread with three dips which was really tasteful and tasty. The prices are also really fair! Highly recommend!!
Amazing seafood pasta, tiramisu is out of this world, made at the table fresh in front of you
Had octopus salad (special) and squid ink pasta. Both were really good and service was very good too!

I've twice ordered the lasagne with a side of spinaci and both times the food was excellent. Nuanced flavors, generous portions, delivered quickly and at a fair price. We're lucky to have gotten our own Piccola Cucina uptown!

Absolutely delicious! Three of us had a different pasta dish, which were all unique and flavorful. The wine list had some great options. For dessert, we ordered the tiramisu, which is prepared table-side! The service was the best part. Very attentive and genuine hospitality by Fabian, Giacomo, and Carlos. For a restaurant that opened just prior to covid, they're doing a great job! The ambiance is amazing as well. Really sets the scene. The quality for the price is well worth it and you won't go wrong here! I will definitely be back.

I had dinner at Piccola tonight and I am a repeat customer that tips well and is appreciative of the staff and servers.  Tonight it began to rain, and as New Yorkers that support NYC businesses, we sat at the table and tried to ignore the rain pouring down our backs.  The issue that leads me to write a review is that tables that were covered and protected from the rain became available.  The matre-d (the bald guy) decided to take tables that were walk in and keep us in the rain.  If these were reservations, then I would understand.  We were spending $200+on a dinner and drinks for 2  on a  random rainy night in the city in the summer during COVID  - probably he should have had a little more consideration and given us a dry table instead of crossing his fingers and waiting for  walk-ins.  This is a short-sighted way to treat regular customers.  I will not be back - even though the wait staff is so hardworking and kind.

I LOVE this place!!! My husband and I have been going to the Soho locations for years - no matter the time of day or season, it's always packed, and for good reason! We were so excited to see it would be opening on the UES, closer to where we live. The food is beyond delicious. My family is from Italy, and it's not as easy as it sounds to make a great pasta dish. There is so much heart and complexity that goes into their flavors. I'm pretty sure we have gotten every pasta dish, and each one is better than the last. It's rich and satisfying, but is never heavy. They did such an awesome job with the outdoor set up too. They decorated it in a way that's inviting and adorable, and it has an at home feel that makes it easy to relax (which is not easy these days). The staff is always so friendly, helpful, and kind -  and they could not be more careful and are taking every precaution to be safe. Can't wait to go back!!
Banana pudding and molten chocolate cake are the best I've ever had. Burger (wife loved), fries, bread, Brussels, crab cake (wife, duh) all excellent.

It was a great list to East Village when this neighborhood bistro closed in 2021; luckily it has found a new space and reopened in the former home of Root and Bone, a Southern style restaurant that still has a location in Florida. A blessing to this new space is additional seatings and a steakhouse menu with steak frites, clams casino, and of course a burger. Another surprise is the kitchen is headed by chef Justin Lee, who closed Fat Choy a vegan fast casual joint last year. Perhaps he could incorporate his smashes cucumbers into the burger or make a cacio e pepe rice roll? ;)

Went here with a group of people I unfortunately call my friends. The place is small with a short bar and and a dining area.  Well decorated warm atmosphere.  We ordered cocktails, which were excellent. I ordered the burger which was unbelievable. Probably a 9.5 out of 10. Buttery, juicy, perfectly cooked, with amazing caramelized onion flavor. I put it in the top three I've ever had (along with Au Cheval and Emmy Squared/Emily). Truly unreal flavor. Hopefully the word doesn't get out because this place could blow up. The fries on the side were unreal also.  I tried my friend Alex's steak which was one of the better steaks I've ever had. My friends Alex and George are pretty average but the food here was not! Service was great. Prices were fair. A great spot.

So excited to see Virginia's back in business! This is an amazing neighborhood spot with a burger that can hang with the greats, without the insane price tag. They are back with new appetizers and cocktails, and the vibes continue to be on point (always have a great playlist going). Highly recommend the carrot salad and hamachi to start, and you can't come and not get the burger and fries. The service here can't be beat - we've come to celebrate on many occasions (engagement, birthdays, anniversaries, NYE), and we were so grateful to be greeted by name with champagne when we came back last night! Reed and the team take great care of their regulars. Congrats on the reopening! Can't wait to come back again soon.

Wow... had solo lunch here and got the Gupo Gukbab and it was amazing. Everything I was craving. Soup was so flavorful, hearty, comforting. Banchan was perfectly seasoned. And it's so pretty and cozy inside. Service was super quick. Highly recommend. I'll be back :)

I came here for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon with a friend. We both ordered the gamja tang (spicy pork bone soup with potatoes, perilla leaves, green onions, hot peppers, and perilla seeds). The panchan here were pretty good quality with pajeon (pancake), rice cakes, fish cake, etc. You can also request white or purple rice with your soup order. Definitely get the purple rice since it has pumpkin and beans. Plus purple rice is healthy and white rice is just empty carbs. The soup was very flavorful and they do give you large pork bones. I would come back, this place has pretty authentic Korean comfort food and the ingredients were definitely high quality.

Stopped by for a quick lunch, got the galbi jjim and naengmyeon combo.  As usual with Korean restaurants it came with a ton of banchan.  Everything hit the spot.  I recommend bringing a friend to share the experience with because the short rib is just that good!

New Korean spot that is already becoming quite popular, and for good reason. Its probably been our favorite non-BBQ Korean meal in Manhattan. The food is excellent and hearty, priced fairly. The side dishes were elevated. The ambiance is quite nice as well. The drink menu is nicely curated with some Korean spirits and local craft beers. Good service. We will definitely be returning for another meal.
The food was great, we were there as a party of 3, the beef was very tasty combine with the soup. Also the fried rice after you finished the beef is an excellence option

Everything was so good! The ban Chan was delicious. The galbi Jim was so tender and flavorful and the cold noodles were a perfect combo. The bossam pork belly was very good as well. A great new addition to ktown!

I walked in on a Monday with a friend late afternoon ~2pm and we were the only customers. The service was great (probably cuz we were the only ones there) and I really enjoyed my Chueo Tang; I've never tasted mud fish nor perilla seed so I was intrigued and ordered it. Although the appearance of the soho is a bit muddy, it was delicious and flavorful (and fishy just as a fair warning for anyone thinking of ordering). I tried my friend's order of galbi + naengmyeon and it was good too!

New trendy spot that popped up in Ktown which was pretty solid - my favorite was actually the skate fish which is an appetizer. They're known for their short rib, which was good but I think overpriced for the amount that you get.
No comment

Came here for a weekend lunch with a friend, no wait and we were seated immediately. The sulantang was really refreshing and light. The spicy pork soup was also really delicious - the meat was sooo tender. The side dishes were amazing!! My favorite was the egg and the pancake. The only thing I didn't like was the appetizer - bossam, it was too salty and nothing special tbh. A little pricey but I think the ambience and the food was good.

I've been wanting to go here since I saw it opened and finally had a chance! We didn't have a res on a Wednesday night and had to wait around an hour for a table. I ordered the galbi jjim & mool naengmyeon combo - it's a litttle on the expensive side (price is better for lunch) but the serving sizes was pretty good and I definitely walked away pretty fool! The galbi jjim was super tender and flavorful - good level of sweetness. The mool naengmyeon was also super yummy and cold & refreshing. My friend got the gamja tang which was decent and was a large portion - I personally liked the galbi jjim better than this. You also get free banchan including some fish cakes and jeon and they were pretty yummy as well! This is a great addition to the ktown area, and I'd definitely go back! The food was good and the ambience is nice as well.
No comment

Such a cozy restaurant with the most delicious Korean comfort food! I came here on a rainy Saturday night with a friend, and we decided to be bold and try all dishes we've never had before: moon snail salad, spicy cold noodles, spicy beef broth. We were blown away by all three dishes. Each was hearty and filling, with unique aromas and flavors. I will say, specifically, that the sullontang was divine: the meat was so tender it was falling off the bone, and the broth so rich that I found myself taking extra sips even after I was full. Additionally, in keeping with traditional Korean cuisine culture, we were served numerous delectable banchan as well to supplement our taste buds; and the water served was also the traditional Korean barley tea which I love so much. The waitresses were all friendly, and Lisa, the manager, was so lovely and kind. I'll definitely be back to share this place with other friends!

Very authentic Korean restaurant in midtown manhattan. The side dishes were super yummy and the ambiance of the restaurant was warm and cozy. Service was amazing and everyone was super friendly. Have so many banchan refills!!! The meat was super tender and has a kick of warm spice but it wasn't super spicy. Came with rice too- we chose purple rice!!

A great new spot by ktown! This place is pretty busy so be sure to snag a reservation beforehand. My friend and I got seated right away. I would say the tables are a little small but maybe we ordered a lot of food lol we got the galbijjim and cold noodles combo as well as the gamjatang stew. The gamjatang stew is good but hard to eat at a restaurant around the pork bones. This place is on the pricier end for Korean food but the portion sizes were decent and everything was so tasty. It was PLENTY for 2 people and we had leftovers to take home.

Worth trying! We had the large galbijim between three people and there was a good portion of meat and it was flavorful! We added the cold noodle and the fried rice and I would recommend doing so too! Even during the winter months, the cold noodle is refreshing and delicious. We also liked the banchan and it comes with Korean pancakes and kimchi.

A new place just opened near ktown and the owner was also very nice.  This is authentic Korean food. All the dishes are exactly what you are craving for during a cold windy day. Every side dish was delicious and healthy, and my favorite was their seafood pancake. The main entries were huge portions and reasonably priced. Once you made the order, they all came out like after 5 mins. Super efficient! Will def come back to try their dinner menu.
No comment

Big space with authentic Korean dishes. Great for big group catch ups. I would say it was a bit overpriced for the portion sizes. Like we literally got 5 things and it was around $250 (with tip). Idk to me there are better places in terms of quality and value. But!!! everything came with SOOO many side dishes which was really really nice. There were some really delicious and surprising side dishes too like fish cake and Korean pancake. Servers were all very nice and attentive. Highly recommend getting the galbi and the galbi fried rice.
Definitely check out this newer Korean restaurant in ktown. The spicy pork bone soup is so good and perfect for the winter. Very cozy ambiance.

I've been to countless Korean restaurants in NYC and can say that Olle was certainly memorable! Very modern interior, we came here with a group of 6 without a reservation and were seated promptly. May need a reservation as the restaurant was busy but we were lucky! The banchan was some of my favorite, and all the food was incredibly flavorful. We cleaned up every plate, it was delicious!
I can't overstate what a great time I had. The food is top three experiences of my life. The service was excellent and the ambiance was perfect. Don't hesitate; just come.

Solid Korean spot located a few blocks away from the K-Town madness. Their sullungtang is the perfect dish for a cold winter's day - the broth is phenomenal by itself and comes served with plenty of scallions (my favorite) but can be seasoned to your liking with fresh salt and peppers, and they don't skimp on the beef! The banchan here is also the best set of banchan you can find in the city - kimchi, spicy pickled radish, scallion pancake (!!), marinated sliced onions and marinated hard boiled egg. Will definitely be coming back.
No comment

I was craving Galbi Jjim and gamjatang while in NYC and I found this gem! This is a new modern, luxurious looking Korean restaurant! I came here for lunch when they opened so there wasn't a wait. The staff was also friendly! We ordered the galbi + naengmyeon (mini ver. of the Galbi jjim if you just want to try it! It was so flavorful and tender! It had a more herbal essence to it than other Galbi Jjim I've had. The naengmyeon was refreshing and yummy!) and the gamjatang (I was surprised how big the portion was! I couldn't finish the whole thing! It was so tasty. I do think I've had better gamjatang at other places but this definitely satisfied my craving! Perfect for a cold day as well!) I definitely think the price is worth for the portions you get! I definitely recommend trying this place out!

Really busy and loud place in the center of Manhattan. We came here for a late lunch and were able to get seated within 10 minutes. They have two floors of seating, and we were seated on the first floor, but we'd definitely recommend asking to sit on the second floor as the music is a lot less loud and it's much less crowded. We ordered one of the most popular dish, Galbi Jjim (marinated short rib) and Mool Naengmyeon (Korean Cold noodles). You can get the Bibim Naengmyeon if you want, it is the spicy version of Naengmyeon. It comes with lots of different side dishes. Their kimchi is also very good!

I was recommended this place for their Gamjatang and it's pretty good. My favorite so far is the Mul-Naengmyeon though. I ordered this as part of the "Galbi + Naengmyeon" option on the menu but the galbi was disappointing. The meat seemed a bit dried out and hard to chew on. The Mul-Naengmyeon was 10/10 though. The broth was so good that I didn't have to add any vinegar, which people usually do to give it better flavor. Not sure whether the galbi is that bad for the main menu since it is one of their popular dishes. It was probably just bad for the mini dish so I know not to order that "Galbi + Naengmyeon" combo next time.

The decor in here is so beautiful and rustic. The plates and utensils were so pretty. Service and time of arrival of food was great- we had the galbi and spicy cold noodle along with soulongtong! I enjoy the flavors of galbi and the cold noodles.

Food was really good, one of the banchans was green onion pancake which no restaurant I've ever been to serves as banchan! We got both cold noodles and the flavor was refreshing and yummy, would be perfect in the summer when it's hot and humid. The bossam, I would skip on as it's nothing special. The sullongtang was just like any other place. The galbi jjim was really tender and had a lot of flavor, definitely recommend ordering the option to into fried rice after. The Won Mae Plum liqueur was absolutely delicious, I would skip on the Red Monkey Makgeolli as it had no flavor other than regular rice wine.

Their signature dish, the galbi Jim (braised short rib with pepper and mushroom) was delicious, but kind of overpriced for what it is. The dish is $70 for the small, which I'd say feeds 2, but you also want to order other things or at least get rice on the side to be full. I did love that they served bori cha (barley tea) instead of water! I might want to come back and try the soups, but with so many amazing Korean restaurants in the area, I'd say personally Olle is worth one visit, but there's no need to come back.

Lovely Korean dinner away from the bustle of Koreatown. Olle is a surprisingly quiet, intimate restaurant with great food to share. We got a bulgogi jongul, skate fish app, galbi jjim and an oyster soup to share. We also added on the small bibim naemyeon. It was more than plenty for 7 people. Everything was good and tasted very authentic and carefully made. The service was attentive and they have a really good, red colored makgeolli. The galbijjim is probably the must order dish here, and the bibim cold noodles that accompanied it was excellent as well. Try this place!
No comment
Really great dining experience! Highly recommend the galbijim and naengmyun. Side dishes were great too
GREAT food - amazing staff. Was an incredible meal and experience - loved it. If you are unsure of that to order just ask the staff - they were great at helping choose.

Randomly came here on a whim when Okdongsik next door was full.  Surprisingly, the food was fairly decent for NYC Korean food.  The ambience, vibe, and service was great.  They serve a somewhat deconstructed Bibimbap which was interesting as you get to remove items you may not like before you add them to the bowl rather than have to pick through them yourself.  The barchan and soup were great and refreshing.  Overall, a solid choice, I would return.

Our group (3 girls) went to Olle on Saturday night and got the Galbi Jjim and each of us ordered a small nengmyun. During the meal we decided to also add on the fried rice but was then told by our server that we couldn't add the fried rice because we had already ordered 2 noodle sides and are not allowed to order another (even though we had 3 noodle dishes?). This was confusing since nothing is written on their menu and our server hadn't mentioned this when we ordered. The service was slow and confusing, the portions were very small and while the flavors were good it wasn't worth it. They definitely need to train their servers better and provide more explanation on their menu. If you're in ktown, there are definitely better places to eat dinner.
completely authentic!!!!!   very good!  grest flavors! great service!  nice restaurant! ‼‼‼‼‼
Highly recommend the gamja tang and fermented skate fish, extremely comforting food with great portions.
Got the gamja tang and it was terrible - no salt, the meat tasted very overcooked and didn't have any flavor seeped in (not surprised because the soup itself was flavorless)

Loved my dinner experience at Olle. Their dinnerware was beautiful and the food was so great! This is not your typical Korean bbq spot, but their braised short rib is delicious! It has a little kick so if you're planning to go with little children, please note that braised short ribs can be spicy for the little ones. We ordered small gooksoo and nengmyun as well as the fried rice at the end. All very tasty! Can't wait to go back and try more dishes!
Great food service and ambiance. We also enjoyed the craft beers! Highly recommend this place. Stopped by on Christmas Day

Authentic Korean food has always been hard to find in Manhattan but Olle is a new oasis for anyone looking for a meal that makes you feel like you are eating your mom's food at home. Made with high-quality ingredients and prepared in a meticulous fashion without shortcuts, the food is excellent and this cozy yet elevated restaurant stands out among the sea of new Korean/Korean fusion spots which are good for a meal but rarely warrant a second visit. Will definitely be back here to try the rest of the menu.
Great food, cute dishes, and super kind and attentive service. Definitely seems like a great place for plenty of occasions!
갈비찜(galbi jjim) is very good. Clean and simple. Love the interior. Great customer services. I most definitely want to go back and try other stuff. Thank you :)
